description:
This place is nuts for happy hour! The patio is huge and fills up fast. There's one line for drinks and one for food, both of which go quickly.

Prices are reasonable, but most of the happy hour snacks are fried, FYI. 

Convenient location but get there early if you want seating for larger groups.
author: Dana B.

description:
This is about as good a taco as you're gonna find in SOMA. Period.

The chicken and steak are well seasoned and cooked. The ingredients are fresh. The portion sizes are more than ample (2 tacos will def fill you up). The prices are super reasonable (2 tacos only ran me a little over 7 bucks, not including tax + tip). Your taco platter comes with a nice side of refried/black beans topped with cheese. Service is quick, friendly, and efficient. Even during their lunch rush hour (where people are waiting in a long line out the door), I was able to order/pick up my food in under 10 minutes. That's thanks to the hard-working kitchen staff who are busting their butts to create dynamite fresh Mex food for the masses. 

FYI, unlike most taquerias and fast-casual restaurants, Uno Dos Tacos boasts a full liquor license. So if you're so inclined, margaritas, palomas, and tequila shots are available for purchase (the house margarita is just $8 and just as tasty as any you'd find at a high-end Mexican restaurant).

So long story short... if you're in the SOMA/FiDi area and need some quick, guilt-free Mexican food, run (don't walk) to Uno Dos Tacos. This place is legit.
author: Kevin B.

description:
All around deliciousness! Great tasting tacos at good prices with fast and friendly service, plenty of seating, AND good vibes?? This one is a keeper!!! 

Love the strawberry Fresca made with real strawberries, the steak asada tacos, and the guacamole and chips. Try them all!!
author: Rainie L.

description: I would give this place a solid 3.5 stars. My office is at the corner of 2nd and Market and Uno Dos is right down stairs on Stevenson and 2nd. Its always packed for lunch, happy hour, and dinner so I thought I would stop in to see what the hype was all about. I read on the website that their tortillas are handmade daily from fresh masa; winning! I opted for 3 tacos - carne, tinga, carnitas. Of the three I liked the tinga the most; the chicken was boiled well and had a good flavor to it although it was not spicy which is what tinga de pollo should be. The carnitas was too fatty and too wet for my liking. The carne was pink on the inside; not a bad thing just not my preference. I did enjoy the refried black beans, chips, and salsa a lot. I would like to stop in again and try the other meats.
author: John C.

description:
I've only ever come here for company sponsored events and these tacos do not disappoint! 

It can get crowded during after-work hours so grab the first table you see open. Their happy hour food menu is a bit lacking. Just get some guac + chips and tacos and don't bother with the rest of the menu. Their drinks are okay, a little inconsistent when they make them. Skip the sangria (it's so gross) and just get margaritas.

Chips + guac is a must. Their gauc is absolutely amazing and tastes freshly made. I've tried most of their tacos and there are some meats better than others. For an Americanized taco place I'm surprised they have lengua. It's pretty tasty! Lengua and fish are my go to meat options. All the tacos are packed with a decent amount of meat and comes with a side of beans! 

They have really fast service despite how crowded it gets. I never had to wait unreasonably long for my food to come out. The lines for alcohol can get pretty long though..

Really fun vibe and a good place to come after a long work day!
author: Kelly H.

description: This place is cool. Go right to order food, go left for the tequila bar which you can also order food from. I went during a weekday at lunch time so it was crowded as heck but the line moved really fast. The tacos were good, but my favorite was the salsa. I thought the guacamole was just alright. The picture is of a carnitas Taco and a carne Asada Taco. Everyone who worked there was really sweet and they had great service!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
What about tres?  Most likely you'll order tres, not uno or dos.  Chicken, pork and fish.  All tasty and seem fresh!

Don't forget the watermelon juice drink.  It's lightly sweeten and a great thirst quencher!

Great atmosphere, friendly staff, cool eats!
author: Jenny T.

description:
I loved this place. The prices were very very reasonable and I was super happy with the flavor. I wanted to try three tacos and it came with some salsa and beans, and all under 14 dollars. That is a steal in sf I think!

I tried the carne asada, beef tongue (lengua), and vegetarian. I think the flavor was awesome and the portions were decent. Both inside and outside encourages shared seating, which is nice to feel part of a bigger table! 

What to try: tacos! 

Water rating: 8/10
author: Amanda P.

description:
Great spot for happy hour / post work drinks and food in FiDi!

Came here with two of my coworkers after work on a Friday around 6 and was surprisingly able to find a seat. There's an outside patio area, but it was pretty full (and extremely loud). Luckily, there was some room at one of the long communal tables inside, so we snagged a spot.

You order at the counter and pick up your food at the counter when your buzzer goes off, so I recommend grabbing a seat first before if it's crowded. Their menu is very easy to understand, with a nice table to make it even easier. You can order either a taco, burrito, salad, or plate with one of the following fillings: carne asada, tinga, carnitas, lengua, fish, or vegetables. 

They also offer some great happy hour deals on food from 4 pm till close. For $5, you can order tostaditas, flautas, gorditas, quesadilla frita, or sope.

I opted for the classic carne asada burrito for $8, which comes with grilled flap meat, beans, and salsa fresca. Yes the ingredients are simple, but I prefer simple burritos so this was right up my alley. I just wish they added rice to their burritos, but I asked when ordering and was told this was something they don't do. I also ordered chips and guac ($7) for us to share.

I was pretty happy with my burrito, as they really crammed it full of meat. I guess when the main ingredients are meat and beans, you end up with large mouthfuls of both. The carne asada itself was delicious and had good flavor. The portion of chips and guacamole was huge and we ended up unable to finish it on top of our main orders.

My coworker also got us a pitcher of margarita which was delicious. It was a good balance between sweet and being too strong, which can be a hard line to walk sometimes.

Overall I really enjoyed my experience here and would definitely come back!
author: Dianna H.

description:
Got an asada taco, had some chips & guacamole, a Mexican IPA, and a margarita. 

Asada taco ($3.50): Great taco with quality meat! Had fresh onions and cilantro on top and very generous with the sauce. Loved it! 

Chips and guacamole: VERY QUALITY GUACAMOLE! Loved this so much because you can actually taste/see the chunks of guacamole. My coworker also asked for a side of cilantro and poured it in the dip, which made it 10x better. This portion was huge so it was definitely shareable with another person. 

Mexican IPA: Happy hour prices from 4-close was $4 draft beers. This IPA hit the spot for me. It everything I expected to be and better. 

I also tried the margarita because my coworker bought a pitcher and couldn't finish it on her own. I'd say the margarita was delicious as well! They also put salt and tajin( I think) in the rim of the cup. 

Overall a very quality place and I would like to try more dishes next time I come back!
author: Amy L.

description:
Every visit to San Fran I come here. The food here is amazing and it's consistent. Everything is reasonably priced. An open air patio w/ tons of tables. An indoor dining room w/ plenty of tables. 

From the tacos to the breakfast burrito to the fresh salsa, you can't make a wrong choice here. I leave w/ a happy belly every time. Everyone I've brought here has fallen in love w/ the food.
author: Kevin Z.

description:
Finally, a taco place that has it all! With beautiful decor, a causal atmosphere, and affordable prices, Uno Dos Tacos is my favorite taqueria in San Francisco. It's definitely a far cry from the taco trucks I'm used to, but with cervezas and a tequila bar, I can't really complain. Just last week, my friends and I shared a pitcher of Paloma. I love the casualness of this place!

I cannot believe there is finally a restaurant in Downtown SF that actually serves lengua tacos (and it's affordable too). But all the tacos are fantastic! Try the carnitas and fried fish tacos.

This eatery also has Taco Tuesday, which features two hard shell tacos.

I really need to try the breakfast burrito, which is only $3.25?! 

The only downside: they don't offer dessert! I really want to convince the owner to serve churros, buñelos, or flan. The food is so good that these would be such nice touches.
author: Joanna S.

description:
My friend and I ordered uno dos tres tacos and a salad. 

We selected a beef, fish, and pork taco (total for all three was $11.25). The beef and fish tacos were better than the pork one. The fish was crispy. The pork was a bit dry. The tacos came with a side of refried black beans and a slice of lime per taco.

The vegetarian salad ($8.25 + $0.50 for cheese) was pretty good. I didn't see any dressing, but it still had a slightly sour taste to it. I was surprised cheese was 50 cents more. The person at the cashier did not mention that cheese costed extra nor did I see it on the menu. She just asked if I wanted cheese. Nevertheless, the dish was not really expensive.

I will probably come back. The food came really quickly despite how packed the place was.
author: Kristina M.

description:
If you're looking for cheap eats and something satisfying in the Financial District, look no further than Uno Dos Tacos. 

Let me paint a picture for you: it's early in the morning, you need to head over to a work meeting in FiDi, you need a quality breakfast burrito. Uno Dos Tacos is easily one of the first places that comes to mind to fill that craving.

Here's what you need to know about UDT:
1. The price point is one of the best things about this place. A few dollars for a breakfast burrito? Happy hour specials? Count me in.
2. Speaking of happy hour, UDT creates a solid margarita and had a wide selection of items to fulfill your needs.
3. The chorizo breakfast burrito is a constant for me each time I'm home in the Bay Area for work. Especially with its close proximity to the businesses in the area and Bart.
4. I may or may not have gotten things to go en route to the airport.
5. Salsa game is strong.

Overall, if you need to grab some Mexican food in FiDi, Unos Dos Tacos should be one of your top considerations. It hits the spot if you can't get to the Mission.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
The good is the food. Pretty tasty, good portion size. I ordered off the happy hour menu, got $5 tostaditas. Pork was good and lots of toppings on it, tomatoes, lettuce, some spice. There was also a bit of black bean spread. All on these crunchy tortilla circles. You only get three tiny ones so it's great for a quick bite. I'd order it again.

The bad is the wait. Even though it's happy hour on a Thursday, I have no idea why there was only one cashier available at a time. The spot is in one of the busiest areas with a lot of seating space inside and outside in such an obviously busy area. Annoying to wait more than 10 minutes knowing an easy solution is to hire or schedule more people at those times. 

Food wasn't worth that kind of wait so maybe I'd go for breakfast or off lunch hours, sometime when it's not busy.

Cute, dimly lit, colorful space inside perfect for hanging with friends. The outside fenced little patio area is also a nice area for groups and dogs.
author: Liz B.

description: I've been here a handful of times after work on weekdays now and have only had positive experiences. Great service, affordable beers, and tasty food - what's not to love? It's a great happy hour spot and I love the outdoor seating area. Their happy hour bites are delicious too. I'll definitely be back.
author: Emma W.

description:
This place is great.  Affordable and delicious breakfast burritos.  The burritos and tacos are   

Wish this place was open on weekends!!
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Burritos are nothing but packed with Black beans,
Whatever happened to rice in them, sour cream and cheese? For the price I expected a phenomenal burrito, Meh, never again. I'm giving it 3 stars because of the patio and bartender Sandy.
author: Kryan O.

description:
Bringing this down to a 2.5 rounded up since the latest experience was not so great. This is my go to spot for taco salads and a chicharonnes taco.   The food has been consistently good, but Do Not go here on a taco Tuesday after work. Went to pick up dinner after taking orders from my fam and didn't realize it was a mad house here. While the line was decently sized I waited since I didn't want to find another place retake orders from the fam. No problems with ordering the food, but once my take out food was finally ready the issues popped up.  

First they forgot four tacos from my order. I repeat, not one, but four!  Luckily I noticed while I was grabbing utensils and didn't leave yet. Went back and it took awhile for the guy passing out food to understand that I was missing items from my order. Once he got it, there were no apologies or any sense of urgency to fill my order. Instead I waited quite a bit of time again. I understand that it's a taco Tuesday special and it's busy, but I'd appreciate some kind of acknowledgement.  With the waiting for the missing tacos, the rest of my food is likely now cold and unfortunately I didn't realize until I left that I'm also missing my sides of beans.

Also, the four tacos were all chicken. Once I got the items I noticed they all had different toppings. I confirmed if it was all chicken and they said yes. Hoping that's the case when I finally get home to eat.

Just got home.  What was supposed to be a chicken salad is now a steak salad and there is no dressing for any of the salads.  Very disappointing.

Update - business owner reaching out has my hopes up that this last experience was just a blip. I'll give them another try one day.
author: Joanne T.

description:
Normally, I'd get carnitas tacos or a burrito but cannot really go wrong. The breakfast burrito is just the right size for the morning without being heavy or overloading. The bar is to the left of the front door and opens at 10:30AM! If having their food to end the night/HH then it's fabulous. However, a better sign is when it's good as leftover the next day/once sober.

A large patio is nice for any venue and it's very welcoming here. So much so that it's almost always crowded (HH is from 4:30 until close, so plan accordingly), and if it's chilly they have patio blankets! Grab one inside the front door on the right. Speaking of, it is located steps from the Montgomery BART station and is easy to find.

Note their habanero salsa has a slow burn but so good, and it will add up after awhile if you can't handle spiciness.
author: Peter L.

description:
3.5 would be better. totally acceptable fast-serve mexican dishes. there are a few seats inside but lots of seating outside too. choices are typical, salad bowl, tacos, burritos, etc. with a choice of protein

good quality food and value. not a bad lunch choice in FiDi/SoMa. I've passed by after work and it's always super crowded so I assume there's a decent happy hour there too
author: Bob U.

description:
This ease at which you can get delicious and reasonably priced food on the go here, in SF, is dangerous. Now that I've been here once, I will definitely be back.

I stopped in post work out to grab a breakfast burrito on the way to work. The regular breakfast burritos looked fine, but I upgraded with added toppings of veggies and chorizos and was in heaven. The veggies were a great add and loved the fact that sautéed yellow zucchini was part of the mix.

The feel of the establishment itself was also very warm but open, and they have blankets you can borrow if you're dinning on their patio. Will definitely need to come back and snuggle outside with a drink in hand and more delicious samplings.
author: Amirissa M.

description:
There are a bunch of happy hour food and drink specials.  The food is tasty, but the portions are sort of small.  You might be better off just getting a full meal if you are hungry.  There are beer and wine and Margarita specials.  Check their website or call for updated pricing.

I bumped this up to 4 stars because seating is almost impossible inside for HH and they have a pile of blankets that you can use to bundle up when sitting outside.  Nice of them to plan ahead for patrons like that.

Happy hour runs all night too, so that is plus and helps bump them to 4 stars as well.

I dropped by for a breakfast burrito the other day since everyone raves about it.  It is good, but I wanted more things to be included inside.  I thought it was pretty small overall.  It was on the inexpensive side, but considering what you get, I didn't think it was a deal.

I would come back for hh at some point, but probably not for the breakfast burrito.
author: Ty C.

description:
I pass by this place all the time and it always seems to busy and fun. There's a large patio with lots of picnic style tables, perfect for large and small groups. Finally I got to check this place out with a few girl friends for dinner. It was happy hour time, but we didn't order things off the HH menu.

I was missing the SD tacos, so figured I would give them a try. Begrudgingly, I paid a little over $8 for pescado ($4.50) and carnitas ($3.50) tacos. You order at the counter and pick up your food when the buzzer goes off. Seating is first come first serve. 

The pescado taco was not that memorable, sadly, but I did enjoy the carnitas tacos with their amazing salsa verde. Their orange sauce was a bit too hot for me, so use sparingly. I also liked the black bean side and thought that was a nice touch.
author: Swan L.

description:
My co-worker and I wanted to go to happy hour after work and happened to walk past this place. It looked poppin' for a rainy day and it's super close to the Montgomery Bart station (which is a plus!). I initially wanted to order a whole pitcher of Sangria and had no doubts that we will be able to finish it, but my co-worker talked me out of it and said what if it's not good? I ended up ordering a glass of sangria for $5 and it was the WORST sangria I've ever had. It was completely trash and I didn't even finish it. I know there's generally a "no wasting alcohol" rule, but I honestly could not drink it. I was so glad we did not get the pitcher, or else it will be $20 down the drain. 

We also got the guac & chips for $7 and quesadilla for $5 which was pretty good. The consistency of the guac was pretty thick and creamy. No complaints on the quesadilla either. It came out hot & crispy. 

Since it was raining really hard, the inside area was super packed and we weren't able to find a seat. So we opted for the patio area. It was really nice to be able to sit outside during the rain and just catch-up and listen to rainfall. 

I think I would give it another shot. The food was good, maybe their non-happy hour drinks will be better?
author: Chi L.

description:
Burrito: 2 stars

Edible, but if you're looking for a good burrito just skip this place and go to any number of good Mexican joints in the city.

Bar: 4 stars

They had pisco and they bartender made a solid pisco sour. However I don't think they have too many options like good craft beers, good wines, etc. Good for affordable happy hour with reasonable cocktails and cheap beer.

Atmosphere: depends what you're looking for. On a warm day sitting outside is probably really nice if it's not too crowded. I came on a cold, crowded day so it wasn't great. Definitely super casual and pretty good for a casual happy hour with some friends or coworkers.
author: Cameron A.

description: Nice staff, good interior, pretty good value. Why so salty tho? Maybe there should be a separate to-go menu for people not staying for drinks, because that little to-go cup of soda didn't even get me through the first few bites. It could have just been the carnitas. All in all, seems good for after work (the "OMG TACOS ARE LYFE" crowd) or a quick bite.
author: Tanya B.

description: I went in all excited about this place bc of my coworker heard good things about them. I ordered the chorizo breakfast burritto and i was sooo disappointed. It wasn't fully cooked and it wasn't even mixed with the eggs and it was watery!! It was so gross, also my coworkers got the churros and they were sooo dry and cold!! It was like eating cardboard no taste and just dry!! I was soo disappointed, i will not be coming back there for breakfast burrito until they learn how to cook chorizo the right way!!
author: Sunshine O.

description: Great tacos! The outdoor seating is very comfortable and spacious. We reserved a seating area and the servers were super nice. They kept coming by to check on us and the food was fresh. They started us off with chips and guacamole and salsa. The chips were still warm when they arrived!
author: Rose C.

description:
This was a solid 2.5 star burrito. But I'm giving them 3 stars because it was fast.

I'm not sure I would look forward to going back, but who has time to drive to La Taqueria.
author: E C.

description: The one thing this place needs is heated lamps!!!! The food is great. The drinks are good. Especially the happy hour margaritas! The staff is okay but hey tacos rule over everything!
author: Dorothy M.

description:
For several years, I'd been attending a Toastmasters meeting down the street from Uno Dos Tacos, and it's taken too long for me to actual eat here. Finally, my friend and I went one evening, shortly after it had finished raining. 

We ordered salads, and mine had carne asada. Since it was a little chilly outside, all the indoor seating was packed. It wasn't wet, though, so we took our "buzzers" and found seats on the large outdoor patio. It was actually nice to be surrounded by fresh, cool air, after sitting inside for so long.

We got our bowls, which were fantastic. How has it taken me so long to eat here?! The only thing that would have made it better is a margarita. The salsa was good (spicy) and the food was plentiful. I love that it's so close to the BART/Muni station, guaranteeing that I'll come again!
author: Stefanie C.

description: The food was delicious and came out within 2 minutes! It was happy hour so they were a lot of people but the wait was very short plus the atmosphere was very nice. I got carnitas tacos.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Came here for the first time, company dinner treat courtesy of the head honcho bosses ;D holy crap I will definitely be coming back. The tacos and appetizers here are BOMB.COM. The carnitas taco was my indisputable fav - just melted in my mouth. Writing about it now is making me hungry. 

Not to mention, I could not get enough of their margarita! Had at least 4 refills and got myself straight buuuzzzed. 

+ indoor and outdoor seating
+ service was phenomenal 
+ fair prices
+ great place to bring friends! 
+ decor is so subtle and pleasant
+ close to muni and bart
+ they take reservations!

- good luck w parking...but whatever you shouldn't drive here anyways because you should be busy getting turntt
author: Connie L.

description:
I came here for lunch and got the carne asada burrito and added cheese. The burrito was juicy and the meat were nice chunks. I thought it was great but I will be back to evaluate the tacos. 

Keep it up!
author: Brian L.

description: This place is your run of the mill Mexican restaurant that uses fresh ingredients and has reasonable pricing. It's nothing mind blowing, but their burritos are consistently good and filling. Chips and guac are relatively expensive to the rest of the dishes offered, but nice to have to snack on while your food is being prepared.
author: Kedar V.

description:
A decent place for gringo-influenced Mexican most of the day, especially during their weekday happy hours where you can score some great deals amidst a roaring atmosphere. 

At happy hour, you can get small items like flautas and tacos for $5, and if the place is too crowded (very likely, both inside as well as on the outdoor patio), you can even get the happy hour deals to go. While you're waiting for your grub, grab some booze to sip too, because the waits can be quite long. 

Nevertheless, the service is fairly friendly and the food (and prices) hits the mark.
author: Vincent L.

description: I was quite surprised how extremely tasteful the tacos were. I was told that you probably wouldn't find good Mexican food in San Francisco and although this may not be the typical Mexican restaurant it certainly is one of the BEST that I've ever eaten asada tacos at. I think what really sets this restaurant up for success is the homemade corn tortillas. You could really put anything in them and it would taste amazing.  In San Francisco this is definitely one of the places that needs to be added to everyone's list of places to eat at in San Fran. Omg it's amazing.
author: Roxanne A.

description:
Super low key taco spot that gets pretty crowded after work! Everything was crazy cheap. I tried the chicken taco and the fish taco, and both were solid. Nothing to rave about. I will say the chips and guac were on point - guacamole was nice and creamy, and the chips were piping hot. Stop by for some margs and tacos, you won't be disappointed! 

Pros:
Food (tacos)
Guac 
Margs
Price

Cons:
Long lines after work, hard to find seating
author: Vyshak C.

description:
Had a great time with my friends.
Although the food for happy hour sucks and also I wish they had better happy hour bites 
The drinks were good but you can always ask the bar tender to adjust salt or sugar
author: Naby S.

description: I have walked by Uno Dos so many times, finally got the chance to check it out with a friend yesterday for Happy Hour. Everything is very reasonably priced and their HH runs from 4pm-close. I ordered a carne asada taco and carnitas taco, my friend got the flautas. Both were delicious. There are communal tables and bar seats inside, they also have a patio with some tables outside. Great place to stop by after work.
author: Elaine N.

description: My friend and I came here on Thurs evening and had dinner. It didn't take long for us to get a table. I ordered a carnitas plate with beans and tortillas. The pork was tender and there were plenty of them. It was the right level of saltiness and really fresh. I also ordered a margarita which tasted like the ones I've had in Mexico. Also super fresh and gave me the right level of "tipsy-ness." I highly recommend this place for a quick delicious Mexican fare. The place is also fun, alive and full of really cool people:
author: Hazel Q.

description: Finally came here for happy hour with a couple friends yesterday and it was pretty decent. The food had a somewhat Mexican fast food flavor, so it wasn't super enjoyable but good enough if you are looking for something to munch on with margaritas. I had a fish taco and a veggie taco, fish was fried well, veggies were alright and under seasoned. The guacamole was essentially fresh mashed avocado and that was probably my favorite part. Oh and we sat outside in the SF fog but stayed warm with blankets the restaurant provides! Overall fun vibe for happy hour but wouldn't recommend coming here just for the food.
author: Farrah N.

description: I would describe it as a upscale taqueria. Good option for happy hour ...friendly faces...sangria, taquitos and flautas were good...nice reggaeton music which always lifts the mood up...simple clean decor with inside and outside seating.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I am such a fan!!! My coworker knew of this place and brought me along for some authentic Mexican food on a cold, rainy Tuesday. The line was semi long but it seemed like people were generally in and out fast -- they just wanted to take their lunch break and then head back to the office. 

The guacamole and chips are AMAZING! The guac itself is expertly flavored and isn't too salty. The salsa is delicious! 

I also got the carne asada plate for $10. It is a bit pricey to me but well worth it for how filling and how flavorful everything is. I'm normally not a fan of black beans but I finished everything on my plate. 

There are tables in the center of the restaurant where people just collectively sit and enjoy their quick lunches. You'll probably make a few friends who are sitting next to you -- they'll pretty much hear your whole conversation and you, theirs. 

I'd be curious what Happy Hour is like here! There's a tequila bar on the other side that's seems like it's decked out with liquor. And the food itself is already amazing -- that I'm sure of!
author: Christine W.

description: Loved this place! It was walking distance from BART so really easy to get to. It's also walking distance from a bunch of other things like the embarcadero, other restaurants, and shops. The food and drinks were really good and affordable, definitely worth the price! I came during happy hour and it wasn't too busy. There's open seating inside and outside. Overall just a really nice restaurant and the perfect place to go with a group of friends :)
author: Danica F.

description:
I went for a mini vacation to SF and was craving some Mexican food. I yelped it ofcourse lol 
This place popped up. This place needs its own parking structure! That's beyond the point though! The place was popping! People everywhere vibing and eating. Great environment. When I walked inside, to the left they have the bar and to the right you have the food.  To start off they had the best guac I've ever had it was made just right with enough lime and salt! I eat a lot of guac in SoCal with all the Mexican restaurants here so don't @me! 
I got a carnitas plate which came with black beans, hand made tortillas and pico de Gallo. 
It was so goooooood! Carnitas was soft fully cooked and juicy drizzled with pico de Gallo nicely chopped freshly made. The black beans were soft and topped with shredded cheese to add more flavor. If you're in town come eat here! If you're a local come eat here!
author: Alex A.

description:
Great spot. Great drinks. Okay food. 

Went for Taco Tuesday with some friends. Great deals and drinks however I thought that the tacos were relatively normal. Good food and flavors but nothing that blew me away. 

If in the area I would totally come back.
author: Michael P.

description:
Great casual spot to grab some Mexican food in the area. 

Pros
- cheap
- yummy tacos, I tried steak, chicken, and carnitas. The carnitas was the weakest link because it was a bit dry
- strong margaritas 
- bartenders and waiter staff were chills 
- clean sitting areas

Cons-

- None really except they close early on weekdays. (9PM)
author: Viren G.

description: As a picky Texas taco consumer, this place is pretty good. Having al pastor would make this a higher score.
author: Trent W.

description:
Coming back from a Wednesday afternoon Giants game, we opted to have dinner in the city to avoid the thundering hordes returning on Bart. Meeting my son, he had just the place: Uno Dos Tacos, just a couple blocks from his Front Street office.

This place is a find, and it was jumping at 6 PM. It was a pleasant day, so we opted to sit outside, snagging one of the last tables. With the delivery of the chips we knew we were in good hands, because these chips were crisp and amazingly fresh. Everyone's order was great: my wife and I especially enjoyed our burrito and chicken enchilada respectively.

The bill came to $28 for three people - not many places in San Francisco can you get this kind of value - no wonder it was jammed!
author: David F.

description:
I walked by on a random Friday afternoon after work (today) and ran into the place all my co-workers mention Uno Dos Tacos more like Uno Dos de Todo! As a person of hispanic decent you bet I was going to REALLY rate this highly raved about downtown joint so here we go: 

Clever name, love it. Its not Rubios, Guadalajara Tacos, El Sombrero, what have you. The name is authentically clever and multi-culturally friendly. I begin with this because the food is not Americanized, it is REAL Casual Mexican food and you would expect something totally different if someone told you about the place. Uno Dos Tacos is Mexican Chic with a spacious front patio, metal and wood accents, bright color, dim lighting inside and an over all clean and pleasing to the eye presentation. Hands down five stars for first impressions. 

I showed during Happy Hour, four dollar draft beer and five dollar bar menu. Ten dollar good time before hitting BART. 

The menu for Happy Hour is simple, classic, and filling if you're wanting a small bite with your beer. Flautas, Gorditas, Quesadillas, Tacos..you know, basic, authentic and to the point. If you are vegan you will have to ask for your bar bites without sour cream and cheese and meat of course. I wish they would add something more vegetarian friendly but its not a big deal. 

I ordered the Mexican IPA tap with what I thought was gonna be a two gorditas but it was two sopes without cheese or sour cream and no meat. 

So here is what happened,

I couldn't see the menu because it was too far for my eye sight and I didn't have my glasses and so I asked Alicia (with the purple hair) what was on the Happy Hour menu that I could make vegan and she said Gorditas, corn flour round pockets you fill with pretty with anything but instead it was two Sopes, corn flour flat cakes usually with bean spread directly on and whatever you want on top of that. 

My food was ready in five minutes or less, the vegan sopes bar bite size and a Mexican IPA, I ordered some chips and salsa (pico de gallo) for the wait as well. On the first bite I knew the food was gonna be delicious! The chips are salted right and semi-fresh not home made thats for sure, home fried is what they they are and not paper thin chips that look like they are almost questionable to eat and the pico de gallo was perfectly seasoned with a great amount of lime! 

The sopes were also very good, the home made corn flour sopes were on hit! They had black beans and salsa that is also found in the front of the food bar for grabs, and a bit of cilantro on top. 

Over all this place is really good! The Mexican IPA is delicious I think its great they have a Mexican IPA to go with the vibe and theme of the place. 

If you are looking for an authentically hip Mexican joint look no further, the esthetic speaks for itself. It is between this place and TropiSueño so far!

PS: They have blankets if you get cold outside........no thanks but GREAT idea!
author: Karlos G.

description: Everything on there lunch menu is really good and tasteful. I recently went to try there Chorizo breakfast burrito and was very disappointed. They don't mix the chorizo and the eggs together which (normally that's how it's cooked at other Mexican restaurants). They just cook the chorizo by itself. Does not taste good at all. I ordered there churros and they were not good either. No flavor and dry.
author: Jenise V.

description: Tried the carne asada tacos here for lunch~ This place has a nice outdoor seating area.
author: Yennie L.

description:
Solid place to get your Happy Hour fix! My friends and I ended up stopping by before we headed to AT&T park for a game because why pay $12.5 for a drink when you can get coronas & modelos here for $5 a pop/margaritas for $8. It's also cheaper when you get a bucket so do it! 

The chicken quesadilla made me stuffed. It was filled with tons of chicken that was surprisingly not dry. I wish the quesadilla was crispier though since it felt like it was falling apart with every bite. I also enjoyed that they add salsa/quac on the side for dipping pleasure. The guac/chips were tasty and fresh, but the salsa wasn't anything special TBH. 

Overall, it's a solid place with indoor/outdoor seating to get your drank on.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
One of my go to spot for happy hour when I'm around the area.

Drinks are made perfectly, and the food are delish. Most of all, they are consistent with their service. Great spot for groups as well. Or come here for breakfast, the breakfast burrito won't disappoint. 

It gets busy around 6pm, so come a bit early if you can
author: Toni Rose M.

description: The line wont' lie! Despite looking busy all the time, the line moves super fast. Food is reasonably priced and big portioned. Super delicious and fresh tacos. Flavorful and satisfying. Friendly staff and super fast service. My friend and I were able to find a seat inside during busy lunch hours on a Friday. The mexican coke was very good and tasted better and purer than a diet coke. This place is a gem in the over-priced and grossly tasting food options in the area. Highly recommend and will definitely come back!
author: Dancing S.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday around 12:15pm. 

There was a line out the door when we got in it, but it went pretty quick (about 7 mins). Being a pescatarian, they had both fish and veggie options which was great! 

Food: I got 3 tacos, one fish taco and two vegetarian tacos. This was the perfect amount of food for me, but I was also really hungry. For the vegetarian tacos I thought it was weird how there is mushrooms and squash in them... not really typical Mexican food. They couldn't make them without it so I just got it and picked out the veggies I didn't want. 

The fish in the fish taco was perfectly cooked and tasted delicious! For sure try the different salsas offered because one of them that I tried was so good! 

Ambiance: This place is super hip, it has inside and outside seating and a lot of it. Very clean inside and comfortable. They have blankets you can borrow if your cold and want one, never seen that before anywhere else! 

Service: The line went very quick because they had 3 cashiers. After I ordered, my food was ready in about 10 minutes but my boyfriends took longer (possibly because he had meat tacos?).

Overall I am for sure coming back! Next time I'll just get bean, cheese, pico de gallo veggie tacos.
author: Hayley D.

description: I've been to a lot of different places and have tried different type of tacos. I have to say that this place keeps it as authentic as it can possibly be, tacos are absolutely delicious and of course can't forget the burritos which are just perfection. Aside from the food, this place does get pretty crazy busy as it's perfect for lunch and happy hour. I don't know many may disagree that this is one of the best places, but you have to give it a try and really know what you are comparing it to. I love this place and believe it's worth a try for those that haven't been here yet.
author: Roman L.

description:
Cool place for an after work "happy hour".  There's a line where you can get a variety of different kinds of tacos, burritos, or a quesadilla all for a reasonable price.  Reasonable?  Hey, cheap by SF standards!  You can get a beer there for $5; or walk across the "hall" and get a margarita for $8.  Chips and salsa are solid(and spicy).  The guacamole is spectacular!

Always packed at the 6:00 PM hour - when I've gone - tells you people like it.  Yet, I've generally been able to find a seat.  Half the seating is indoor; the other half outdoor.  

Rest rooms are clean.  Service is fast; even when long lines.
author: Dave C.

description: Great fast and tasty food for a quick lunch with some Seats. Loved it. I got the vegetables platter.
author: Emm C.

description: Not my favorite place to grab a taco in the city but can we talk about their margaritas? Love catching up with drinks at this place after work and sitting on the patio. They even have blankets to use if you get chilly!
author: Emily M.

description:
Really convenient place to stop by with coworkers either during lunch or happy hour. We've done both lol. There are several long tables inside and outside of the restaurant. During lunch, there's quite a line, but it goes by fast.

I've only ever tried the carnitas salad the flautas. The salad is pretty standard and the carnitas was moist. It's a good size for lunch. For happy hour, the flautas go for $5 as well as a few other selections. During happy hour, the bar on the left gets a longer line than the food line. So grab a beer or wine from the food line and maybe wait for the bar?
author: James N.

description:
If you're looking for a reasonable place for lunch in SOMA during the week, you can find a variety of options at Uno Dos Tacos.  You can get lunch for under $10 and you'll be filled or at least satisfied when you leave.  They have the usual menu items, but my faves are the carnitas and carne asada burritos.  

Looking for an affordable spot for Happy Hour?  You can come here and enjoy a variety of beverages.  As others have said, their guac is pretty good and what's not to like about guac and a beer?

They have plenty of outdoor seating, so when the weather is nice, this is a nice option to enjoy lunch.  If it's raining or cold, stay inside at one of their many tables too.  

My personal fave here are their breakfast burritos.  You get a choice of bacon, chorizo and veggie and each burrito is packed with eggs, onions, salsa, potatoes and your meat option.  They are the perfect size for breakfast and they'll fill you up.  The price is reasonable ($3.50 each), so you really can't go wrong.
author: Lon H.

description:
I came by for happy hour drinks and our server Sandy was SO AMAZING!! She got our order so quickly and served us margaritas in no time at all!! I've been to so many places in San franchise and this has some of the best service EVER! I can't speak for the rest of the servers, but if you're in Sandy's hands you're good. Drinks are good, won't make you regret your night but you'll be happily tipsy  
Tldr: if you're here for happy hour it's fast and worth your $$$
author: Kulmeher D.

description:
When it comes to having breakfast or lunch in SoMa, Uno Dos is always an option for me that I rarely turn down as long as I don't eat it back to back weeks. 

Love their Break Burrito. 
Grilled tortilla, eggs, cheese, potato, salsa fresca for $3.75 and add your choice of chorizo, bacon, or just veggies for an additional $.75 cents. 

My go-to during lunch would have to be their fish tacos. $4.50

Don't let the long line intimidate you from coming here, it moves quickly and somehow the cashiers still manages to give each other the attention they need. 

Way to go, Uno Dos!
author: Danny L.

description:
This is a convenient, cool taqueria that's super close to Montgomery bart. They offer a large indoor seating space and an outdoor patio - however, this place is crazy busy and loud after work so go early to get good seating. 

I wouldn't say that the food here is very authentic or that cheap (I believe it was $4.50 for a small taco), but it hits the spot when you're craving a decent taco, margarita, and some good guac. I tried the carne asada and fish taco, and I definitely recommend the fish taco. I also tried their breakfast burrito with chorizo ($3.75 + extra $0.75 for meat or veggies) which was not that great. It was a bit bland, even with the hot sauce that wasn't very spicy. Their salsas in general are not on the spicy/flavorful side, adding just a bit of a kick. They also don't have rice here which was a bit strange to me. 

They offer a wide selection of drinks, but unfortunately no horchata, which is one of my favorites :( We did order a few pitchers of margaritas, which were sadly smaller than we all had hoped for the price. 

This is a good place to hang out after work with coworkers and friends, but not somewhere I'd go by myself for a good meal.
author: Victoria L.

description:
What started as eager anticipation turned into an awful experience. First, waiting in line I was excited to see they had a special menu for "Chicharrones Tacos or Burritos" - we get to the front and the cashier tells us they don't actually have it in their store. Why advertise something you don't even have? Strike uno.

I ordered my food, sat and waited for my buzzer to ring to receive my food. 10 minutes passed, no ring. 20 minutes passed, still silent. And to my surprise customers who ordered after me are getting their food left and right. How mad would this make you? I decide to walk up and ask about my order. I have to break up a casual conversation between the worker ringing the buzzers and the chef as they clearly seemed to have nothing else to do. (So where was my food?) I say excuse me and show them my ticket. The chef decides to pass it down the line to another chef and says "Oh, I never saw this ticket." They banter back and forth ("No thats not my order." "No, you make it, I didn't have that ticket.") before one finally gives in to make the order. Mind you the person working the buzzers said no apologies nor explained why they decided to skip my order. The tacos finally get made and she hands it to me with a "Here you go." No apology, no smile, just attitude. I guess I was wrong to interrupt their conversation. Strike dos.

As I sit down and eat these dreaded tacos that I had to practically beg to be made, I notice how dripping wet they are from the carnitas. No one wants to eat a soaked tortilla that falls apart the moment you pick it up. The tacos turned into a bowl of soggy meat and limp pieces of tortilla. Strike three.

Misleading menu, inconsiderate staff, and undesirable food. 
Save yourself the disappointment and eat somewhere other than Uno Dos Tacos.
author: Victor H.

description: I work down the street so I'm here quite often. Their breakfast burrito bowl is the bomb and is pretty cheap for $5ish - I always skip the tortilla. In the summer they get super busy because of the patio/drinks/good food so try to come early but the line does go quickly. Their tacos are good and their guacamole is also great. I really wish they had fish tacos and better salsa as the salsa they offer for free isn't the best..
author: Mira B.

description: When I came here with a group of six on a Friday night around 6, before a Giants game, they were out of a lot of food options, like lengua and other cuts of meat. There was a fair amount of seating outside which was good for a big group like ours. The portions were huge but the food was just all right. A happening spot to meet for drinks though.
author: Christina G.

description:
UPDATE: After my bad experience, the manager Monica reached out to me promptly to look into the issue. I really appreciate the quick response and concern. She offered my next meal on the house so I returned - this time opting for the veggie tacos instead of the burrito. The food was amazing and meat-less as ordered. It feels good knowing they took my concern to heart and actually spoke with the staff to make sure the food is adequately prepared for us veg customers.

Raising my review to 4 stars bc the service was great, the food delicious, ambiance perfect for a happy hour.
author: Tamra N.

description:
3.5 Stars

Fast forward 3 years later and I still about the same despite trying their $5 HH menu 

I'll be honest, I can't recall what I got or which one was which but what I do remember was everything was very standard. The one stand out was the chicharron, super crispy yet had a meaty bite to it

Of all the establishments this restaurant group owns Uno Dos Tacos is probably my least favorite....Lolinda is #1 followed by Delarosa then Super Duper

Overall Thoughts

Not all of them can be winners, take that for what you will
author: Eddie W.

description:
TLDR: Best parts are the blankets and breakfast

best thing - the breakfast burritos! Those are legitimate. good price for a not bad at all breakfast burrito. Drizzle in the salsa that's the best part for sure.

Food - It's good but not great. There's better tacos in the area for sure. But theres versatility in the salad options and all.

Happy hour - legit bc it draws a nice crowd of working professionals on fridays. The margarita pitchers are cool and moderately strong. The blankets come in clutch and are stylish.
author: Samraaj B.

description: Save yourself some time and go somewhere else for tacos unless you want to wait 15 minutes for 4 tacos because they forgot or lost your ticket. No apologies whatsoever! Also this was my second time going there and no chicharrones, why advertise something you don't have?? At least put up a sign letting customers know you're out of it.
author: Sidney S.

description:
Not a lot of good Mexican options near market and 2nd street so I welcome the option here. They can do a lot to improve their burritos. The fact that cheese is extra is strange and their bottled hot sauce is not hot at all. There are also some bites where all I'm eating are beans. 

Great outdoor seating which is nice. Service is nice with the buzzers so I'm sure it helps with efficiency.
author: Young Y.

description: Came in with the thought the tacos would be just ok. Boy were we wrong. I ordered the carnitas burrito with lettuce. The burrito was stuffed with the delicious shredded meat. My husband ordered an array of things. He got carnitas, lengua, and Asad a tacos. We ate everything very quick because it was good. Hate to admit this but we finished our food and I got up to buy two more tacos. We were lucky when we walked in no line but not even 5 mins it got packed and for good reason. Service is fast and accurate. Even though there is a line it doesn't seem to be more than a ten minute wait. Also food is ready just as quick. Glad we made this our last stop in San Fransisco
author: Olivia M.

description: Good tacos a little pricey but not bad. This is more somewhere fidi bankers come to have lunch and network or have a beer tho personally I prefer to eat my tacos in a seedy dive in the mission where no one speaks English. I ordered a fish taco and a lengua tongue taco. Both were tasty and a good portion size. I liked the sauce that came with the battered fish taco and left it alone. The tongue had a shredded beef texture and was super juicy in a good way. I went ahead and threw a bunch of their hot sauce on it for an ample kick. Worth a stop if your downtown and want tacos but iv had better.
author: Sean G.

description:
I really wanted to like Uno Dos Tacos. 

The restaurant name is catchy, it's at a great location, and the interior is very festive and there's even outdoor seating! 

We got the 6 taco deal for about $20 and we ordered the carnita, asada and vegetarian. Everything was dry and the tortilla was soggy except for the solid edges that cut the sides of my mouth.

I came here twice for happy hour and the drinks are okay but I wouldn't come here again for their tacos. The meat was bland, the vegetarian taco was super soggy and if we didn't buy the 6/$20 deal, they were about $3+ each taco! Wasn't worth it. The meat was super duper dry.

If you're looking for a place that can hold a large party, make a reservation ahead of time. People start strolling in around 4 and the place gets packed and loud. I would definitely come back for drinks with friends but for the fellow taco lovers out there, this ain't taco heaven.
author: Linda K.

description:
The tacos here are pretty solid and they have good seating for group lunches/dinners. This isn't a small taqueria, but rather a dine-in restaurant and the taco prices reflect that. I'll definitely come back here sometime if I'm craving fish tacos.

What I liked:
* Tasty and fresh ingredients. Just really solid tacos in my opinion. Out of the tacos I tried, I liked the fish tacos the most. Tacos also come with salsa and refried black beans on the side.

What I disliked:
* A little pricey for tacos (compared to taquerias I've been to), but that's probably because it's more of a dine-in restaurant.
author: Michael M.

description: We ate here for dinner. I had steak tacos and he had a fish burrito. They were both pretty good, especially for the price. The tacos did come with a big pile of raw onions and cilantro mixed in, which was a little different that what I expected. But the food tasted good and was incredibly reasonable in price.
author: Kamden S.

description: As stated before great happy hour prices and fun atmosphere! The patio is huge and great on a nice day. The lunch crowd here is big so get here early if you're going for lunch.
author: Annette K.

description: Love coming here for lunch!! Their chicharones tacos won't disappoint. However, on popular days, they do sell out quick! There's always a lunch time crowd but staff taking orders are usually pretty fast. I've never had a problem looking for a seat. And staff is super attentive with bussing tables. Must try their guac- super addicting. And don't pass up their margaritas during happy hour. Probably one of my faves! Uno dos is also open early for breakfast. I've never tried their breakfast but I always see people stopping by when I'm on my way to work. Overall, i'm always recommending this place to friends.
author: Kristel S.

description: This is yet another touristy Mexican joint. When a restaurant cannot keep the basic ingredients of a cuisine in a dish, there are some people like me who are going to return disappointed. They do not have rice in any of their dishes and yes, rice is not available even as a side. That sounds like a good choice for people who are looking to skip rice but I still can't come to terms with having a burrito with say chicken and beans minus the rice.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
Not the best food. Gave it 3 tries and each time it was super salty. 

And they dont serve rice in your burrito at all. No option
author: Rhea-anne M.

description:
Way better food than from a Chipotle, but doesn't live up to even middle-of-the-road taquerias.  Given the SoMa/FiDi location, it is better than the scarce competition.  Plus the ambiance and drink specials help seal the deal when you want Mexican food but don't want to walk more than a few blocks from your office. 

Chicaronnes Taco: This taco far surpassed expectations and was the highlight of my meal.  It wasn't like the pork rind chicaronnes you get in a bag.  More like chunks of pork that happened to have very crispy fat and skin attached.  It reminded a bit of when places that fry carintas in a final step to make them nice and crispy.

Pescado Taco: This fish itself was nice, but the batter exterior wasn't crispy at all.  An inexpensive fish taco from Rubio's is far superior.  Speaking of, they could probably make their taco a little better by adding some crema.

Asada Taco: This was very meh.  The cubes of meat tasted like something out of Chipotle rather than a Taqueria in the Mission.  I'm not used to my carne asada being a neutral gray and would have preferred it to have a bit of diverse texture (from grilling the exterior to a nice well done).

Pineapple Agua Fresca: Pretty awesome agua fresca.  Lots of pineapple juice and pulp as opposed to those cheap places that cut corners and give you sugar water with a little taste of fruit.  Very refreshing.
author: Adam B.

description:
Tons of nice indoor and outdoor seating. It's a casual atmosphere and the service is friendly.

I got both the carne asada ($3.50) and fish tacos ($4.50). I liked the fish taco a little more. It won't be the best taco you've ever had but it's a good option for a meal in the financial district. I really liked the fried quesadilla ($5) that they have for happy hour.
author: Linda X.

description:
Uno Dos is one of my favorite places for happy hour! It's in the convenient location of being RIGHT next to Montgomery Bart station so easy for all friends to meet up and their food is great for sharing!

+ pitchers of margarita, sangria and more for less than $30! (each pitcher serves at least four cups w a few refilla)
+ 6 tacos for $19 HOLLLLA!!!!!! 
+ huge bowl of guacamole and chips for $5

their outdoor patio is so much fun (and they have blankets for cold days) and it's always so packed so the atmosphere is super fun. COME HERE FOR HEPPPPI HOUR, you'll have a blast!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Solid Mexican food option in the immediate area of SOMA/FIDI, and a go-to happy hour spot,

I'd like to update Uno Dos Tacos to a 4. The food is a solid 3-3.5, but overall rounded up to a 4 for the crackin' happy hour and their stellar service!  

SERVICE:
Cashiers are always patient and help answer any questions. Bartenders are friendly and make the drinks quickly and thoroughly. The workers are also always constantly cleaning and clearing empty dishes! 

Water & utensils are self-serve,

CATERING: I have gotten breakfast burrito catering for the office recently (which was a hit!) Super responsive. The order received was 100% correct, and was ready to pick up at the exact time I specified (and phew, I got to skip that early b-fast line rush!)

BREAKFAST: The breakfast burritos for $2.99 is a steal for the area and although it's on the 'smaller' end (just eggs, cheese, potatoes & choice of meat/veggie), I think it's the perfect portion size for breakfast! And you can't complain for the price.

HAPPY HOUR!
+ lasts til 9 PM!
+ outdoor patio! (wish the view was nicer, but it's koo)
+ BLANKETS PROVIDED BECAUSE IT GETS COLD SOMETIMES (no space heaters). TAKE A PIC WITH ONE ON FOR THE 'GRAM.
+ 6 tacos for $19 or $5 app specials!
+ $30 marg pitchers or a bucket of 6 beers for $25

There's' limited seating inside and it gets kinda loud, so I usually sit outside. There always seems to be seating for small groups even when it's at peak time (or at least recently - maybe not during summer!).

I dig the tacos. Fresh corn tortillas, nice corn flavor and the right amount of thickness. Not soggy. My favorite is the fish (fried cod), but the carnitas and tinga (chicken) are also very good. Very tender. Asada was kinda dry (maybe just my batch) but it was very flavorful and had a nice smokey flavor.
I wish it came with the option of more pico de gallo / fresh veggies, but maybe I can try asking next time.

Their other HH specials are always very fresh and well-made. Most of them involve their fresh corn masa / dough which is spectacular (I'm a big fan of corn...)

The guac is decent - it is very fresh and on the more creamy (vs chunky & thick) and lemony side. I prefer my guac chunky, but every place has their own style.

Margs: very well balanced! Not watered down and they also don't use any artificial sweeteners! They measure out their tequilas - so yay for consistency! A pitcher serves a good ~5-6 drinks. They ask if you want salt on the rim when they give you the cups when you order a pitcher. Big plus! It's the little details :)

My only notes for improvement are:
- They only have 2 salsas. I wish there was more variety and that it packed more flavor. I like my salsas with a lot of oomph.
- The salsa/pico de gallo that comes with the chips is kinda whatevs (tomatoes are  soft, and it's pretty watery at the bottom - I like my pico super crunchy and drained of water!)
author: Emily C.

description:
Around the corner from my office and always a good place to take vendors to enjoy Taco Tuesdays. 

Buckets of beer, tacos and all the trimmings makes this a must visit place in SF.
author: Marc M.

description: A perfect after work spot! Delish food with a fun crowd. And they're not being cheap with their alcohol either. They serious!
author: Gino P.

description: Walked past this place and saw the long que and thought I better try it out, since it seemed to be so popular! I was not disappointed, The service was very fast and friendly. I had the carnita salad and it was gorgeous, lived every bite. Very fresh and well balanced flavours. Loved it! I'll be back
author: Jessica J.

description:
I've come here twice. Once for dinner and once for breakfast. 

I was working late at the office and needed someplace to buy my dinner and bring it back to the office. Being in FiDi means that there aren't a lot of good places to eat, let alone places that are still open for dinner. I have always passed by Uno Dos Tacos on the way to the office, and thought I would get a bowl. I ended up ordering the Carne Asada Salad and chips and salsa. I was very surprised that this place was so busy. It was already way past happy hour. The line didn't move very quickly and the food also came out very slow. I probably waited about 20 minutes for my food to come out. The salad wasn't very memorable. I remember the proportion of meat to salad to beans ratio wasn't very good. There were too many beans. The chips and salsa were chips and salsa. Nothing made the amazing, but they weren't horrible either.

For breakfast, my coworker and I both ordered the bacon breakfast burrito ($4/each). The normal breakfast burrito $3.50, but when you add meat of some kind, they add 50 cents.  My coworker swears by these burritos and comes everyday to get one. I have to say, it is a great value! I was surprised about how cheap it was. Now I understand why there is a line, sometimes out of the door for breakfast. You get a decent sized burrito for cheap. The filling and taste was meh, but if you just need food, this is the place to get it. Don't expect your burrito to come out extra fast. They also have fresh squeezed orange juice, which tasted very good. 

Pro tip: If I've learned anything, if you don't plan on eating in the restaurant, order ahead and have your food waiting for you by the time you pick it up. You can use that time you would have waited to do more productive things.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Uno dos is always crowded, it's a great place to meet up with friends or hang out after work. The inside dining is small, the patio seating is much bigger, all community tables. Food is OVERPRICED & I wouldn't consider it "Mexican" food. There's a line for food & a different line for drinks, & you pick up your food. 

Tacos: 1/5
It's $3.50 for a tiny little taco, and the meat is below average. Tortillas are cold..... have you ever eaten a cold tortilla!? It's like eating cardboard. 

Burrito: 1/5
You pay $8 for a burrito. The burrito is LITERALLY the same size as the taco. It doesn't come with rice...... I like rice on my burrito. Not good. 

Margaritas: 2/5
The margaritas are good, not are to mess up. But SO EXPENSIVE. A pitcher (a large glass, don't picture a beer pitcher, picture a beer mug) is....$30!!!!! No no no..... too expensive. The pitcher gives you about 3 small cups (smaller than buying an individual margarita).

Chips & salsa: 3/5
It was the only decent thing & at a reasonable price! It was $2 for a cup of salsa & a basket of chips. 

2 stars: food is not good & drinks are good but, everything is overpriced.
author: Kathy T.

description: My wife and I stopped in here to grab lunch on a recent trip to San Francisco. Uno Dos was near a friend's office that we were meeting and because... tacos! We shared a few of their street tacos. All were delicious.
author: Jason W.

description:
Good and fast! 
The salsa here is hot and spicy. The chips are fresh and hot. I live the homemade tortillas. The salad left a bit to be desired but I really love everything else I have tried. Worth the money and the lunchtime wait. Lots of outdoor seating as week, so it's good for larger groups.  
Oh, and tequila!
author: Dangerous T.

description: Great place that gets pretty crowded around happy hour! Decided to divide and conquer the line with a friend who got us chips and guac, veggie tacos, and chicken tacos while I ventured to get us a margarita pitcher. Both the pitcher and meal were appropriately priced and satisfying- especially loved the veggie taco and beans. I'll definitely be back to try the breakfast burritos as everyone seems to rave about them!
author: Chandani D.

description:
It's rare to find a space that can fit a medium-sized company's happy hour without issue, but Unos Dos welcomed our hungry and thirsty group with welcome arms.

The setup is a bit odd we will admit; on the left you order the drinks, on the right you order the food. There is no immediate obvious reason for this from the get-go, since it requires two people to man two stations, but after the fact, we wonder why more places don't do the same.

Food is decent (tacos, chips, and quesadillas weren't bad, just nothing special), though the drinks and the vibes are definitely where it's at. Especially if you're a mezcal and tequila fan, you'll be dropping quite a few bucks on their exquisite cocktail menu. 

Pro tip: Happy hour is 4PM til close (hell yes). So come early, come thirsty! This place fills up.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Came here on a Friday for lunch.  This place is super crowded!  However, the line goes by fast and there's plenty of outdoor seating to catch up with friends.  

As for the food... I really wasn't that impressed.  I got the carnitas burrito (add cheese for 50 cents) and it did nothing for me except fill me up.  Upside was that it was pretty big and I ate the rest for dinner (strangely enough it tasted better as leftovers).  Price was pretty decent for the area since I paid less than $10.  Taste tested a bit of my friend's salad and it was also pretty unexciting.  

Overall, I wouldn't choose to come back here on my own, but I would tag along if my friends insisted on coming.  Heard that the happy hour/margaritas are good so I probably need to check that out.
author: Shannon L.

description: Burrito was good. Restaurant is nice. I know this is a popular place for happy hour so may return. I've seen large crowds on the patio.
author: Sergio C.

description: I've given Uno Dos Tacos a couple more tries and they deserve a star upgrade.   While I still hold to my conviction that they don't make the best breakfast burrito in the area, their offering is nonetheless perfectly adequate and service is fast and friendly.   They also serve some really tasty fresh squeezed OJ.   I'll probably still come here primarily for reasons of convenience (I work in the same building) but if I ever really am craving a mean breakfast burrito, I'll probably still venture elsewhere.
author: David O.

description:
A friend and I met here for lunch and we were really impressed. The food was absolutely delicious- I had the carne asada tacos, my friend ordered a chicken tinga burrito and we shared chips and guacamole- and they had a great selection of beer and tequila. The outdoor seating was lively and great after being stuck inside all day. Great location in FiDi and perfect happy hour spot. 

I definitely recommend Un Dos Tacos!
author: Eric H.

description:
I'm loving the outdoor seating area, where you can grab your tacos and sangrias/beer/both and lounge there (if the sunny weather is out and about)!

They provide indoor seating as well, but who wants to be indoors when the daylight permits a pleasant enjoyment for the outing.  That's a statement.

Their tacos are yummy.  I got their carne asada, which was tender on the meat.  Their fish taco with lime wedge squeezed onto it, is delightful!

This spot is great for kicking off the happy hours and lunch flows!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I went to Unos Dos Tacos on a Thursday for lunch (around 12:30pm) with my coworkers. The restaurant has a really great location - on the corner of a block in the middle of the Financial District, close to KPMG, Fidelity, and a few other big companies/buildings. There is both indoor and outdoor seating. There is a bar and seating on tables and long counters indoors, and several tables under umbrellas outdoors. Because it was cold and windy, the indoor seating was completely packed but the outdoor seating was not, so we sat outside. It's definitely a great place for an informal lunch meeting with a client or with coworkers!

There is a wide variety of options to choose from - the dishes are prepared as tacos, burritos, salads, or plates. I'm not too sure what the plate is (read through the other reviews), but the other three options are pretty straightforward. There are several choices of meat - chicken, beef, pork, and fish - and then a vegetarian option. I chose to go with two fish tacos and a side of chips which came with salsa and guacamole.

The fish tacos are definitely tasty, albeit expensive ($4.50 each). I thought it was odd that the fish was fried rather than grilled, but it added to the great taste. The tacos contained the fish, lettuce salad, and diced tomatoes (the same salsa that came with the chips), and came with a side of black beans topped with cheese. Two tacos were enough to satisfy me, but I probably should have ordered a third to fill me up completely.

Overall, I enjoyed the food and the vibe of Uno Dos Tacos! If it is cold outside, I would recommend you to sit inside if possible. If it is crowded inside, watch out for the pigeons flying around the outdoor seating! There was a woman who was literally bullied into moving tables because of a brave pigeon (LOL). I would also recommend you to try a variety of tacos instead of a single type - that is something I definitely want to do when I come back next time, and maybe go for a burrito rather than a taco. There are a few people who get salads, but it's not as common.

I give this restaurant 4 stars overall because while the food is great, it isn't completely mind-blowing. I was disappointed the fish tacos were fried rather than grilled, and that the food was expensive overall ($3+ for any taco). But I am definitely coming back for more!
author: Rahul R.

description:
If you love Mexican food and work any where near downtown San Francisco then you MUST try this place!  Probably the best salsa I've found in the area...from the mild tomatillo-based green sauce, to the more chile-based red sauce that packs a spicy punch along with delicious flavor.  Fair warning, I love spicy! In fact I carry a bottle of El Yucateco XXXTRA HOT Chile Habanero sauce around in my bag and put it on practically everything -- I would rate El Yucatero an 8 and the sauce from Uno Dos Tacos a 6 on a 1-10 spiciness scale, but spice level is subjective anyway right so just go try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed!

I was introduced to this place at a vendor presentation last week where Uno Dos Tacos was served for lunch. I had the Tinga burrito, which is juicy simmered shredded chicken.  Today I had the Asada burrito which boasts huge chunks of tender grilled flap meat, black beans and salsa fresca all wrapped in a flour tortilla. I also had lengua tacos -- lengua done right is my absolute favorite for tacos and Uno Dos Tacos definitely knows how to prepare lengua!  Thick cubes of succulent, melt-in-your-mouth, tender, braised beef tongue atop a super tasty house-made corn tortilla with the requisite onions and cilantro sprinkled on top.

I work only three short Metro stops away, but that's just far enough to keep me from turning this place into my second home LOL.  That said, I'm already planning my next visit :)
author: Damon C.

description: Great spot for margaritas and delicious tacos! Met some friends on a Friday night and there was no wait for a table. Shared chips and salsa, a few tacos and I ordered a salad with chicharrones. Everything was great and will definitely return!
author: Melissa H.

description: Had a good time here on a Thursday night! Very crowded so it was a little hard to find a table at first but we managed. The atmosphere was great but the food really wasn't awesome. I had the vegetarian burrito which just tasted pretty bland and was watery. And also this is technically a vegan burrito unless you add cheese, which I didn't. I don't think cheese would have made it any better to be honest. I also got the chips and salsa, and the salsa was like pico de gallo and not really salsa. The chips at least were great. And at least it was a pretty fun place to just chill for a few hours and talk.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Delicious and reasonably priced (wouldn't say cheap) tacos - I got the steak, chicken and carnitas, and will definitely be back for more.
author: Josh L.

description:
Their salsa is spicy and I love it. 

Their blankets are cozy and I also love it. 

Their lengua tacos are tasty. I enjoy the lengua. It was pretty tender. I like it. 

Margarita pitchers $30. They have a small HH food menu. Quesadilla and flautas are on there! This place can get crowded after work. Come a little earlier to grab a seat inside if it's freezing outside. Otherwise, be prepared to grab a ton of blankets. I don't know why they don't have heat lamps...
author: Dianna C.

description:
Went here for a coworker's birthday happy hour after work.

We ordered a few pitchers of margaritas and baskets of guac and chips to taste. Margaritas were well-mixed, with an appropriate amount of tequila. The guac was seasoned at a happy medium leaning towards less salty (just add salt if you need more flavor). 

A little overpriced for taqueria-esque food, but this is FiDi after all, and it's right on Market. Also, the happy hour specials (until 7p) are pretty good, especially the $5 sope (chicarron was fried with a good texture). The lengua taco was pretty good too - nice and savory, and the texture was just right in being cooked perfectly. 

While we sat indoors, the outside patio had quite a nice ambiance too. Also, amazing location right next to the Montgomery St BART. 

Can't wait to try their breakfast burrito if I'm ever in the area in the morning.
author: Toby L.

description: Came here again for tacos doing happy hour. Was super excited at how good the carnitas were! Also had a quesadilla and chips. After two delicious margaritas, finished all my food and realized this might be one of my new favorite places to grab a quick bite. Happy to come back!
author: Anthony S.

description:
The manager here is amazing. My friend forgot her $800+ camera here and the staff found it and kept is safe for her. They really went above and beyond. Such a lovely community here.

 My team comes here every Friday for happy hour. We can always hear each other talk, find seats and love the snacks.
author: Maude B.

description:
Hands down best carne asada street tacos in San Francisco... I've tried a number of the SF "staple" taco joints, at least 9 or 10 so far and this place still has them beat. 

Quick service and nice staff. They even have serapes to use if you are cold or sitting outside.

Good happy hour too!!!

I wish there was another one of these close to my house but that might be dangerous.... haha
author: Sam S.

description:
Needed an escape from home and my friend working downtown recommended Uno Dos Tacos. I was thrilled as I sadly haven't explored downtown for dinner options as I work in the East Bay and live in Glen Park/Excelsior, and even on weekends don't usually head to the Montgomery station.

Conveniently located around the corner from the station is a modern Mexican restaurant that kind of blends the quickness and simplicity of Chipotle but with more authentic options. As I wanted something on the healthier side considering my big meal the night before, I was thrilled by the large salad option with chicken. It was huge.

Also nice is the tequila bar located inside. This was getting plenty of attention as well.

On a nice spring or summer afternoon or night, this must be a packed place, especially on the patio.
author: Michael C.

description: Not too shabby.  Had a fish salad bowl here which was decent not great (hence the 3 stars). I like the set-up with the outdoor seating however .
author: Rod M.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to grab a bite. Whenever I'm in the area I make it a point to stop in. I've tried nearly every taco on the menu, and each variation is delicious. I especially loveee the chicharrones. Plus, they have stellar margaritas. I love that they make some spicy! The service is fast, friendly and helpful, PLUS they have outdoor seating. Total bonus. Highly recommended! Already planning my next visit :)
author: Lorenn K.

description:
So if you read my previous review, you will see that the owner, Luis F. replied to me.

I love that he takes his customer's recommendations into consideration. He said that he now includes cilantro onto his veggie tacos! I truly think it will brighten up the dish.

I came back with a couple of friends for dinner. I ordered the veggie plate this time and was happy at the portion size! Multiple warm fresh corn tortillas and plenty of beans and veggies!
When I picked up my food, I saw the Luis F., the manager, was expo-ing the line.

I decided to say hello and introduce myself. He instantly remembered who I was! We had a great conversation where he addressed my desire for cilantro on my tacos, as well as explained why they don't have a salsa bar. He actually designs a different sauce for each taco so he wants the flavors he created to stay true. Also, he doesn't want to risk cross-contamination between each sauce or have them sitting out. However, he did say that we are more than welcomed to request extra sauce if we'd like to try them out. He gave me another sauce to try that was spicy and delicious!

Luis checked up on my group and even let us try his enchiladas! These were seriously a game changer. The tortillas were so fresh and the sauce just warmed me up. He prepared it vegan so I can enjoy it! They are only available during dinner time, but they were so good I will just have to come back for more. 
After a few margaritas and as many chips & salsa we can shove down our bellies, we were incredibly stuffed! 

Amazing quality and fresh ingredients made for a delicious meal. Luis and his staff also showed incredible customer service from beginning to end. (A woman came out to help bus my plates). There really isn't anything more I can ask from a restaurant. 

Uno Dos Tacos earns their shiny 5th star. See you guys soon!
author: Lanie L.

description: Great place for a quick stop after work or even a start to an outing with friends great food , great tequila bar , even have blankets to keep warm if you decide to sit outside
author: Jenese B.

description: Loved this place! The tacoes were really good and the salsa just right. Good location in the heart of the financial district with outdoor sitting.
author: Laura k.

description: I went here after work on a Friday with a friend, and I was really happy we did. We heard about it from a friend so we went to go check it out. It's a really great spot to meet up, have a couple drinks, and grab a couple bites. It looked like it was busy, but the food and drinks came out pretty quickly and there was plenty of seating. The food was great and so were the margaritas. I would definitely go back again, especially on a nice day outside. It's right on Market street in the financial district so if you like people watching, eating, and drinking then it's perfect.
author: Ivan F.

description:
This place is a fast and easy taco fix! I come here for lunch sometimes with my co workers. Line gets pretty long during lunch hours, but has plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. They also provide blankets for outside seating, considerate :D
