As you'd expect. It could be a great place to fuel up before a Thursday night out with 4 beers on tap, a dozen in the bottle and a wine or three. 

I know this sounds harsh, and it is. But they have the potential to educate not pander to the Taco Bellness so many poor souls ask for. Kick it up my friends and I'll be back. Give it a shot if you're walking by. What else do you have to loose?

¡Salud!
author: Mark F.

description: Great tacos. Outside area chilly but hey have blankets! Service is pretty fast as well. I had chicken and pork soft tacos. Probably best to ask for some salsas on the side. Guac and chips are tasty too!
author: Arjan N.

description: Decided to try one of their breakfast burritos and ordered a Chorizo breakfast burrito, with no cheese and salsa on the side. What I got was not what I'm accustomed to getting when ordering Chorizo and eggs. After my first bite, all the eggs showed no signs of chorizo. I thought they forgot to add it, which bothered me since they charged me extra for it. When I got half way down, there it was! on one side of the tortilla with one chunk of a potato. I realize I wasn't ordering a gourmet burrito, but it looks as if someone threw the ingredients onto the tortilla, instead of cooking and mixing it all together the way it's suppose to be or at least all the times I've had it in Los Angeles. Disappointed ;(
author: Susan C.

description: My daughter took me to this place and I Loved it. We had margeritas which were served by a very friendly young lady and when the food came it was seriously yum!! It's not fancy but for quick, cheap, fresh fab mexican food it would be hard to beat.
author: Gillian H.

description:
Went searching for Mexican food while on vacation, drove to a few places and found their prices to be insane, like most of the city.

Came here and was pleasantly surprised, prices were great and the food was amazing. We had the carnitas burrito and a carne asada burrito. The carne asada here was perfect, I have tried a lot of carne asada at a lot of places and it is almost universally overcooked and rubbery but here it was delicious melt in your mouth. 

Would recommend to anyone in or going to SF.
author: Brian W.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos.  A wonderful find! I was hungry and had time to kill and stumbled upon this little gem. It has an urban vibe with the high ceilings and minimalist decor with nice salsa music playing. There have a large outdoor seating area that had large tables for groups and small tables, as well as  bar style seating area, it is a great place for people watching! I ordered a carne asada salad that was fantastic. They use chopped romaine lettuce, black beans, a house made salsa and a light dressing that complemented the salad as opposed to the overpowering ones that are often used. I also ordered a pineapple agua fresco that was great. They use pottery bowls and silverware which is a refreshing touch in a taqueria. They also serve beer, wine and sangria. My only complaint, I had to leave before happy hour!

Before I had time to post my review I returned the following day for Happy Hour! I ordered a sangria and it was great. They also offer beer and in the near future they will have a full liquor license so margaritas will be on the way.  I ordered chops and salsa for $1.95 and the pico de gallo is house made and they gave a generous amount. Definitely enough for two people. I decided to order a fish taco instead the the small plates they offer for Happy Hour and the fish was battered and served in a crispy corn tortilla, very nice.  Monday I will return to try the offered items.

When I mentioned Uno Dos to a friend who works around the corner, she also loved it and enjoyed the sarapes that are in a basked near the door to use when it is cold outside. I thought they were part of the decor, it is another reason to love the charm and thought that went into this gem. By the way, my phone phone was dead and I could not find an outlet. One of the employees directed me to a work station at the counter and plugged my phone in, that is customer service!
author: Kelly K.

description: Came here yesterday to meet up with a friend before the Giants baseball game and it was pretty packed! How could you not love a place that smells nothing like tacos? It was too packed I had no idea where to order so I decided to not to order anything at all. My friend did order a beer. We sat outside on their bar stool. Get there early if you want a good spot and make sure you have friends with you. It's a pretty good place to go to happy hour. Didn't stay here for long. Their ladies restroom was out of order or at least their toilet wasn't flushing. Hopefully, I'll come back here soon to try their tacos, but beer is beer and it was good.  I recommend those who love tacos and happy hour to come here.
author: Danika P.

description: During a temporary work assignment, I made sure to stop by Uno Dos Tacos for breakfast to fill up for the day. I really enjoyed the breakfast burrito for less than $4 and you can add vegetables, bacon or chorizo for an extra 50 cents. Their breakfast burrito with any of these additions is the perfect to-go meal and will more than sufficiently fill you up. I hope I get another assignment in the area soon as I would love to stop by again! It's a lively place with great music and friendly servers.
author: Maile N.

description:
Of course it not as authentic as the taqueria restaurants in the Mission but more Mexican than your local Chipotle. Its great place for a quick bite to eat. Their menu can seem a little pricey when considering their small serving size, but I guess it evens out since the don't stuff their burritos with rice. 

I had ordered their carnitas burrito. They were fairly quick in making it and the meat was marinated really well. Their hot sauce wasn't too spicy which I liked.

Maybe next time I'll take advantage of their happy hour menu.
author: Denzell S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. The decor is cool and they have a nice happy hour. But it was not a good choice for lunch. Somebody (accidentally?) blasted the volume button on the music and my ears are still ringing.

I waited twenty minutes before finding out that they lost/forgot my order. I had a carnitas burrito and while the flavors were good that thing was so watery! I practically had a bowl of soup left over when I was done. I'm not sure if that's how they normally are or if this was revenge for my complaining about the wait. If you're wearing work clothes, avoid this place. Maybe bring a bib.

I probably won't be back.
author: Kelly A.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place! i'm a sucker for a breakfast burrito so I put this on my map ASAP when we found out we were moving. For $4.08 you can get a breakfast burrito with eggs, potato, chorizo, and cheese that's filling and delish. Be sure to snag some salsa if you're getting it togo- that stuff is addicting.

So my co-worker buffawaed at this place because they don't have rice in their lunch burritios. But he's a hipster who lives in the mission. El Farolito this is not, but I have to say my carnitas lunch burrito hit the spot. Their food is clean, cheap, fast, and fresh, which pretty much checks all the boxes when scavenging for lunch in the Fidi. Again, get some chips and salsa! Even the guac is good- with fresh chunks of avo for me to gobble up. So while I can't RAVE about this place yet (um hello, happy hour margies in my future plsthx), I can recommend it!
author: Alyssa J.

description: Shout out to Uno Dos for being the real MVP of my work week. Its my go-to spot for happy hour because the beers are cheap and the tacos are bomb. I would say they are on the pricier side but this is SF. The pescado tacos are to die for.
author: Helen F.

description: An after work go to spot for Millennials. If your idea of a taco is a tortilia packed with dry meat and nothing else really then this place is for you. Admittedly they are cheap enough tacos but as far as being an authentic taco in any way they aren't.
author: Steven B.

description:
Just started working down the street, and I've been back a few times, primarily for the tacos/tortillas. Super fresh, really tasty. 

I've ordered the fish taco 3 times, each time it was really soggy. The taste is GREAT. Really flavorful, but there isn't a crisp in site. The fish is completely soggy from the sauce and pico de gallo. 

The guacamole is delicious. Really fresh, as evident by the avocado peel I found the first time. But that hasn't happened since. Today they forgot my chips and guac, and I didn't realize until I got back to the office, so I'm a little salty about that. 

Otherwise this place is a go-to lunch spot for me. It's quick (even with a long line) and cheap-ish (for the city).
author: Nikki G.

description:
Horrible. The tortilla had a smell of detergent, whereas the filling was so bland and uninteresting. Also, I could not possibly comprehend what the mashed black peas were for : so thick and bland, not good as a condiment, horrible with the chips, too. 
The chips are fine except for that excessive grease, but the salsa was really bad. Anyway, possibly the worst dining experience this summer. Strongly not recommended.
author: Zoey A.

description:
Come here for your breakfast!

Cheap $3.53 burritos
Big, tasty and lot's of protein. 

They come with flour tortilla, egg, cheese, pico and potato (I get mine no potato) 
Additional $.50 if you want chorizo.

They also serve: 
Churros $2 
Orange Juice small & large. The large was $3
Small Coffee
author: Britt S.

description: pitches of margaritas. chips n guac. patio. happy hour all night. what else do you need in life?
author: Christina L.

description: You can always judge a good mex joint by their lengua tacos & this place delivers on the goods. I've had a few other kinds which were pretty good but nothing compares to the tongue! I can't judge their margs yet since I've only had beer here. Fun atmosphere & decent prices, can get crowded so go before 12pm if you're getting lunch. Even with a line it does go fast and they buzz you to get your food quickly.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This review is solely on their happy hour cause, well, I've only been here for happy hour. (Not an alchy, I promise!)

Happy Hour is from 4-8pm
- $4 draft or bottled beers
- $6.50 margaritas
- $5 sangria
- $5 food items

Their tequila bar is the home to fifty different tequilas. Oh man, are they trying to make me dance on tables or wake up with last night's regrets?

Their beer selection is meh, but you have to get the margaritas! I'm a huge fan of their bartenders for two reasons: 1. they are sweet, friendly, and attentive and 2. they have a heavy hand. You know you're getting a bang for your buck with the margaritas here!

This restaurant is quite big (and they have outdoor seating), but it definitely fills up from all those FiDi and SOMA folks after 5pm. I'll be back to check out their tacos and other food items!
author: Christine S.

description:
Excellent spot for happy hr which runs from 4-8pm in FiDi. I came at 6 and finally managed to swoop a table at 6:30. 

Asada Tacos (3.50) - Comes with a side of beans. The tacos are a little pricey but they are good quality and filling.

Quesadilla de Comal (5) - This happy hr special comes with 2 quesadillas. They were pretty expensive considering it was literally just cheese quesadillas. I recommend them with the salsa verde but I prolly won't get these again.

Sangria (18) - My friend and I split a pitcher which was effective in getting us to feel some typa way. It comes out to 5.5 cups worth which is a great deal considering 1 cup is $5. Delicious!

Definitely will be back to check out the other happy hour options!
author: Lucy N.

description: Uno dos tacos has a pretty decent happy hour menu. That's when I went and it was super busy. Everything on the menu was between $5-$10. I ordered a quesadilla and they forgot to add meat. Tiny side of guac costs 2.50 and it's not fresh. Classic margaritas were only $7 and the bartender was awesome. My friends burrito looked pretty good and it was a sizable portion. She couldn't finish it. Kind of a fratmosphere... Not really into that loud impersonal environment but not bad for a quick bite after work.
author: Sarah P.

description: Great for lunch or happy hours. Friendly employees and great  service especially from Monica! Great pleace to have the best burritos ever!
author: Nancy A.

description:
$21 for 3 tacos and a burrito.

-pescado; won't order again because I don't like fried fish 
-carnitas; must order
-lengua; good but will try something else
-chicken burrito; didn't get to try it but my friend said it was really good

portions aren't large, but enough to fill you up and not leave hungry.  2-3 tacos per person is good sufficient.
author: Angelica C.

description:
I used to work in a Mexican restaurant before coming to SF, so I've been looking for a good Mexican place for a couple months. I ordered two chicken tacos at Uno Dos Tacos and they were fine, but not spectacular. The chicken was well marinated and juicy, but the rest of the ingredients weren't great--the guacamole was too salty and limey, the salsa wasn't that great either. 

However, the prices were not bad, everyone who worked there was super nice and the decor and ambiance inside is so cute! I really like tequila so I definitely want to come back for the happy hour or to just get a drink some night.
author: Megan D.

description: I love the casual ambience, large space and central location. Ideal for post work drinks if you can find a place to sit. I give it 4 star not for the quality f margaritas, which can be improved by adding more tequeila, but for the overall convenience of a mission style restaurant but in the heart of the city
author: Vin M.

description: Being near FiDi, Uno Dos makes for an easy Taco Tuesday choice. The menu is limited, which is perfect for busy office workers and a major reason why my coworkers like coming here for group meets. My first impression of this place was a set of mediocre and sorta wet veggie tacos, so I decided to try my luck with a burrito this time. My order was made wrong, which is forgivable. What is not forgivable is the rushed, very loosely wrapped, pile of sog that I received when I returned. There was black bean water all over the outside of the wrap that spilled on my clothes as I attempted to eat it. After a few bites, I tossed that ish. Don't be fooled, the meatless "options" here are a total afterthought on the menu for show. You'd honestly be better off at Chipotle down the street.
author: Jessica R.

description: Chipolte is SO much better. Over priced and another trendy restaurant that SF offerers. I would go else wear for sure. TOO crowded for lunch - WAY to crowded for basic food.
author: Michael O.

description: Loved the outdoor seating and overall setting of this cute restaurant. I also loved how they offered blankets for those sitting outside. I was visiting my friends in the bay and they brought me here for dinner before heading out for the night and overall it was good! Definitely going back when I'm visiting sf again.
author: Shareen D.

description: Solid food. Our team went there, and Unos Dos Tacos was excellent at delivering all of the food very quickly.
author: Wyatt S.

description:
10/12/17 - Update

When I have a craving for a breakfast burrito, I keep coming back for the burrito with veggies; and, I have taken several people here to try it.  I still think it goes best with the salsa verde.

I honestly think it's a 5 Star breakfast burrito for me.  So, I'm raising my overall review from 3 Stars to 4.
_____________________________
For me, this place is a recent find.

From time to time, I have a craving for a breakfast burrito.  They have a small size basic breakfast burrito with Eggs, Cheese, Potatoes, and Salsa Fresca for $3.50.  I get vegetables added for $0.50 more.  While Burritos are not authentic Mexican food, the combination of ingredients, flavors and the size is just about perfect for a breakfast meal.  Any larger, and I might have to share, or risk falling asleep.

Unfortunately, I always have to make a special request for a small container of their nice salsa verde.

I just don't understand why they always seem to have only have one type of salsa pre-packaged and ready to hand out (it's OK, but not my favorite).  They have other salsas accessible to the cooks; but, if you ask for one of them, the cooks actually have to stop what they are doing to serve you some.  Personally, I think they should either have a do it yourself salsa bar, have more types of the salsas pre-packaged and ready to select, or have the sever at the counter ladle and serve it.

For lunch, I haven't visited much.  I liked the Battered Cod Fish Taco, and the Carnitas taco was OK.

As I get a chance to try more items, I'll consider changing my overall rating.  For me, a 3 star rating is an A-OK review; especially for a Mexican Restaurant.  So, I definitely plan to continue to eat here.
author: Roy C.

description:
This was my first experience with fresh masa shells and my first restaurant on my first time in San Francisco. So this was a literal religious experience. But I am not sure if I am better for it.

Waiting to meet up with a buddy for dinner, I was looking for a place to sit, drink a beer, and lay down my large bags. Louis' was too packed. FYI, that place doesn't look like a dive bar to me. They should head to Howlers in Pittsburgh or The Nick in Birmingham to see what real dive bars look like. But I will check it later. It looks cool regardless of the miscategorization.

So i kept going. Walking down the alley, I found Uno Dos Tacos. And there was outside seats open so I went in. "Just a beer," I said to myself. "Just a beer. I will be eating at Tropisueno in an hour and a half." But my mind quickly changed when I noticed they had beef tongue tacos. "OK.  Just a beer and a couple tacos," I recalibrated.

Explosion. "What the..." As a man dedicated to the soft corn flour taco, I could never understand when people said corn shells are better. But my reality cracked in that first bite. Fresh masa! One frigging bite and I knew I just destroyed myself. How will I enjoy Taco Tuesday in Midtown Atlanta?

Listen all east coasters. Stay away from California Mexican food. Don't touch the tacos. Don't touch the mole sauce. Keep living in your ignorant blissful lie that you know what real Mexican food tastes like. Don't do to yourself what I have done to myself.

Alright now. Where to next? Dim sum?
author: Biff W.

description:
Such good tacos here, oh my goodness! I've been getting two tacos de carnitas every time I come and I have yet to be disappointed. Definitely go for chips and guacamole, it's worth every penny.

Also check them out for breakfast, they have delicious breakfast burritos that I wash down with their freshly squeezed OJ!
author: Sergio G.

description: Love this place!! Great tacos. They got a good all different kinds of meat even cod for fish tacos!!  About $3.75 each and comes with a side of beans. Highly recommend the guac. They got a bar and an outside patio. Awesome spot in the FiDi
author: Glo R.

description:
Outdoor seating was great, however whenever I come here its cold AF because its San Francisco and lets be real its gonna be chilly no matter what.

If overpriced drinks and mexican food is your thing then great you will like this place. Conveniently located down the street from At&t Park and near the montgomery bart station we sometimes come here before a game. 

Note: the happy hour does not apply to the drinks, only the food. #lame

So if you want a $9 sangria that tastes like juice then you got yourself a deal. The margarita pitcher was $28.

The best thing about this place was the fresh guacamole. So all in all I would recommend this place for happy hour appetizers and get drinks somewhere else.
author: Sara S.

description: I came here last week while traveling on business and was really satisfied with what I received for lunch.  I had the steak salad with avocado and the portion was very generous.  My colleague and I shared a side of chips/guac and it was good just a bit heavy on the lime.  Overall a solid lunch spot!
author: Rachel S.

description:
This is mainly for the breakfast menu. I did not give this place a 1 star rating because their breakfast burritos are pretty tasty. And unlike the other places in FiDi on a weekday, they don't microwave their eggs (.. what is that about FiDi...). Also, the salsa is actually flavorful and spicy, it doesn't just burn your mouth. Let's face it, that's quite the accomplishment. 

No 4 or 5 stars because every. Single. Time. that I've come here for breakfast, they've gotten my order wrong. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. 

At least they're consistent. I've started calling their breakfast burritos Surprise Forrest Gump burritos. You never know what you're gonna get.
author: Jessie D.

description:
Food is good, but the service was poor. Bartender returned change, extracting a tip that was greater than 15% (I gave him a $20, and he returned $4, when the price was $14.50. 

I'm upgrading my review to 3 stars as my concern was addressed. I did enjoy my experience overall. There aren't many places in the immediate area where one can sit outside in the sun and enjoy lunch with or without a cocktail.
author: Rhonda K.

description: I can't believe I have never written a review for this place.  This is by far the best taco Tequila place in the bay area. The food is authentic and delicious and as a hard core Tequila drinker the best Tequila bar I have found anywhere. All quality stuff here. The patio is great, the music is great and the crowd is great. More important Luis and his staff create a terrific experience. I am here for happy hour and/or lunch 3-5 times a week and it is always perfect. If I could give it more stars I would.
author: Richard B.

description:
Really great place to grab drinks after work
Chips and guacamole were good
The margarita was ok
The couzel was very strong but good. Be careful!
Nice outdoor patio
Bathroom situation is too long
Service was very good
author: Jones T.

description:
I ordered 30 burritos for an office Cinco de Mayo breakfast. They arrived on time, all neatly marked, including the five without cheese and my special "bacon, no potatos". I appreciated the extra salsas, very fresh and delicioso.  The OJ smelled wonderful when I poured a glass, and tasted just as good.  People in my office are raving about how good the burritos are, and thanking me for ordering from UDT.  
Monica was a pleasure to deal with as well, and ordering was a snap. Thanks, Uno Dos Tacos, for great food at a great price, and for making me look good!
author: Barbara C.

description: Amazing food, I love the fish taco! I'll see you again uno dos tacos. The staff is great and friendly.
author: Daniela M.

description:
Uno. This is an easy place to stop and grab some grub during lunch rush hour. 

Dos. SO many other fantastic choices surround this little place with lackluster food and ambience that rivals Applebee's and TGIF's Mexican food selection.

Tres. Have you found another lunch spot yet?
author: Kevin J.

description: Come here for their breakfast burritos. Such a great price and these things are like a drug. I nice LEGAL drug.
author: ER W.

description:
My go-to spot in SF. I get steak salad with extra steak every day I'm at lunch in the city unless I have a lunch meeting at another spot.

Fast service no matter what, polite employees, really great salsas, and I don't even have to say anything about the salad - I literally get it every day or I leave SF sad. Have gotten it 2 times in a day on any occasion that I leave the office after 6. 
The steak is the best steak I have gotten at a Mexican restaurant thus far, easily!!!
Oh and the Guac is great! 
Great spot for drinks as well
Many coworkers worship the breakfast burritos for deliciousness and cheapness.
I will hopefully branch out to get other stuff but my go-to is too amazing! 


My first review on Yelp but had to do it because I have never had a bad experience here for two summers in a row of eating here daily, when possible
author: Ivan K.

description: Their breakfast burritos used to be so good, what happened?! Went there and ordered my usual breakfast burrito (egg, potato, cheese, salsa) and added veggies. First of all, they forgot the veggies, which is annoying (considering it wasn't even busy when I came in) but whatever. But even worse was that instead of the usual breakfast potatoes, there were bits of day old FRENCH FRY. Every time I took a bite I was like what is this weird crunchy thing? Freakin hard, dried up french fries, that's what. Definitely won't be coming back here.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Keep coming back for more.   Keeps me interested without Fail.  Their chicken tacos r to die for


Tortillas r hand made. Game changer
author: shar z.

description:
I had some seriously bad veggie tacos here, so much oil used and way too much squash! Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? I will say, I did love the fresh corn tortillas they used. I pretty much ate only the tortillas and left the rest.

Chipotle is better for veggie options, and I hate saying that since I would rather support local businesses.
author: Shannon Z.

description: I'd walked by here a dozen times and I'm happy I finally went in. My burrito was fantastic and affordable (for FiDi prices), and it was ready FAST even though the place was packed with a line out the door.  I was amazed.  We sat outside on the patio which was a bit chilly but I did see some others with colorful Mexican-style blankets.  I wasn't staying long enough to seek one out but I thought it was a very nice touch, but I do agree with another Yelper that this patio would benefit from heat lamps.  I think it's also a great idea to have the bar separate from the food ordering/cashier, both lines were very quick.  I rarely enjoy a beer on my lunch break but this place was too inviting to pass up the opportunity.  I am definitely visiting Uno Dos again very soon.
author: Jessika S.

description: I've had their breakfast Burrito and today I had a chicken burrito. I've had better. I probably won't go back to Uno Dos Taco's for the food but I am willing to try the cocktails.
author: Nancy M.

description:
I ate at Uno Dos Tacos because I was in the Financial District when it was happy hour and I was craving Mexican food. Let's just say, I do not plan on going back any time soon, unless I was desperate for Mexican food and this place happened to be the only Mexican restaurant left in the city. 

I genuinely feel bad for talking down about this restaurant because the service was nice and the workers were friendly, but unfortunately, the service does not compensate for the quality of the food. 

One of their options during happy hour is a quesadilla for $5, which I thought was a great deal. When I saw how puny the quesadilla was, I was disappointed. My friend said, "even Polly Pocket had bigger portions than this." When I tasted the quesadilla, I felt like I needed to get drunk off of the happy hour alcohol menu just to make the food taste a little bit better. 

The quesadillas tasted more like corn chips than anything else because there was barely any cheese inside. Even I can make better quesadillas than Uno Dos Tacos... and I'm Asian. 

Overall, Uno Dos Tacos isn't the worst place in the Financial District, but to me, it's not worth it.
author: Mark B.

description:
Where is Uno Dos Tacos: Uno Dos Tacos is located on San Francisco's bustling Market Street. Their outside seating area and garden is on 2nd Street just off Market. 595 Market St, San Francisco, CA 94105
(415) 974-6922.

Why must you visit: For starters it has delicious Mexican food in a fabulous downtown San Francisco location. On top of the food, the drinks (specifically the margaritas) are awesome. Chef Luis Flores is not only involved on the culinary side, he's also very hands on with the cocktails and is a tequila enthusiast. I learned this during my visit when Chef Flores walked me through his extensive tequila assortment sharing his passion for tequila and the delicious drinks him and his team have created. Check out the bar below!

A Bit More About Chef Luis Flores: Luis' culinary roots go back to a big family and warm kitchen in Guadalajara, Jalisco, where his mom and aunt gave him a taste for cooking from scratch. No matter how big the meal - the tortillas would be made by hand and the salsas carefully crafted to bring out the flavor.

What are Chef Flores's favorite dishes to prepare: To this day Luis' favorite foods, including Carnitas and Mole, are among the most time-consuming to prepare. But that's what makes them rewarding. "I always wanted to open a restaurant that captured the real flavor of Mexico," says Luis. "Homemade and deeply personal." You can see exactly how Luis makes it all work, thanks to the big expo kitchen at Uno Dos Tacos allows you to be part of the action.

What are the happy hour specials:  $4 beers, $6.50 Margaritas, $5 Sangria and assorted Bar Bites for $5 from 4:00-8:00pm. Yes that is NOT a typo, Uno Dos Tacos San Francisco has a FOUR HOUR HAPPY HOUR!! WOW, I want to move in!!

Thanks for checking out my post I hope you enjoy dining with The JetSetting Fashionista. Emily
author: JetSettingFashionista J.

description: nice to have another Mexican food option besides Chipotle (and a few stretchy places...), but difficult to rate. the food is above average, prices are definitely reasonable, pretty quick service once you ordered, and nice surrounding (use to be a sandwich place back in the day), but at a certain point, a place just reaches its peak. Uno Dos Tacos is what it is - 3 star worthy.
author: Mike C.

description: Best tacos I have ever had! Delicious and the carnita are the best! Look for Monica, she is incredible and her salsa is worth dumping a whole bowl of salt, all for good luck!
author: Anthony V.

description: This review is for their breakfast burrito with veggies in it (you can also add bacon or chorizo). Just the right size and right ratio of egg to potato to veggies to cheese to tortilla (ever get a mouthful of just tortilla? not here!). There wasn't a ton of cheese, which I like because too much cheese doesn't ever sit well with me (especially in the morning). I always get breakfast burritos with salsa on the side so it doesn't get soggy if I don't finish it (which I did anyway), and they got my order right and it was ready very quickly (I came at 9:30am). A piece of potato at the very end was a bit hard, but that was the only downfall to my meal. For $4.34 including tax, I'll definitely be back for their BB.
author: RuthieAnn A.

description: I work across the street and have been eyeing this place for a month. It seems too trendy to be good. I finally gave in and I'm glad I did! The lengua (tongue) was AMAZING. If you're even the slightest bit curious you should try it. You will have a new appreciation for Mexican food. The one downside is the wait but it passes quickly because they have an assembly line that works efficiently.
author: Brian J.

description:
This place is in my building, so I'm really happy about that. I love the breakfast burritos, but not the way everyone else does. I leave out the veggies/chorizo/bacon options. They're not needed and possibly too spicy for some. What's great about the breakfast burritos is the eggs. They scramble a really good egg, mix it with potatoes, pico de gayo and some other bits and pieces and I'm very happy. 

If I get there when the agua fresca is ready, I'm even happier.

At lunchtime, I stick to the fish tacos or salad as they are best at that. I can get better carnitas from El Faro. But the fish here is excellent.

Salsa is too spicy for my taste, so I wish they'd offer another less spicy option, but I can live with it and bring in some Cholula for my desk.

Haven't had a chance yet to sample the bar, but it's very inviting after work. Will update my review once I've had the pleasure.
author: Marty R.

description:
Now serving margaritas! Yep it's true, they have a full liquor license now.  

Having a tequila or mezcal drink with your Mexican food makes the dining experience that much better. Perfect for happy hour or dinner.

When are the breakfast tacos coming?
author: Abby S.

description: One of my favorites places for Mexican in the fidi. It's more of a fresh mex style with burritos, tacos, plates or salads.  Pretty simple menu and really really good carne asada. They also make the tortillas fresh by hand daily. They offer a full bar with a large variety of tequila (my favorite) and the Paloma is just perfect. Check em out!
author: Shondra G.

description: Fast service, but tacos were bland and boring. Only one type of hot sauce available, and it sucks. If you are really craving a taco go for it but I'm not going back. No variety
author: Ciz A.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos is a great part of the SOMA lunch rotation. Typically a long line (but it goes fast) and once you order the wait is only about 5 minutes. Plus you get a handy little pager so you don't have to wait around in an awkward cluster. By the time you find a place to sit, grab a drink, and get set up to enjoy your lunch - your food is ready!

Their salads are a good portion (I hardly have room to finish) and at under $8 (for the Vegetariano (my go to) -  with Poblano, yellow squash, onion, and mushrooms) it is not only a tasty option but also way better on my pocket book then the typical $11-$13 salads you will find in most other restaurants in SOMA. (the most expensive salad at Uno Dos Tacos is still only 9.50!)

Other notable menu items:
* Chips and guac - good addition to any meal and the size is large enough to share. 
* Pescado taco - Wild fried cod, chipotle salsa

They have a good amount of seats inside - but on a nice day the patio is the place to be. Just watch out for the birds... they are vicious and will practically fight you for your food!

Service is always helpful, friendly, and quick.
author: Shannon H.

description: There's a huge crowd every weekday evening so I decided to give this place a try. The menu is clear and simple - 6-7 options across tacos, burritos, etc. However, I feel the quantity was rather sparse and the taste not punchy enough. Perhaps it suits the business-y crowd that you get here, but I was not a great fan.
author: Neeharika P.

description: Loved this place! Excellent food! Good drinks. Went when we were in town for vacay. Recommended by the desk staff at our hotel. Semi-self service--you Order at counter, choose seat, get your own non-alcoholic beverages (they serve alcohol to your table), and then they bring your order. Family of 4 with two teens/tweens had a fabulous meal.
author: Tiffiny D.

description: Imagine. Sitting in downtown SF sipping on a margarita watching the people walk by doing their daily routine. Up comes my fish taco which sends me back to Baja. Made my day!  The General Manager, Monica was out and about checking tables. Outstanding food and service!!!
author: James M.

description:
Vegetarian options are horrible. No chips and salsa.
I got the vegetarian salad and it was lettuce covered with black water from the beans.
You are better off going to chipotle. Not sure about drinks but food is atrocious.

Not much seating during happy hour.
author: EatVegetarian F.

description: When you're craving a breakfast burrito and don't want to spend more than $5, Uno Dos is your place. At $3.25, it's a steal for the Financial district, and you can add bacon or chorizo for a mere 50 cents. The burritos are on the small side, but not bad for the price. Plus, they crank them out so quickly, I'm never waiting for long.
author: Jenn C.

description: Uno Dos Taco!!! This place has the best Pescado & Lengua Tacos!!! And don't even talk abou breakfast burrito's, They are to die for! The best way to enjoy your burrito is with one of there awesome freshly squeezed orange juice! I have to admit they do put a lot of egg but you can always ask for light eggs. This is a great place not only for breakfast but for lunch & dinner too!!! Go bring the crew after work for happy hour!!! Staff is always amazing & helpful! Good job guys keep up with the hard work!!!
author: Runel M.

description:
Great place for breakfast. The only breakfast item is a really tasty breakfast burrito that pairs well with fresh OJ (they have a zumex machine). There is always lively latin pop in the morning which charges me up for the rest of the day.

The Yelp rating is for breakfast. The lunch and dinner food need a lot of improvement, and it's way too crowded for me after 5 PM.
author: Edmundo R.

description: The tacos are quite small so I tried out the Asada, Carnitas, and Lengua tacos. Although they were different meats, they all tasted very similar. The tacos came with a side of mashed black beans with cheese. The salsa that came with the tacos was not spicy. However, you can grab spicy ones from the counter. They have a long lunch line that moves quickly.
author: James S.

description:
I eat here almost every fucking day. I don't understand the folks that think Chipotle is somehow magically better? 

The tortillas are made right there with a machine to flatten corn, and then they are shaped by hand. How can this even compare with Chipotle?

The salsa is always fresh. I've had a few issues with tomatoes at Chipotle. 

I've tried all the meats. I am not sure where some reviewers think it's sub-par?

That said, yes, the quesedillas are small. Yes, the burritos don't have rice. Small and different does not equal bad.

Also, if you order a plate you will get the meat separate from the tortilla. For some reason this is somehow a 1 star experience for some reviewers.
author: Jim B.

description: Finally made it here for lunch after walking by many, many times. I ordered the tinga plate (chicken), and was very happy with it. Very flavorful, nice amount of spice (i.e., some kick but not overwhelming), and good portion for the price. I'll definitely be coming back here, hopefully for dinner so I can give the margaritas a shot.
author: Pat M.

description:
The service was fair and cheap enough. It would give chipotle and Baja Fresh a run for its money with the price point and food quality.

The carnitas pork was delicious and flavorful . The carnitas was recommended by the cashier and I couldn't agree more.

The only drawback which is fairly huge was the presentation of the corn tortillas on the plate. The tortillas were soggy and folded in little squares. When the tortillas were unfolded, it left rips and holes in the tortillas making the entire "taco" process a complete mess. It isn't fun when you have to use multiple napkins and your hands are left smelling like salsa.

I'll try the burritos later. Hopefully, it'll all be contained within the tortilla...
author: Jonathan T.

description:
The best carnitas in SF, hands down. 

Standard burrito fixings are pretty basic -- choice of meat, beans and salsa only,  but DAMN... SO FRICKIN FLAVORFUL! And that's saying a lot, from a guy that usually needs all the supers on his burrito. Guac, sour cream, extra hot salsa... skip it here because UNOS DOS delivers quality ingredients and masterful preparation in every bite!

Gimme more!!!
author: Jason A.

description: I've only ever had the chips and guac and margaritas even though I've been here a dozen times. The margaritas are awesome, I love getting a pitcher or three and sharing with friends. The guacamole is super tasty and the chips are fresh and so cheap and filling. It's a really hard place to find seating if you go right after work but it's the perfect place to go for a lazy lunch when you have nowhere to go/no important business decisions to make afterward.
author: Morgen S.

description: Loved this place until they denied me because it was 30 minutes before they closed and they tried to say someone threw up in there restaurant and I couldn't come inside to order. I waited outside to find some place new and I noticed they were taking people orders. I walked in and asked why are they taking people's orders when they said they were closed and they said they did not have a recollection of it. I proceeded to order some food while they laughed in my face. I thought they were unprofessional and immature. I was offended and sad, not for myself, but for the integrity of their business. I am sorry for the owner and the characters they hire. Please do not support this place. They say you are what you eat, absolute shit in this case.
author: Phil I.

description:
Uno Dos is a great spot for lunch and happy hour that's right by the hustle and bustle of Market and 2nd.

The tacos here are delicious! My favorite ones to get are the lengua and fish tacos. Prices are a little bit more than I'd like (not bad considering the location), but it's hard to argue with the quality of food. Uno Dos also has a housemade salsa that is awesome on everything! The salads are good as well, though you should ask for dressing on the side since it does tend to get over-dressed.

Happy hour prices are decent. You can't beat getting a bucket of beers or pitcher of sangria after work with a basket of chips and guacamole.

They do serve breakfast now (various breakfast burritos), which I've been meaning to try one of these days before work.
author: Vivian L.

description: Walked in for a quick bite to eat after happy hour at one if the nearby bars. I am still flabbergasted that the plate I ordered did not come with rice. Wtf??? Food was bland and over done, I would not come here again.
author: Zehra A.

description:
I've been here several times when I'm near the downtown area.  I like the atmosphere; it's usually a pretty happening spot after 5 on the weekdays.  

My favorite drink is the cazuelas...it has tequila and fresh grapefruit with some other stuff to make it delicious.  It's not too sweet, just right...be careful because it also packs a punch.  The bartender Sandy has always been really friendly and makes delicious drinks. Their margaritas are great also...no salt please.

I always get the guacamole because it's on point...with a little jalapeno for a slight spice.   There salsas are all fresh, but my favorite is the spiciest one.  I usually get the tacos because I like to pick 3 different kinds.   My favorite meats are the carnitas and the lengua...probably some of the best lengua I've ever had...and don't knock it until you try it.  The enchiladas are a solid choice also!!  One other side note...they do a great job of making mexican food into a healthy fresh option and not heavy.     

I'll definitely be back anytime I'm in the area because of the friendly staff, fresh delicious food and great atmosphere.   Oh and if you go outside and it's a little cold, put on one of the mexican ponchos they have...functional and stylish.  Enjoy!!!
author: Alex B.

description: Good Mexican food. Worst. Customer. Service. The first time I checked this place the lady that took my number forgot to activate by pager so when my order was ready they'd ring me up. My order came 25 mins later because the lady realized she forgot to activate the pager. My food was given to me cold from just sitting on the counter nobody knowing who's order it belonged too. Strike 1. The second time I went in after my first time there. This time it was a different girl and my gosh she was the nastiest employee. She rolled her eyes at me as she was taking my order and kept giving me dirty looks. And if I didn't ask to speak to a manager about her dirty attitude it was because there were people behind me and I was on a lunch break with no time for drama or causing a scene. I asked for sour cream which they charmed me for but forgot to give it to me. They'll take your business but won't provide good customer service.
author: Lupe H.

description:
Ordered a pitcher of margarita, a pitcher of sangria, the happy hour quesadilla, and the happy hour sopes.

They have a nice selection of happy hour menu items. Pitchers are $20 each and serve about 8 glasses. The margarita is really good, but the sangria is not great. The sangria didn't come with fruit slices. 

It might have been my selection, but I didn't enjoy my food. The quesadilla was covered with a sauce that tasted like cream cheese. The sopes was better tasting, but the meat was overly fried and dry. However, my friends enjoyed their tacos and chips. The portions are appetizer sized.

The bartenders were very nice and helpful.

Arrived at 4:30pm on a Thursday and the placed was full! I would come back. Good for a laid back place to come with friends for happy hour.
author: Heather L.

description:
Typical San Francisco baloney , there wasn't very much food and
The price was terrible,when she or he whoever delivered this overpriced 
Poor excuse for a dinner, I said oh well and tried it out didn't taste bad 
But there sure wasn't enough for the money I spent . One good thing 
Though the gal at the cash register gave us a free bowl of chips and 
Salsa  and guacamole which was great. Enough said .
author: Art F.

description:
When my secretary alerted me that there was a new Mexican restaurant near our office, my heart skipped a beat. One cuisine whose absence is acutely felt in the FiDi is Mexican. To be sure, there's plenty of quasi-Mexican chains that serve colonized Mexican fare, but this feels unacceptable when you know that less than a mile away, in the magical Mission, you can get authentic Mexican cuisine that will knock at least one, if not both, of your socks off.  

I dropped by UDT promptly around 1:00 p.m. PDT.  There was a line winding out of the door and into the foyer of a high rise, which is no surprise at a new restaurant.  Just have to note that the foyer of a high rise is not a good sign.  When it was finally my turn to order, I ordered two fish tacos.  As an aside, UDT serves what I like to call "Health Mex," which is not my favorite right out of the gates.  But considering their lunch menu does not contain cheese or sour cream, it's hard to understand why they have to fry the fish tacos.  Can't you grill the fish in those bad boys?  That tastes so much better, and lightens up lunch considerably. 

After I ordered two fish tacos, the cashier handed me a pager (he also dropped a big stack of pagers on me and onto the floor, but that's no big deal and is not reflected in my rating whatsoever).  I grabbed the pager and awaited my takeout order, which was served extremely quickly, much to my pleasure.  When I'm on my lunch break, I definitely appreciate when I do not have to wait longer than 5 minutes for takeout.  I grabbed the salsa from an adjacent table and squirted some on my tacos.  I'm not going to candy coat it for you, it annoys me that there is no salsa bar.  I can't imagine what people must be doing to salsa bars in the city to have caused so many restaurants to discontinue the DIY salsa option--- or worse (gasps) - charge for salsa(!)  I shudder just thinking about it.  I don't appreciate having to beg for salsa, however, for the record.  And there's no amount of salsa that ever equals "enough" in those tiny pre-portioned plastic ramekins.  

I took those tacos straight back to the office, which is less than 3 blocks away.  They were pretty cold by the time I got to them.  I acknowledge that I did put salsa on them, but even the taco shells were cold.  They were served with a little side of black beans topped with cotija cheese, which was a nice touch but honestly not really necessary.  How about just getting the tacos right, first?  

UDT is receiving a ton of hype and attention from the FiDi crowd, but I feel like this is a classic example of how so-so food receives an undeserved yet colossal reception in San Francisco.  This is not the best taco you will have, not by a long shot.  At a price of nearly $10 for two (fish) tacos, I think your lunch money would be better spent elsewhere.  

Of course, let's acknowledge that this is a new restaurant and perhaps needs time to work out the kinks.  And their happy hour looks kinda slammin.  It also appears that they have a full host of less healthy ingredients at dinner.  The service is quite good.  You'll receive a prompt greeting, a menu while you wait in line, as well as a sample of chips and guacamole.  The cashiers were fantastic-super friendly and helpful. Best of all, they seem to get that you don't want to wait a frakking month for a lunch order.  The service at UDT most definitely saves the day.  

Overall, it's not bad, but it's not the best, either.  It tastes like teen spirit.
author: Sunny S.

description:
I came here for a quick lunch and ordered the pork burrito and a Mexican coke.  It was decent, but I would have preferred a stronger spice base. As other reviewers have noted, no rice. The size is spot on - no bloat when finished.  Next time I will try their tacos
Their HH menu looks like it could be a great way to end the workday.
author: George S.

description:
Came here for lunch around 12PM (busy times I know) and yes the line was long.. but I feel like the overall time from when we got to the line and our food wasn't? 

Anyways, I ordered one fish taco and one asada taco. I was presently surprised! They were both decent sized in which I ended up eating only the insides of the asada taco (I know.. butchering ways of eating food). Also, their SALSA is pretty good! I put it on EVERYTHING.. the tacos.. and the chips!

Defs would come back here for lunch again and maybe try something else! Saw that their "bowls" looked pretty good and HUGE as well.
author: Krystal O.

description: Tried this a couple days ago with a friend for lunch. It has caught my eye a month ago but never tried until the other day.. as for my first visit I can say it gets busy during lunch hours due to being really packed but aside from that it is very welcoming with the Latin music playing. Veronica took my order and provided great customer service. My friend and I shared fish tacos and a carnitas salad. It was good and fresh. The food wait was not long which i appreciated. We got agua de fresa but I did wish they had more options for agua frescas. Overall, good lunch spot. I would consider going again.
author: Rose M.

description:
Update:

Until today, I was under the false presumption that one could not screw up a breakfast burrito. 

The $3.50 burrito ads seem appealing but in reality it's hardly a good deal. The burritos are tiny and anything apart of eggs and cheese is extra. I tried chorizo and that's the ONLY thing I could taste. This is likely due to the fact that there were hardly any eggs in this burrito. Additionally, the chorizo was bitter.

Today was a sad day for the breakfast lover in me. I'm on to the next.

---------

Uno Dos brings a trendy modern Mex spot with loud reggaton music to a rather dry FiDi setting. 

I came in for dinner and tried the pulled wpork burrito. Some may find this catastrophic, but I was pleasantly surprised to find no rice inside. No, I'm not on a diet. It's just that the lack of rice allowed the burrito to be packed with the pork and black beans and salsa. Such a simple recipe but it made for a hearty, filling meal for this starving gal. 

Portion sizes are just right: big but not overwhelming-take-half-home-after-overeating type. Good value for the neighborhood. 

*bonus: $5 Sangria from 4-8 during Happy Hr

Give it a go!
author: Nina M.

description:
For some good, fast Mexican, you can count on Uno Dos Tacos.

In the space that formerly housed Seller's Market, Uno Dos Tacos now puts out Mexican specialties that, while not rivaling the Mission Mexican triumvirate (El Farolito, Taqueria Cancun, and La Taqueria), is good for the FiDi.

With concrete floors, a long, communal, counter height table, and open kitchen, the dining room is quite spacious. There is even ample outside seating for those few sunny days in The City.

Upbeat musica Latina and friendly cashiers greet you as you enter. The menu is straightforward: carne asada, chicken tinga, carnitas, or veggie tacos, burritos, salads, or plates and only tacos of lengua or pescado. Prices are not unreasonable for the FiDi, and chips are an extra charge ($1.95 or $2.95 with guacamole). There is beer, Mexican sodas, and fountain drinks to slake your thirst.

This is a place where you order, pay, find a seat, and wait for your food. Cashiers are nice and kindly explain the menu. However, despite the cooks working at a frenzied pace, it was a while before the food was ready.

The chicken tinga burrito ($7.25) was filled with sizable chunks of high quality, white meat chicken, black beans, and piquant salsa. While tender and juicy, the meat was so moist as to make for a drippy burrito experience. 

Contrary to custom, the only thing you can personalize on your burrito is beans: regular or black. There was no option for refried, no whole wheat, corn, or spinach tortilla, and no variance on the spiciness. Perhaps this makes for a quicker assembly. Kind of like Henry Ford saying, "You can have any color car you want, as long as it's black."

Wrapped in freshly made corn tortillas, the carnitas taco ($3.25) was rich and very flavorful. The taco de pescado ($4.50, really?!) comes with fried (rather than grilled) cod and was good, but a little greasy. The agua de piña had the right balance: not too sweet, not too sour.  Don;t miss the house-made roasted jalapeño salsa--it's  available in squeezable containers on the tables (be careful or you'll wear it) and is quite piquant.

While not a contender for the best taco in town, Uno Dos Tacos focuses on using fresh, wholesome ingredients and is a far better alternative than Chipotle for Mexican in the FiDi.
author: CJ G.

description:
Another day, another visit to Uno Dos Tacos and this second visit was better than the first.

I had their Chicken Plate yesterday, which was good and flavored very well, but I thought I'd go for the tacos since it is in their name - great choice!

I had three tacos:

-Fish/Pescado Taco - amazing!  Good quality, fresh tasting cod fried to perfection and wonderful in the taco.

-Beef/Carne Asada Taco - This was good too, with nice quality meat...I just think it needs a bump of salt to make this even better.

-Pork/Carnitas Taco - very flavorful meat with the rich taste of pork, this was perfect inside a taco.

I really enjoyed this meal and will definitely go back for more of their great food.  

It has a fun and lively atmosphere inside which is nice and perfect for the area.
author: Ken G.

description:
The happy hour here is a JOKE! The $5 food items looks like what a freshman college student would whip up in the microwave and is miniature. Save yourself the trouble and get the burrito / other full sized items. Also, note that the burritos here don't have rice... :/

Also the drinks here that are on happy hour... are also kinda sad... the margarita is nice but theres only cheapy beers here, nothing you would come to expect at a bar in sf. 

Overall, nice try Uno Dos Tacos. I don't think you'll last very long here at this prime location and I highly doubt i'll come here Dos or Tacos.
author: Seliya G.

description: I really like the restaurant but today I found black plastic objects in my taco. I tired contacting Uno Dos but kept getting to voice makl
author: Cecilia M.

description: Love this place for happy hour. It's busy but not super crowded. Their tacos and chips/salsa were good, as well as their margaritas!
author: Katie P.

description: What a happy busy place, even on weekdays. Happy hour is from 4pm till close, which is later than you'd stay anyway.
author: Mingmei N.

description: Honestly wasn't what I expected. They don't have rice here...like...ah. It was good though and service was friendly. But if you're craving authentic Mexican this is not the place you want to go. Salsa was okay as well. Overall it was just an alright experience but we ate all of our food!! That's good right?
author: Julia F.

description: Maybe even 4.5 stars.  Had 6 taco platter with friend and agua fresca ~$30.  I really liked the lengua tacos. Fish were kinda meh, too little fish in them. I recommend you come on a sunny day, sit outside eat your fill and relax with friends.
author: Mike G.

description:
Service here is good and efficient, but foodwise, I prefer Chipotle or burritos from the mission. This is like a faster Chevy's?

Not a fan. Sorry.
author: Angela L.

description: Stopped by for a quick bite during their happy hours last night. Wish I took more pictures of what I ordered! My friend and I each ordered a $5 happy hour Gordita plate, $8 Margarita, and chips and guac/salsa for $3.50 each. The Gordita plate was a bit small, but it was a delicious little appetizer. We loved the outdoor seating vibes with popping music and complimentary classic Mexican serape blankets. The entire staff were so awesome and accommodating. This is an excellent for after work good vibes in the city!
author: Mariel V.

description: It didn't knock my socks off. I ordered the asada burrito and was underwhelmed. The burrito was light on the meat and heavy on the black beans. I ordered guac on the side. I always prefer it this way. I like each bite to have just the right amount. I like to be the master of my own guac destiny, so to speak. Anyway, the guac was a little heavy on the lime taste. Not my preference but who knows, maybe it's yours. Different strokes for different folks. I was a little surprised that there was no rice in the house. Would have liked some rice in my burrito but I guess if I wanted that I could have gone to Chipotle. We were visiting from out of town. This place was super close to the hotel. So that being said, if we stayed at the same hotel (or nearby) during our next visit to San Fran. I would probably would go back. It wasn't horrible.
author: Michelle M.

description: The food was amazing and margaritas, bartender super friendly,fast and delicious tacos with great cocktails
author: Horacio B.

description:
I came here for a quick lunch and ended up staying for a few drinks!!!

I have the carne asada burrito with cheese, rice, sour cream, guacamole and pico de gallo! It was delightful  and the perfect size. Some would say the burrito is too small but I like to think of it as European sizing. HA!

My friend got the burrito bowl and it puts Chipotle to shame. I would love to come back for happy hour!!
author: Simone J.

description:
Delicious authentic Mexican food, best guacamole, buñuelos and habanero salsa I have eaten. Handmade tortillas and a wide variety of drinks. 

The first time I went to Uno Dos Tacos my husband took me for dinner and I loved the drinks so much that I decided to invite my friends over for happy hour. 

Great customer service.
Love the cleanliness of the restaurant.
author: Tere G.

description:
Super close to Montgomery Bart
Fast service
Stumbled upon this place on a bad date once, loved the food but not him.
Went back the following week with a friend to find this little gem
author: Cassondra B.

description: This place has great tacos, wonderful ambiance, and generous staff. Can get super crowded but overall 5 star experience!
author: Mary A.

description:
Interesting place.

Food was good, loved their chips. Tacos were decent, can't compare them to a real taqueria in the mission though. Happy hour seems good. Pitchers of Sangria, bucket of beer. 

More like a place where you bring a group of friends or coworkers though.
author: Erica L.

description: The food here is amazing. I came in thinking it was just another Mexican food restaurant with a bar, but it wasn't. Their burritos are amazing, although the they don't have rice in it. Defiantly would come back again. Really big crowed outside but you will always find a spot to sit and eat.
author: Brianna W.

description: Tacos, guacamole, and margaritas were SO great. The salsa/pico was okayyyyyy... And the outdoor seating and complimentary blankets to keep warm is seriously such a great idea! Definitely will be coming back!
author: Tiffany T.

description: I love the fish tacos here, and appreciate the quick ordering and abundant outdoor seating (and blankets for damp/cold evenings). Everything is pretty reasonably priced and there are a lot of happy hour specials, although the line at the bar gets really long quickly. The only weird thing is the consistency with which they include the beans on the side of taco orders; if I order two tacos, I get the little cup of beans in the basket. But when I order 4 tacos, I don't get the beans. What gives? They're delicious, just include them consistently. Otherwise, this is a great after-work spot for some yummy tacos.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Happy hour in fidi!
Strong cocktail and fun, friendly bartender!

tacos available at happy hour pricing if you go after work. Yummy. Drinks and tacos, that's all you need to have a good time and catch up and share secrets with your friends.

You can sit inside at tables, higher bar tables, or outside (and use their blankets)! Adorable.
author: Veranna N.

description:
I'm a recovering Mexican food junkie. This place does not assist in my recovery. 

I love the option of indoor or outdoor seating. Some days I wanna bake outside, some days I wanna be at the communal tables. I get my fix either way. 

The pescado is very fresh. Paired with a little lime and my taste buds are on fire. My only issue is the trial sized water cups. But in the grand scheme, no other complaint from me!
author: Samuel C.

description: Great atmosphere, good food. Perfect for meeting  coworker's or friends for a drink after work
author: Louise C.

description:
There's a lot of decent daytime Mexican options in this area but nighttime is another story entirely.  If you're out drinking and need food, then Mexican options are few and far between.  Uno Dos was one of those options when I was heading home after a post work happy hour.  It was about less than an hour from them closing and I got a chicken burrito to take home.  There were plenty of people eating, conversing, and drinking.  While I was waiting for my burrito, I asked a lady how her house sangria tasted, and she replied "excellent" in an excited tone of voice.  I'll make sure to try it next time I come here.

By the time I got my burrito, I chew into it and I saw that they used pinto beans instead of refried beans.  Otherwise the burrito was okay.  I didn't even know whether or not I could have swapped the beans.  They do have lengua here as an option but I wasn't feeling having it that night.

May come back here to try their cocktails and maybe some lengua tacos but my first burrito wasn't bad but wasn't great.
author: Ben H L.

description: Best tacos I've ever had in my life. I can definitely eat this every day and not get tired of it. I had one fish taco and one pork taco, both were juicy and delicious!!!xD
author: Dennis T.

description:
We used Uno Dos to cater a work baby shower today.   Uno Dos was wonderful.  First, we got the high quality Uno Dos food we love, but delivered to us right on time.  They were shockingly reasonable, less than all the other horrible "taco" spots in the FiDi - and they are Uno Dos and delicious.  It was a win win.  

The food came perfectly packaged for service, they thought of everything, helped us more accurately buy based on our numbers (even talked us down on some things - no greedy over ordering at all).  We had carne asada and chicken tinga tacos - those hand pressed corn tortillas are so good, I could have crawled under the table with a dozen and never come out.  The bar includes limes, onions, cilantro, salsas, pico  - basically every taco condiment know to man.  Everyone left full and happy - the sign of a great party!

They could not have been more helpful - and the woman who delivered, she set it all up herself, and took a ton of stress/work off my plate by needing no direction!  I will use them anytime I need great food for an event downtown!
author: Shannon N.

description:
Does anyone NOT love Uno Dos?! It's the best!

This place has a great, lively atmosphere, but the setup makes it so it never feels too loud. I love both the indoor seating and outdoor patio, and they even have blankets for when it's cold out.

It's reasonably priced with a great $5 happy hour food selection, and the bar is great too! I love nothing more than splitting a pitcher of Sangria with my friends.

It's seriously the perfect place to meet up with friends after work. It's conveniently located near BART, so no excuses why you can't get there! It's also counter service, so no awkward splitting of checks. The food is good quality, and the service is amazing! The bartenders are so nice!
author: Sally F.

description: Honestly...kind of average. Maybe even below average. But alright for a cheap breakfast burrito in the mornings in FiDi. Everything else is not really good and not necessarily cheap either. 3 stars for fun ambience and outdoor seating! Sorry UNO dos :(
author: Menisha V.

description: I came here after work for happy hour and was super excited about the happy hour prices. Definitely worth it for cheap drinks and eats. The margs were good. The guac was good. I also had a quesadilla but it was nothing special. Overall - if you're looking for a great happy hour special in SoMa - this is where to go!
author: Teresa C.

description: Seriously the worse place ever. First of all, it's TACOS TUESDAY. This place is all about tacos but doesn't promote Tacos Tuesday and their happy hour menu is sh*t. Too crowded and nowhere to sit. The $5 hour advertisement is full of crap and you're barely getting anything decent. AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!
author: Venus T.

description: Perfect for after work! Very cheap. You will love the margaritas and the food! You've got place to enjoy a moment with your friend!
author: Romain T.

description: Chicken tinga tacos are only second best to my husbands. The fresh tortillas are a huge bonus. Really surprised they don't have a solid five star rating because the tacos are the best I've had in SF and I make it my job to eat tacos all the time. They need a location in the mission, please. Location is not the best.
author: Lina M.

description: Not really Mexican food. Mexican food names, yes. It lacks the most fundamental ingredients of Mexican cuisine. It is obviously financial district people putting together a glitzy, spacious, cookie-cutter Mexican restaurant. I felt like the food was very simple and lacked spice. I am sure they are adjusting it for most who work in the area. When I finished my food I felt full, yet unsatisfied.
author: S. G.

description:
Utter crap

We did a big order (for the company) and I must say the food we got were painfully average

The only flavor was salt, that's it! Guacamole, salty! Salsa, salty! Burritos, salty! I think a lot of our colleagues developed high blood pressure after the meal ... never again!
author: Alan N.

description: We came here for cinco de mayo and it was crowded and lively.  The burritos are pretty good.  I loved the steak and the black beans have the soft consistency of refried beans, which I really love!  The guac and chips are pretty good.  This is not like Mexican food in the Mission but between there and Chipotle.  I would definitely come back.
author: Chris L.

description:
*UPDATE - I nearly increased the rating to 5 stars, but I just needed to call out the AMAZE-BALLS breakfast burritos here, available until 10:30 am.  They are very TexMex style - if you know and like breakfast burritos in Austin, TX (how could you not?), these are like that.  Manageable size for breakfast, very egg-y, and totally delicious.  I get mine without potatoes and cheese (the cheese is never melted) and add bacon and sometimes avocado.  The price is reasonable and it's a solid size for breakfast.  The eggs are perfectly cooked - scrambled and a little soft.  I douse the whole thing in their house smoky salsa and it's perfection.*

I'm so glad this is in walking distance of my office...

I love this type of hipster/Americanized "Mexican" food - and I think a lot of the negative reviews on here are simply because this is not super authentic Mexican cuisine.  If you're OK with this style, however, then I think you'll like Uno Dos Tacos.

I've been a few times for lunch and "afternoon snacks" - as in, sometimes I stop here for a single taco rather than my usual coffee/pastry break.  I think the tacos are awesome.  If I'm here for a snack only, I just order one fish taco.  If I go for lunch, I usually get carnitas, lengua, and fish tacos.  I LOVE all three of these.  The fish tacos are served with a really tasty chipotle mayo and then a big heap of fresh slaw and pico de gallo - it helps to freshen up the fried fish and mayo combination.  I never think the fish is overly heavy or greasy - I actually love the more "tempura" style of batter, and they freshly fry the fish up for each order.  The carnitas and lengua tacos are also terrific - the lengua is pretty oily, however.  I don't think it's a bad thing - it reminds me of my favorite old-school taco joint in East Moline, IL (Adolphs Mexican Foods - check it out!) - and it certainly doesn't take away from the flavor.  Rather, I think it adds to it.  But I could see that grossing some people out... I will say that this place IS pretty expensive.  I think they could stand to take at least $0.50 off of all of their tacos - especially with all the taxes we have to pay for food in SF now that are basically funding the costs that they would otherwise have to pay to their employees...

I used to order the chips, salsa, and guacamole with my meal but have since stopped, as I don't really think they're anything to write home about.  At the very least, just get the chips and guacamole and then take some of the free salsa that they have by the silverware - it's a LOT tastier than the pico de gallo (more or less) that they make you pay for... 

It looks like this place has a pretty decent happy hour, but the environment is a little weird - usually one big group of office workers - so I would probably opt to try that and sit outside if you really can't think of anywhere more interesting to go.  I'm also intrigued by their breakfast burrito selection and am definitely going to have to try that sometime soon!
author: Tay H.

description:
Great food! I used Uno Dos Tacos for a catered event and not only where they on time for delivery, but they insisted on setting up while I finished decorating. Uno Dos Tacos really helped to make my Holiday party successful. 

Thanks Monica!!!
author: Sharon M.

description:
This place reminds me of a dirty taco shop/club in Tijuana Mexico.  This is Sub par Mexican food because they have a great location and don't have to be a great restaurant. They are all about speed here. You slightly feel like you are being 
Taken for your foolishness when you choose to eat here. 

Their breakfast burritos are cheap but the eggs are never cooked all of the way. Sometimes it tastes like they crack a single egg into a flour tortilla and then serve it to you. In and addition the flour tortilla makes up more than 50% of the burrito.
author: Alexander S.

description: This review is based on their breakfast. Uno Dos is my go too since it's been open. I rave about it to my friends who haven't heard of it. It's a great HH spot. However... I usually treat myself to a tasty, warm, breakfast burrito once in a while and I usually get a bacon breakfast burrito but wanted to switch it up this morning. I've gotten chorizo in the past, but I don't remember the chorizo being that greasy and I got barely any chorizo this morning. Granted, I saw they were making a huge order of burritos it looked like. But... don't raise the prices on us (as of a few months ago for breakfast) and give us a lesser product. Disappointed.
author: Kelvin N.

description: LOVE This place! I get on BART during my lunch hour, just to go here. Great people, great food and great service! Always friendly and the environment is always good...and the tacos and their salsa...*drools*
author: Just M.

description: i like how uno is open during breakfast hour, so we can grab coffee with breakfast burrito. the breakfast burrito is pretty filling, but i feel like there's too much egg in it, and it is wrapped in a thick tortilla, feel like a mouthful of carb and eggs.
author: Emily H.

description: This was the best quick sit down meal I've had in the city.  I had the pork plate, and it was so tasty! I would have given them 5 stars, but they ran out of guacamole.  This place is great for fast causal dining in the city, with good food.
author: Shelly M.

description: Solid breakfast taco for cheap, on the way to my office. It's a good option to grab on the go, the food is fresh and the hot sauce is homemade and tasty. I would reccomend it :)
author: Jonah K.

description: Decent mexican food. Good for a quick lunch bite. Menu is easy to read. Choose the meat (fish,pork,chicken etc.), and the style(taco, burrito, salad, plate). Nice outdoor seating. It definitely beats chipotle.
author: Carrie Z.

description: Best tacos in town really tasty burritos ! And very good price also specially for financial district
author: Jose H.

description: Great ambiance, amazing food and good service. I came here for lunch and it was awesome! The happy hour also looks epic
author: Ilana B.

description: Drinks only.
author: Dean L.

description:
Had a great happy hour experience here. Everyone was very friendly, drinks were good, and I imagine the food is good too! (Certainly looked good, though I didn't get anything). 

For how much space they have outside for seating, it's a bit cramped on the inside, especially on a cold day when not many people are brave enough to sit outside. 

Overall good experience, and I'd definitely go back!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Coming from someone who works downtown off Market St., the lunch options can be pretty limited and mundane after a while. I heard about Uno Dos opening a while back and finally decided to check it out the other day.

This is an incredible lunch spot. Plenty of seating outside, and lots of seating inside. The menu is smaller, but straight to the point. Tacos, burritos and salads. Side of chips with guac. Personally, I don't need anything else in a Mexican joint.

The burrito was good, but to be honest the pico de gallo just ruined the overall structure. I hate how they wrap the burrito in tin foil even though I was dining in. After unwrapping, the burrito started to fall apart, and pico was just ALL over my hands. My coworker ordered a salad that looked gorgeous, and the chips and guac were fantastic. The waterlogged tube of Mexican love was the only gripe I had. Maybe no pico next time.

I'll 100% be coming back for happy hour (4- 8 p.m.) because they have a ton of great cheap items.
author: Tyler H.

description:
Came here to grab Breakfast Burritos for our early morning meeting.  Placed the order one day before and had a little bit of complication with ordering. First I called and I was put on hold for a few minutes, then she gets back on the phone asking if I can call back in 20 minutes because she was so busy. Im thinking in my head, is she serious? but went ahead an agreed. Called back in 20 mins.. and she still was super busy and put me on hold once again, waited patiently then finally my order as finally taken! I ordered 20 breakfast burritos ( 10 bacon & 10 chorizo) also I wanted rice and beans.. but they said beans were not ready by the time i would pick up my order (9:15am), I thought that was strange.  Then I asked.. well could I get guacamole and chips... then I was denied once again! No guacamole at 9:15 AM... seriously? If I'm ordering in advance, I would figure they can have it ready for the night before.. any who. I just opted for chips & salsa. Upon pick up, everything went smoothly. 

Now for the good stuff.. the taste of the food.  I had the chorizo breakfast burrito, it was OK nothing special about it. The eggs where very very soft if that makes sense, the chorizo was  spread like (kinda made me wish i should have chosen bacon). The chips were delicious and crispy and the salsa was great. Over all 3 stars.. 

PS the breakfast burritos was decent priced. 20 breakfast burritos, 2 bowls of chips, and 2 salsas = $108
author: Mariethonnie M.

description:
I stumbled upon this place on a Thursday night looking for a food place along market and since the jnitial place my friend and I wanted to go to closed at 8pm (get it together McDonald's) we decided to give it a go. 

I got the Gringas Tinga (essentially a chicken quesadilla) which was $7.50 and the chips and guacamole ($3.50). I was pretty satisfied with the price since San Francisco dining can get pretty up there and the serving size was reasonable.

What I very much enjoyed was the Margarita de la Casa! The price ($8) was pretty good for the city and although the serving size was small, the drink itself was nice and strong. Not sure if it was just the bartender that night or if their margaritas are strong on the reg, but I am definitely coming back for them bomb margs!

Only negative thing I have to say is that the tomato salsa that came on the side with the quesadilla made the bottom of the quesadillas a little soggy but it was still delicious. 

There is indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating does not have heaters but they provide blankets by the register. Worth a try!
author: Cielli G.

description: Margarita pitchers (4-5 servings) for $27 and sangria pitchers for $20. Chips and guacamole for under $5, and $5 happy hour snacks like quesadilla, flautas, and more! The drinks can definitely add up, but Uno Dos Tacos has a great vibe and decor that make it a good place for happy hour. They also have a lot of outside seating if you have a big group! There are long tables inside, but it's probably better for groups of 4 people or less. If you have more in your party, grab a blanket from the entrance and snag a picnic table with your friends!
author: Grace C.

description:
If they put half as much effort into the food as they did the decor, This place could be a hit. 

THE VIBE:

"rustic chic" look with a simplified menu, it combines nice tables and light fixtures with steel. 

THE FOOD:

Just a big ol' bowl of "Meh". the Fidi has always been kind of lacking in good quality Mexican, and Uno Dos really isn't bringing much to the table. Salsa's are uninspired, meat's not super high quality, it was just nothing special. 


UNO, DOS TIP:

If you're going to come here (because your work forced you), at least come during happy hour and get a discount.
author: Patrick T.

description: Disclaimer: I didn't order any food here since it was stop two on a happy hour hop. My group ordered two pitchers of margarita ($30 each)--not a bad price considering we had about 6 to split it among. Each of us had about two glasses! Lots of seating both inside and outside. The inside tends to get filled up quickly since people want to avoid the chilly SF weather. If you're going to sit outside, Uno Dos Tacos has you covered! You can pick up a blanket to keep yourself warm while you enjoy your food/drinks. Definitely will come back again!
author: Naveena S.

description: Yummy tacos and chips!  Love their margaritas too.  Great place to hang out after a stressful day from work.  It's my new favorite hang out place.
author: Rowena L.

description: Monica is amazing! My margarita was one of the best...good start to my birthday week. Thank you!!
