author: Stephanie D.

description: I've only been here for the breakfast burritos but they keep me coming back. I'll have to come back for evening service and the tequila bar.
author: Caleb H.

description:
I went to eat here during lunch on a weekday and the place was packed! Surprisingly no issue finding a place to sit though.

The menu is simple and easy and the lady taking my order was very sweet and patient regardless of the madness! I ordered the Lengua taco and Tinga (chicken) salad. The Lengua taco was so delicious! All of the ingredients in the bowl were so fresh and delicious too! 

Their beans that they have as a little side are also delicious! 

I would definitely come back here for happy hour and hit up the bar too ;)
author: Vanessa P.

description: come for the Micheladas and Margaritas they're awesome! Fish Tacos and Frijoles are amazing, it's my go to happy hour and lunch spot. Service is awesome! Thank you Uno Dos Tacos!
author: Mara G.

description:
In my continuing my continental cuisine exploration of the Financial District, Mexico was the next country on the trip. 

Several of my colleagues recommended this place for tacos. More or less met my expectations for a FiDi taco experience. 

2 is plenty and a reasonable $7 lunch, but I would rather skip over to the Mission for the real deal at half the price.
author: Amy Z.

description:
The meat is really flavourful; got the carnitas taco and it was really delicious.

The vegetariano taco was a bit bland though and tasted overpoweringly of beans.

Otherwise friendly staff with a pleasant lively atmosphere in the restaurant.
author: Drini C.

description: Breakfast burrito WIN!! Also solid tacos de lengua but I think they're overpriced.
author: Jay H.

description: As good as it gets. Very lively, lot of seating space. Lot of good drinks but the food is the highlight. I had enchilladas and my friend had tacos and we had a great meal!
author: Zaki S.

description: Ordered breakfast burritos for a meeting at work.  The Uno Dos staff had them ready and packed up at the promised time.  They provided tons of salsa - which I had forgotten to request.  The burritos were yummy - all eaten by the end of our meeting!
author: Carolyn K.

description: I always pass by this place going to and coming from work. I wanted something other than a pastry for breakfast and decided to try there 3.25 breakfast burrito.  It was counter service and they make it fresh for you.  It was filling and tasty for breakfast. I will come back again.
author: Cindy T.

description: Pretty solid Mexican food, a bit of a step up from your typical taqueria in terms of cleanliness (though my visiting family member got sick after eating their carnitas burrito).  Fish tacos were good, burritos were ok (I'd take a burrito from any taqueria in the mission over the one I had here).  Also they were nice to not kick us out even though we kept eating/drinking 30 minutes after closing.
author: Kasey M.

description: Went here for happy hour with a group of friends.  Sat on the patio.  The blankets really came in handy.  The food and drinks were pretty good.  Would have given it 4 stars if they had a wait staff.  It was ridiculous having to get up and go inside to order more appetizers and drinks.  Even more ridiculous that we couldn't put it all on one tab.  Probably won't be back unless they get a wait staff.
author: Stacey N.

description: not too shabby tacos, everything was pretty fresh, tortilla too fresh / fell apart too easy
author: Phillip K.

description: Went here a few weeks ago for a work happy hour and the staff was awesome. Me and two other people arrived about 30 minutes early so the staff was in the middle of setting up. We told them not to worry about us and that we would hang out at the bar or outside until the set up was complete. They were so nice about it and rushed to get everything ready and even started making some apps and bringing us out some of the pre ordered pitchers of drinks. The place has a fun atmosphere and vibe and the food was pretty good. My only suggestion would be to get some heaters outside since it can get really cold in the outdoor seating area.
author: Michele H.

description:
Plan on two.

Otherwise you'll have a hard time choosing between the shredded chicken taco and the vegetarian taco with peppers, squash, onion and black beans. Both delicious.

Those are just two options. There are more and all are reasonably priced considering the impressive size at $3 - $4. Served on tasty homemade tortillas too.

Burritos and bowls are available too, as are homemade sugar cookies in the shape of a roll with a pop of pink on the inside. Sweet and striking.

Tables and countertop seating both are available and surrounded by a colorful and festive vibe. Long line but the friendly staff moves it quick.

Plan on four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Love this place for a workday lunch. The line is usually out the door but the staff is efficient and your food comes out quick! I absolutely love the fish tacos. The tortillas are delicious! The salads are very tasty too! You can get beer, wine, or margaritas here, too! Great place, great food, great service
author: Julia M.

description: Heard some mixed reviews about this place from my co-workers, but I decided to try this out for dinner after work. Well the mixed reviews are almost just about right. The place is ok, but it's definitely not a place I would rave about. The lady behind the counter was nice, but the food is where I had a bit of an issue. I ordered a coca-cola in a glass which was great and then I got a chicken burrito and some chips and salsa. The chips were nice and fresh, but the salsa didn't have a lot of taste. I was looking for something a bit more stronger, but it was just bland. The burrito was ok. It wasn't gross or anything, but the sauces inside mix together a bit too much so after awhile the burrito gets really soggy and almost has a watery feel to it. Overall, it looks like a great place to come to for a drink or two (as it seems like many people do after work). The food was just ok, but not a place I'd probably drop by for again when I have an urge for some Mexican Food.
author: James R.

description: Would only suggest this place if you want your order to be forgotten or poor customer service. This would be my go-to morning spot for a good breakfast burrito, however I must say my past couple experiences have been poor. Last time they actually forgot my order. Today I was in line at 1030 to order the usual breakfast burrito and was rudely turned down saying there were no more burritos, but staring at a huge pan of eggs in the kitchen. Disappointed that this is how I was treated as a loyal customer that frequents this place a few times a week. Will be taking my business to the new Mexican food place across the street and suggesting the same to others.
author: Karley T.

description:
Best tacos ever and I'm mexican 
The place very clean. As far as the service  looks like they have a great system lines were big but I was in and out in no time. I will make uno dos tacos my place to eat
Love it
author: JORGE F.

description: Came here on a lunch time at Monday. The line was long so I almost decided to go elsewhere, but I'm glad I didn't because the line moved incredibly fast. I think it took 5 minutes from the time I got in line to when the food arrived, including ordering time. Insanely fast. The tacos were great too. My friend and I shared six Asada Tacos. The sauce was yummy and the meat was very high quality. I will definitely be back again.
author: Lisa Y.

description:
Solid breakfast burrito! It's one of my new morning favorites. A good proportion of ingredients and it's the perfect size for breakfast; not to mention the price is right: Under $4 with bacon or chorizo. Coffee is just okay; a little too much like mud for my tastes. 

I've never come in for lunch, but I would be willing to give it a shot one of these days.
author: Kelly E.

description:
My co-worker recommended me this place so I gave it a try!
Traveled 6 long blocks during lunch to get to this spot and I'm glad I came.

PROS: 
Fast service and the food comes out quickly
TACOS are delicious (get the carnitas and pescado - you can never go wrong)
Chips and Salsa/Guacamole (Great portion to share and chips are extra crispy)
Plenty of outdoor/indoor seating (even blankets are provided if you are on the chilly side)

CONS:
I do agree that the taco shell itself can get pretty soggy
Portions are a bit small if you have a large appetite

ALL IN ALL I will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu :)
author: Virginia L.

description:
Good carnitas!
A little hipster for me, but in SF it's a good dine-in option for tacos.
Glad to have found it.
author: Alex S.

description:
Came here through a series of random events on St. Patrick's day and ended up having a great time! The sangria was delicious and I really enjoyed the happy hour quesadilla. My friends had just about everything on the happy hour menu and everyone enjoyed. Considering that this place is so close to my school I look forward to coming back! 

Although we sat inside, I appreciated that they had blankets for those sitting outside!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Finally found an excellent taco place! There are obviously plenty of incredible hole-in-the-wall places in this city, but I was looking for an authentic place with a nicer atmosphere as well and just couldn't find it. Finally found it! I went with a group of coworkers, and we had all just come back from Mexico City and were looking to recreate our experience as much as possible. These tacos were perfect. We tried one of each and were all super happy. The tortillas are the bomb! I would buy a pack of just these each week! And the lengua- yum! I find that so hard to find in San Francisco. The atmosphere is perfect. We felt right back in Mexico City. Will be back again and again. Next time for margaritas. Thanks for a great experience!
author: Catherine C.

description: If your an SF native and your looking for a Bfast burrito do yourself a favor and walk half a block down to Caramba. It's much more authentic and food is made to order. The eggs at uno dos are pre made and taste imitation egg or kinda reminds me of continental breakfast at a cheap hotel. Drinks are good and the salad looks yummy.
author: Natasha M.

description: One of the best happy hour places in the financial for sure! Everything from the am breakfast burritos to the awesome evening bar staff, Sandy was/is the epitome of that bar, from the small talk to the perfect pours she will make you feel welcome. I strongly encourage you to try the food as well as the happy hour specials
author: Noah I.

description:
I went to Uno Dos Tacos last night for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised -- for being in the middle of Fi Di, everything was decently priced. ($3.25/tacos and $4 beers). I had the veggie taco and it was packed full with delicious ingredients. I would highly recommend it; it even looked better than their meat tacos. 

The set up itself was pretty cool as well. Inside was trendy and it had an outdoor patio with plenty of blankets in case you were cold! 

I docked a star because it's not the best taco, I've ever had but I would definitely come back!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
My favorite Tex Mex restaurant, Chevy's closed down....RIP so I tried this place out and it was extremely underwhelming.

I got the fish tacos and the breading to fish ratio was just awful. I felt like I was eating a giant mouthful of greasy breading with tasteless fish. The tortillas, which they make in house were pretty good I'll admit. 

They give you a teensy, tiny metal cup of beans on the side...The beans were really good but they only give you a spoonful to go with your tacos. I would have loved a reasonable sized portion.

The location is really nice and it seems like a good place to eat outside and share a pitcher of something. I didn't try any of there alcoholic beverages but they looked good. 

I don't think I would come back unless it was for some drinks.
author: Loryn F.

description: This is a great addition to this area of downtown. Great for lunch and happy hour. The space accommodates a lot of people so you can actually have space to eat and drink. Nice patio for those sunny days. Food is simple and decent. The staff are really fun and friendly.
author: Bharu J.

description: Loved this place! The food was fresh and tasted great! Def recommend and will be back again :)
author: Brenda M.

description: My burrito was full of beans. If there were any more beans, it would have been a taco bell type bean burrito - only it would be 95% cheaper. The meat was lean which was OK, but I really wanted it to be a flavorful and tasty with some fat and comeon guys what do you use to season this beef - water? This burrito was tasteless as my mother's vegitarian tofu. Did I mention the beans?
author: David L.

description:
This review is for the Breakfast Burrito.

Hands down the best in the Fidi.  Bigger and better than Caramba. Better than any spot in Crocker. And better than any deli/dive that i have found within 4 fidi mega-blocks.

$3.75 gets you a fresh, fully loaded bfast burrito with eggs, cheese, potato,  meat (bacon/chorizo/veggies) from a beautifully clean, and well-organized kitchen. 

I wish Thrillist published it on their bfast burrito ranking, but i think it was still getting up and running at the time.

That being said, IMHO, here is how to take it from a great bfast burrito to an AMAZING one:

1.)  Up that hot sauce game. Either a typical Mission green sauce, or a La Victoria (San Jose) -style orange sauce would hit the spot so much better than the current mild/med salsa.

2.) This is a personal preference, but a griddle toasted tortilla would really be a level up. Throw it on a for 5-10 secs for that subtle crunch - helping offset that sogginess from wrapping a steaming burrito in foil would be worth an extra $.50 to me.

I grew up eating out of a lot of gritty taquerias, in contrast this place is fresh, clean and i think the kitchen staff and customer service at this place are top notch.
author: Priyan P.

description: Ordered fish and chicken tacos. The corn tortillas are made fresh. Over good taste. The bad part is the price. Paid $18 for three fish and 1 chicken taco. No drink. No chips. Salsa is free though. The beans they give you is in a small cup and it was only filled 1/2 way. Beans are cheap--why not give more? There is no rice served here. Overall, tastes good, but portions are small for what you have to pay.
author: Ben L.

description: Loved it. Friendly staff, fun atmosphere. Came by myself, but it would be a fantastic place to have a casual meal with friends. The fish tacos are on point.
author: Jake K.

description: At lunch time this place has a line out the door and it might be a little tricky to find an open space for a group of more than four or five to sit, but if you get cozy with some neighbors and make friends, you can find some spots to eat. The food is tasty, the ambiance fun...and if the weather is good, I definitely recommend sitting on the patio.
author: Anna C.

description:
Excellent food! The taste is authentic and  and the price is fair. Great home made tortillas and awesome burritos with a lot of meat!

The breakfast burritos are extremely cheap and delicious too! They have chorizo, bacon, and veggies. 

The same owners who brought super duper burgers have now hit it off with a nice Mexican restaurant!
author: Rodolfo M.

description:
This restaurant is great for overweight wealthy masochists. Notice you have to be all of the above to enjoy this restaurant because their food has less portions, costs more, and tastes worse than most Mexican restaurants in San Francisco, even Chipotle. It is quite literally INFERIOR IN EVERY POSSIBLE ASPECT. 

In fact, compare Uno Dos Tacos to Chipotle: $8-$9 for a SMALL, dry burrito with very plain filling (you have to pay extra even for cheese and sour cream), or, $7-$8 for a LARGE tasty burrito with however many toppings you want. Given that Chipotle is walking distance away, I cannot imagine why anyone would become a regular at Uno Dos Tacos, unless, as I mentioned before, they are an overweight wealthy masochist. 

2 stars instead of 1, because they served us some tiny hipster samples of something while we were waiting in line and they tasted moderately good. Figures that the thing they served us is not on the menu (even if it were, it would probably cost $10 per 100 calories).
author: Max L.

description:
I don't think my Spanish is very good, but "Uno Dos" means 12, right? AKA probably the number of times I've come here for lunch in the past two months.

Also, people who know me wouldn't consider me a salad guy...but guess what? 12/12 times I ordered their extremely affordable (~$8) and delicious salads that are consistently eclipsed by copious servings of chicken/beef/carnitas.

On top of that, they are clearly a well-oiled machine capable of churning through 30+ person FiDi lunch hour rush lines like a fat kid goes through pant sizes. Their assembly line approach minimizes your wait and never skimps on quality or quantity.

I have not experienced a subpar lunch from 12Tacos yet. As long as they keep this up, I guarantee I will be here every week from now until retirement. :)
author: Nick W.

description: Don't go here unless you are super desperate. Their tacos are so gross and dry. Meh.
author: Katy W.

description: Now that I'm away from the Bay Area and California, maybe my rating is even higher because of some bias. Regardless, I loved my carnitas plate! It came with 3 tortillas, beans, and salsa for less than 8 dollars. We sat outdoors, and on a chilly San Francisco evening, they even provide blankets for the patio. The happy hour menu also looks amazing, will definitely come back to try that.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Pitcher of margarita is pretty small, but it tastes pretty good. Food is fresh and fair portions for the price! The burritos are AMAZING, I've been twice and the others who were there with me weren't disappointed. Also, real homemade guacamole tastes great too. Overall, I took away 1 star because of the fairly small margarita pitcher... and how the bathrooms were barely flushing and seemed clogged both times I was there.  Otherwise, it's all good and the free wifi is appreciated!!
author: Alpo P.

description: Higher quality than a taco truck and cheap! Service was super fast, staff was friendly. We sat outside and it was pretty clean and pleasant. No bums, no bird doody on the table... What more could you ask for?
author: Bauble C.

description:
Tacos were ok.  Had the pescado taco, asada taco and carnitas taco.  Not impressed with any of them. 

Pescado taco was watered down from the pico de gallo that was strewn all over my basket, including my other two tacos (which the menu said DIDN'T come with). Corn tortilla was soggy. 

Carnitas taco had some weird juices in it from the meat.  I thought carnitas were supposed to be somewhat crispy...? Guess not. 

Asada was less than impressive.  Looked like wet dog food.  Not appetizing. 

A pigeon tried to steal some of my chips and salsa while I was eating outside, so atleast someone found this food appetizing (looking on the brightside.) 

Won't be back, so
Two Stars.
author: George P.

description:
The staff is friendly and the sangria, sweet with a lovely Jalepeno kick is great. However the atmosphere is chipotle esque and the taste of the food is similarly bland and boring. Big ups for making their own tortillas but other than that it's worth schlepping to the mission for some real mexican food.
Hell I'd rather go to chevvys because at least they have margaritas
author: Molly S.

description:
If this review were based only on the pork, it would be higher.  It's expensive for tacos...but it's what you expect downtown.  I'm glad there's a place to get tacos near my work.  The salsa and guacamole are both really good.

Their breakfast looks good, but I can't eat it because they only have burritos and not tacos (I can't eat wheat).  Breakfast tacos, please.  Kthxbai.
author: PrincessPeac H.

description: Stopped by one morning to try a BREAKFAST BURRITO. The base is eggs, pico de gallo, potatoes and cheese. You can add chorizo, bacon, and/or veggies for an extra $0.50. I tried the bacon and they did not skimp on the meat! The bacon was perfectly fried and crispy. My friends enjoyed the spicy heat of the chorizo. Grab some spicy salsa cups to kick it up a notch!
author: Bonnie Z.

description: I've been here 3 times for lunch and it keeps getting better. Always a line but it goes by quick which is a good thing. Great service, staff is friendly and on it. Their green tomatillo salsa is the best, it goes well on all of their dishes. I like how they use Flap Meat for the meat tacos, it's my favorite cut.
author: Joseph B.

description:
The good:  the carnitas burrito was out of this world.  It was more than enough food but I was starving so I made short work of it.

The bad:  why would you hand us a happy hour menu at noon when it was not applicable?

Also the specials menu, starring tamales, was hung from the wall on a on a paper roll.  When I ordered the tamale, rather than apologizing for the confusion the woman taking my order responded, "That's only at dinner, then literally rolled her eyes.
author: Tony M.

description: Where to start? They have gorditas, handmade tortillas, and Tequila Ochoa. Need I say more??? Ok it is excellent, I'm an LA transplant who's been looking for a bomba taco spot FOREVER! Finally found it... Only complaint is it closes too early for post bar/club taco time.
author: Nicole C.

description: Tacos are delicious, service is crazy fast.  Great lunch spot, line moves quickly.  The fish tacos are the best in SOMA/FIDI.  Outdoor seating, just great overall.
author: Elise G.

description: I love this place.  When they close on the weekends I go through burrito DTs.
author: amy g.

description: Not bad, not bad. They charge you for EVERYTHING here so expect to spend more than $10 for lunch. It does get busy so I'd recommend coming during off lunch hours. I ordered 2 tacos - carnitas + carne asada with chips and guac and cantaloupe aguas frescas. Pretty good but I'm used to paying no more than $9 for the entire meal and here my friend and I paid nearly $30 for his meal and mine.
author: Jo L.

description: This place...don't go. They have the worst happy hour. For five dollars you can get three corn chips with what is basically a bean dip on it. Wow. Five dollars. There are other happy hour items as well. A masa tortilla with a smear of beans for five dollars! Yah, that sucks. There isn't any authenticity about this place from the same owners as Super Duper. The Margarita is from a mix, which they poured about 90% mix to 10% tequila. I mean, when Chili's has more authenticity then you may have a problem. You will never see me here again.
author: keith g.

description: Organized my birthday lunch here with 10 other friends and this place was amazing. Service was wonderful. My whole group enjoyed it. We ordered a mix of tacos and burritos. :)
author: Juan Z.

description:
YUMMY!!

Carnita tacos with hot sauce - delicious! 2 for less than $7 fills me up.

I've only ordered to go but they have lots of indoor & outdoor seating. Restaurant is spacious & clean.

Customer service is great.

Location is great.

Highly recommend getting extra hot sauce. It's amazing! They need to package this and sell it.
author: Jen J.

description:
Their breakfast burritos are dynamite! They aren't huge burrito sized which I personally think is a good thing. I don't need 8 pounds of chorizo, egg, potatoes and cheese in my belly at 8 in the morning. With that said, they are fantastic! They chorizo makes the burrito by far! It gives it a little kick that'll wake up and give you a solid start to the day.

However, I'm not a huge fan of their lunch or normal menu - the tacos in my opinion are just so-so. I always expect Mexican food to have more flavor, their tacos are pretty bland but what does a white irish dude know? I haven't tried the rest of the food so I can't speak to that but I've heard great things about their salads - I'll have to check that out next. 

The food is reasonably price, pretty cheap actually. In an area that I think lacks reasonably priced good food this place is great! Outside of the breakfast burrito, I'd rather branch out a bit farther and hit a better Mexican up. But like I said, the food is reasonably priced, the staff is always extremely friendly, it's in a prime location, their breakfast burrito is off the charts but their tacos are so-so.
author: Sean D.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos has a huge dining room that uses bare wood stabs as tables. It's a pretty hip looking kind of place. Quite different from your average looking taco joint. 

== Food ==

Tacos are are street style, which are palm size ones. There's a few different meats to choose from. The chicken is alright. It's wet so it makes the taco kind of squishy if it sits too long. The beef tastes really good. The pulled pork is pretty good. The fish is quite good.

The to go option comes with some beans and some sauce. The sauce aren't very hot. The tacos could definitely use some hot sauce.

== Service ==

Service is pretty quick for to go. It's in and out within 5-10 minutes.

== Overall ==

A bit pricey, but the yum factor is there. Not a place to go everyday for me, but once in a while.
author: Steven B.

description: Another day in the FiDi brings another day of having to forage for lunch.  New places tend to make noise fast, and when you've got legit owners opening up a Mexican place in the old Seller's spot, you've got yourself a potential hot spot.  I loved Seller's, mostly because there was always space to eat, and on a nice day, sitting al fresco was amazing for people watching.  During my morning perusal of Eater SF, I saw the brief mentioning of the opening of Uno Dos Tacos, and immediately sent it to my old co-worker (we used to work on 2nd/Mission). We met up around 11:45 and the line was already significant; how did everyone else hear about this so fast?! Anyway, I ended up ordering the Beef Asada plate with a side of guac and it was DELICIOUS. Pricey, sure, but a nice little upgrade from my typical Chipotle bowl. My friend had a pork taco and a fish taco, and at the end, admitted that he'll probably be hungry later.  Well duh. The corn tortillas was really what sold me on the place, and while my friend seemed to think that Tropisueno down the street might have the leg up, I sort of think this place might be good for an "every now and then" meal. I would definitely make another visit back here when I'm in the mood for a non-fast food experience.
author: Lisa I.

description: Spent about 20 minutes at work picking the beans out of my salad after I asked for no beans. It's a good salad and I like the carne asada but I'm more annoyed that I'm sitting here picking out beans. I came after 1pm to avoid the lunch rush so this wouldn't happen. Just be careful if you come here with a food allergy...
author: Kalli P.

description: This was the first place I ate in the city when I started working here a little over 2 months ago and I eat here almost everyday now. The carnitas burrito is so amazing! I get a chorizo breakfast burrito every morning and the cashier is super friendly. Not to mention, their house salsa is great and has a nice kick to it.
author: Stephan G.

description:
I wandered in a stupor toward Market, cringing away from the FiDi crowds and processed foods when someone invited me to this Mecca. I ordered three vegetarian tacos and managed not to devour them on the way to my office. 

The freshly-made corn tortillas were still perfectly crispy, the vegetables warm and the cheese cold, as I took that first bite. The tomatillo salsa and lime wedge only set off the tantalizing flavor that my little tray managed to contain. 

The fresh ingredients reminded me of my late night forays in LA. The tacos were filling and kept their shape even after my trek back to my desk. Eat up and keep this place in business so I can keep snacking away conveniently.
author: Bianca H.

description: Soggy fish tacos! Waited 10 mins for 2 tacos. I Noticed the chef took out some cooked fish out of a batch that looks like it's been sitting out for a while!. Kind of disappointing.
author: William U.

description: My 2nd time here. My husband is currently having his job interview at Yelp!  i came along with him and decided to stay here to eat and drink some margarita! Hopefully my early happy hour will be worth it when he comes back from his interview! Lol Uno Dos Tacos is one of the best in Fidi!
author: Em S.

description: Had an AMAZING experience here today. They treated me like a king. I was so upset because another restaurant (Raavi) totally flaked on delivering us food. They adapted to our needs and created a delicious spread. The guacamole and beef were standouts. it was very delicious. They were fun and great people! THANK YOU!
author: Andrew K.

description: Fish tacos are great. Highly recommend. The setting is pleasant too - very nice lunch spot.
author: Anne M.

description: I had pretty high hopes for Uno Dos Tacos but it didn't come close to what I wanted.  Maybe my expectations were too high? Anyway, I wanted a burrito/taco/bowl so ordered what I thought was just that.  I basically got some beans, meat, tortillas, and a little salsa.  It wasn't that much food and I was still hungry after. It was also pretty expensive considering the fact that I was still hungry. I think I'll stick to Chipotle for my not-so-authentic-but-delicious lunchtime Mexican fix.
author: Sarah H.

description: Cool new place! Lots of outdoor and communal seating. I got the carne asada plate-it came with 3 tortillas, plenty of beans, rice, and steak. I really enjoyed it all of it. My best friend got the carnitas plate and she also liked hers. Around $8 and they seemed to have a decent happy hour.
author: Salma R.

description: Shame. Nice place, great ambience, but rude workers. Did not get a single thank you or smile. All the male workers seemed like they were trying to be tough and didn't want to be there. Wish I didn't leave a tip. What a shame as this place has potential. Please brush up on customer service.
author: Daniel M.

description:
5 stars for customer service, 4 stars for food.

They have a really nice happy hour, their sangria is jalapeno infused so it's spicy and delicious. My roomie and I got the sangria and she choked on the spiciness of the jalapeno but the sweetest server (should have asked for her name) raced over to grab her water. Speaking of service, it is always on point and everyone seems just so happy to be there which makes me happy to be there! I also like that they have indoor and outdoor seating, perfect for a nice SF day when Karl the Fog isn't around. 

The food is pretty good too. I suggest the fish tacos and try the breakfast burrito in the morning (7am-11am). $4 for a burrito w/chorizo is a good morning deal in my book.
author: Jordan S.

description:
One week later, I decide to try their breakfast burrito with chorizo... amazing flavor and can finally see and taste the chorizo!
This business sincerely cares about their clientele.
Just hope things remain consistent.
author: Aaron C.

description: Tacos were delicious. Tongue was the best and Carnitas. Drip the sauce over the tongues and it just chewy and the meat just melts in your mouth. Thumbs up.
author: Eileen V.

description: I've been here a couple of times and can't say enough about their housemade tortillas.  I've gotten the tacos both times and gotten different one and they're really good.  It comes with a side of refried beans which is really good too.  I'd buy the tortillas alone but with the beef, chicken and fish in them it makes for a great meal.
author: Blake B.

description:
Eh. This was underwhelming at best. I got a veggie burrito, and it just did nothing for me-which is a rare thing. Even rarer is that despite being famished before coming here I didn't even finish said burrito. (Seriously, I love burritos, in a platonic and a romantic way-although I haven't consummated that love-yet)

Maybe it was because the veggie portion was about 60% black beans, causing the whole tortilla to be a leaky mess, and it drowned out the taste of everything else. I guess I've gotten spoiled and expected a little more.

It's a new place, so I'll probably try it again in the near future, and maybe things will be better. But maybe it was never meant to be.
author: Steve A.

description: Happy hour on a Friday in the fidi. Not as bad as I thought it would be for a Friday. Easily found a table and everything is affordable!
author: Vange C.

description: This is a great place to come with friends if you want a chill lunch/dinner. Compared to most places in FiDi it's pretty average price, 3 tacos for about $10 isn't bad. The sangria is pretty standard, I wouldn't buy one again.
author: Deandra S.

description:
Came here to check it out and ended up ordering a vegetarian salad rather than some tacos because they has roasted squash on the menu and it sounded yummy. The woman who took my order asked if I wanted cheese on it and I said "sure"...but when I got my receipt I realized that cheese was 50 cents extra. What? Full disclosure would have been nice. I'd still have paid for it, and I wouldn't have felt cheated.

Anyways. I took a minute to survey the place...clean, lots of seats, and they were advertising their HH a lot. "Maybe I'll come back for that" I though. It wasn't busy so my order also came up in less than 3 minutes. Nice!

Well, the salad was yummy, but it had no squash. Lame!!! The mushrooms and peppers were really tasty instead, but again...it would have been nice to know. Not everyone wants a mushroom salad.

Bottom line: the ambiance is fine, but it appears happy hour drinks are the priority rather than the food. I won't become a regular customer if they can't communicate the food right.
author: Katies F.

description: Asada salad every time. The grilled flank steak is seasoned perfectly. I keep saying I'm gonna try something else whenever I go in, but I feel like I'll be cheating on my steak salad if I do.
author: Madeline R.

description: Went here on happy hour and enjoyed it. Don't expect to get a seat if you go with more than two or three people. Great outdoor seating.
author: Mitch C.

description: Solid Mexican spot with the usual fare. Tasty taco and salad. Reasonably price for downtown ($3.5 to $4 per taco). I would return!
author: Tracy L.

description:
I gave it 4 stars because of its location. If you want Mexican food, go to the mission. If you're craving tacos and you're in the financial district, swing by and grab yourself some tacos. I ordered the Pescado, Lengua and the Carnitas. Not a huge fan of the Carnitas, it wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped and was a bit dry. The Pescado was amazing. That sauce they put in there is so good. I had to grab a fork to scoop every last dripping bit on to my last bite. The lengua was nothing special, but still better than most. 

I can't understand why they don't have salt at the table....lime and salt is the only way to eat tacos in my opinion. But the service is great and food comes in a hurry. I avoided the lunch rush though so I can't comment on that though. Overall a better place to grab lunch than the nearby alternatives.
author: Cody M.

description:
Maybe not the largest burritos/tacos, nor the most authentic, nor do they offer much in way of options, but they make up for all of that by having well made, good quality products from start to finish.

Their carnitas is tender, juicy and flavorful (as carnitas should be). Their other fillings taste great and synergize well.

And to top it off, they're cheap and once you order, incredibly fast.
author: Alan Y.

description:
Came here for HH after work since every place around us was PACKED for no apparent reason. Pleasantly surprised the food was good and there was room to actually sit down instead of standing at the bar. 

+++++
- food prices were good for HH
- the staff was exceptionally friendly and welcoming
- outside seating area was good ambiance

--------
- inside ambiance not great
- wish they had margaritas (it's Mexican for crying out loud)

Overall would come back here for a quick drink/HH but wouldn't go out of my way to try the place.
author: Jane B.

description:
So I started working downtown again and felt like a burrito. 

There's a Chiptole down the street. I refuse to eat at chipotle. Not a fan of the marinade they use for their meat. Not a flavor i find appealing. 

There's a couple mom and pop type mexican places around work, but I've been to them all. 

Figured I'd give Uno Dos a try. 

Service was not that great. I was handed my burrito....no bag, no chips, not even a napkin. Of which there was a stack next to the woman handling the orders. 

Overall the burrito was ok. The carnitas is pretty much flavor less. The salsa was good, seemed fresh. It was the only thing I could really taste. 


These guys are like the new Chevy's
Want a real burrito, go to the Mission.
author: Leo V.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos' name makes me so happy. Yay puns! Especially food-relevant puns. UDT is a conveniently-located, hipster Mexican joint in downtown SF. The outdoor seating is covered and has heat lamps, while the interior features exposed light bulbs and a long bar-stool communal table. Don't expect authentic Mexican food. The flavors are more akin to Chipotle, which is great in a different way.

I shared the happy hour plate of 6 tacos and chips & guac with a friend. It came out to about $12 a person, so we're not talking one-dollar-sign taqueria. The meats were just ok - we tried three types and some of them were on the dry side. The tacos do come with a generous portion of filling and three accompanying salsas. The chips were fresh, but the salsa/guac portions were too small for the size of the chip basket.

More for the ambience than anything, I think this is a good spot for catching up with friends or a casual coworker lunch/dinner.
author: Jessica F.

description: Since the issue that I had at the restaurant, the owner and the manager made a serious effort to resolve the matter and hosted all 15 again for HH.  We will definitely continue to come back given the service we received the last go around.
author: Maggie P.

description:
Location: Corner of 2nd and Market but the front door of the restaurant is off 2nd Street... helpful tip as 595 Market St is an office building

Food: I ordered the carne asada plate. Small portions. The plate includes meat, tortillas and tomatoes. It felt more like a taco platter that you need to assemble. They don't serve rice with any of their items. 

Next time I'll order the tacos or burritos.
author: CL S.

description: I am still not over the stale tortillas. Serious question, are they microwaved? The meat is very bland and the hot sauce was a let down. It's okay though, the service was alright and they have alcohol.
author: Anu C.

description: Great guac! Great carnita tacos! GREAT margaritas!!! I've been thinking about these tacos for a while! Great customer service!!!
author: Jessica C.

description: Hopping and popping place..but food is average and definitely great by city standards. Decent happy hour deals.
author: Howe L.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos is good. Not great. Not terrible.

The pescado tacos are the main attraction, in my opinion. They're quite tasty, featuring a crispy cod that's well dressed with chipotle sauce, avocado, and pico. I've also tried the carnitas, which were, unfortunately, equal parts bland and dry. Both tacos were pretty messy, which I blame on the wrapper. Their fresh corn tortillas are great but don't hold up well to how they're packed.

The outdoor seating at Uno Dos is pretty great on a nice day. Note that outside seating might be your only "dine-in" option, as the inside gets absolutely packed around the lunching hour.

It's a good lunch option in SoMa, but given the prices (moderate) and the high bar SF sets for Mexican, Uno Dos gets three stars.

Pro-tip for Uno Dos: make a burrito with your fried fish. The tacos just fall apart in your hands when you eat them.
author: Matt T.

description: Love this place for tacos and drinks after work! Not to mention the chips and dip are yummy too. The girls there are always nice and friendly. I wish they had tv's for sports.
author: Shirley C.

description: My wife and I tried this place and loves the fresh taste. The Guacamole and the fish tacos are exceptional! Carnitas are my close second favorite.
author: John A.

description:
Salsa without kick, guacamole without any spice, and meat that was a little mushy and bland. This place hasn't learned that it's okay to actually commit to a flavor. I'd head somewhere else for your taco impulses.

The homemade tortillas are actually pretty good, though.
author: David S.

description: Lunch is good, but their breakfast burritos are amazing! Perfect way to start the day.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Ordering is simple - you are given a chart of meats/proteins and serving styles. 

the food here is very high quality - although I was not as much of a fan of the serving size. typically during the FiDi lunch rush, the line is usually out the door, but goes reasonably quickly.

However, what takes this place from 3 stars to 4 stars for me is the service. While you wait in line you are given a menu. There is an outdoor seating area. If you are cold, they have mexican panchos to keep you warm. If you're lucky, while you are waiting in line you will get some finger foods which are delicious. You can order alcohol here. 

I think those things alone make this place a legitimate lunch and happy hour spot. Good food, great amenities :)
author: Aunik B.

description: If your craving a breakfast burrito the chorizo burrito is pretty decent. They are about a block down from work so after clocking in me and a couple of my coworkers take field trip down here. Haven't tried anything else but going back to the burrito, I wish they would add just a little more to it. It isn't too much bigger than a breakfast burrito from McDonalds.
author: JJ S.

description: If you're in the area, I recommend their fish tacos. The carne asada ones are good too, but not quite as yummy.
author: Doug V.

description:
tl;dr: this is apparently what many FiDi people think a taqueria should be like. That makes me sad.

Lousy carnitas, lacking in flavor, though the texture was decent. The black beans needed salt. Flavor was lacking throughout the experience (and I'm not just talking spice/heat). It was like something you'd get in an airport or a hospital. Certainly not going to offend anyone from an infant to a nonagenarian, but hardly good.

My burrito was smallish -- maybe good if you're on a diet, but certainly not what's expected in The City (and no,i'm not complaining about it not having rice). Perhaps I'm spoiled because I live near a few legitimately good taquerias, but I was very underwhelmed.

Two stars because the premises were clean, the service was fast, and someone came to check on us when we were sitting outside in mildly inclement weather. The staff certainly were on the ball. That being said, the food was mehtastic. Nice folks, but if this place was in the Mission it would be out of business in a week.

Then again, it's not in the Mission, and it's probably what Buffy and Chip (substitute your FiDi stereotypical names) want, so more power to them.

I won't be back. Ever.
author: Mark W.

description:
I only come here because it's a logistically solid lunch play for an office group. I know it's unfair to compare a Mexican place in downtown Financial District to the Mission or elsewhere, but it truly is over-priced and unremarkable. I neither had any complaints with the tacos nor any praise; the lack of salsa bar or variety beyond one unmemorable salsa takes takes away the opportunity for any redeeming experience for me.

I love lengua and appreciate that they have it here. The vegetarian burrito however was terrible, and I only ordered it because I took "squash" to mean butternut squash or some other potentially interesting green thing eaten raw (an etymological tidbit for you). Just call it f'ing zucchini if it's zucchini. Stomach didn't feel great for the rest of the day but it's hard to imagine getting food poisoning from a veggie dish...

Margarita pitchers are small but decently tasty. The cashiers are kind and the place is clean and spacious... really this has nothing to do with food and we're here for a food experience, right? Don't come here expecting much.
author: Eddie L.

description: This place is alright. As someone who grew up eating authentic Mexican food my whole life and eating out to some of the best sit down or taco trucks in most of California this place isn't special. It's not the worst, but it really doesn't stand out. It has a great location, and alcohol is on point, but that's about it. Salsa don't really have any flavor, portions are small, and prices are absurd. You cannot get orange & carrot juiced past breakfast (classic drink for Mexican people). People look at you funny when you ask for a salsa more flavourful. If you grew up not eating Mexican cuisine, I am sure you will like this place. If you are looking for legit Mexican food in the Financial District then we will have to keep looking because I have been looking high and low for a place near my work with no luck. But definitely give it a try to meet with me people and grab drinks.
author: Juan G.

description:
After eating a Tinga Burrito from here I have come to the conclusion that it is a feasible alternative to Chipotle around the corner. 

Tinga usually has a strange, more pronounced,  savory, smokey and spicy flavor. The chicken seamed like it was just brushed with the sauce. 

Also, I have to give tgem a plus for not serving rice on the burritos as that is not authentic. 

The ingredients were fresh!

From my experience besides the subtle Tinga flavor of the chicken my flour tortilla was cold. As an establishment that serves a busy FiDi they should serve food right the first time,  I ate it cold because I didn't have time to go back. 

Overall, whenever I feel like eating Mexican food I might contemplate going there again.

Only if my food would've been cold...
author: Carlos L.

description:
Uno Dos Tacos has tasty and reasonably priced food ESPECIALLY when you compare it to other lunch spots downtown. The salads are filling and easy on the wallet at $7.95 (i always get carne asada). 

Oh and don't get discouraged by their long lines - it moves very quickly and you'll have your food in no time. Lastly, their staff is consistently friendly and accommodating - this place is a BIG improvement from Sellers!
author: Vanessa Y.

description: Place was packed for HH. They have a later HH than most places. Service was pleasant and attentive. I had a burrito and some beer. This was the 2nd time that I've had their food. Food was tasty, but I ended up getting food poisoning that lasted a week. Not sure if I'd go back.
author: Ace V.

description: Could bulk up their burrito sizes, but overall ingredients were good. Salsas were on point, left feeling satiated.
author: Jason C.

description:
Seriously yummy carne plate. I was also very happy they have watermelon agua fresca, tho it was a little watered. I really don't care if their food is authentic or not. I've tried many places that claim to be authentic and didn't like the food.

As for price, seems reasonable to me since the nearby places are selling boxes of lettuce for $10. Sure you can go to Chipotle for fast food, but is it worth saving $2? I'd pay just to sit outside!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Food poisoning from this place! I got horribly sick after eating here. It was an awful evening I spent and will never forget or will never return to this crap place. I'm not sure I can even walk past it. I would recommend to everyone... You want to stay away!!
author: TJ U.

description: The second time I came here it was just ok. The fish taco isn't that good and the veggie taco was kinda soggy this time. :( So my 2 star review and 4 star review average to 3 stars, which I think is fair.
author: Victoria C.

description: Never disappointed when I come here. Fresh tortillas, salsa, juice, etc. Everything is made in house with love and it shows. Whether it's a breakfast burrito or a taco plate you won't be let down. The servers are always smiling and the patio space is unrivaled. Two thumbs up!
author: Mike O.

description: Good spot to eat Mexican when you can't get out of SoMa. We brought out interns here a few weeks ago, and they ate it up! Margaritas are tasty, so is the lengua.
author: Kid D.

description: I've come here for a breakfast burrito every moring since they started serving them. Without your burritos I don't know how I would make it through the day. Seriously, this stuff is brain food that I'd credit as partly responsible for everyone of my career achievements in the past year. However, you've got to change up your music selection. It's so bad. If I have to listen to Cumbia de la Cerveza one more time I'm going to lose my mind, a mind expanded by your eggy burrito concoctions. There is so much great Latin music out there (except Ranchero)! Why do you insist on playing the same shitty songs every day. I remember one day you guys played Santana and it was fantastic. Another day you played alternative Latin rock and that was good too. But every other day you play the same 10 songs on repeat. Please, for the lost of Santa Salsa con Huevos change it up!
author: Trevor C.

description: Food amazing and the margaritas great!! Recommended for the happy hour that last until 8 pm.
author: Giovanna C.

description: Fast, inexpensive and tasty. I like to stop in for the breakfast burritos in the morning.  Yum!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I was looking for a nice lunch at a new to location.  the environment is very once, but the food was below average. and with so many good places around, there is no reason to eat here.  they are; however, organized and very quick.  customer service added a star.  
my burrito will very blan and soggy. the chip and salsa were the same.   I could 't, actually, didn't want to finish my luck.  I would have preferred eating at Ricos or Chipotle.  I was so disappointed.
author: Glenn G.

description: This place is awesome ! The food is as good as almost being in Mex ! The yellow corn tortillas are great !! Sandy the bartender is amazing and very nice ! Always in a great mood very friendly !!
author: Daniel S.

description: Fish tacos are incredible!! Be sure to get chips and guacamole because the guacamole is to die for. We come here weekly and the staff is generous and friendly and the food has never been anything but incredible.
author: Dani T.

description: The Mexican food here is really outstanding. You will be surrounded by corporate people and that will affect the price to be a little bit over priced. But the tortillas there are worth it. Home made. Sooooo worth those $.50
author: Carolina A.

description: Came here for a quick snack, what a surprise, best tacos de lengua and drink was amazing, server was good
author: Phill B.

description: Delicious quick breakfast burritos for only $4 right next to the Montgomery Bart station
author: Hunt Q.

description: Stopped in with friends for a late afternoon meal. Service was excellent and very friendly. We were acknowledged quickly. We all ordered different tacos and all were delicious and very fresh tasting. The tortillas reminded me of my Aunt Jo's. Excellent!!!!! The owner Luis checked on our table and made us feel welcomed. Great meal, really good margaritas and very nice staff. Great day in the city!! Will definitely stop by again!!
author: Dawn S.

description: Giving it 1 * totally unacceptable. I took a breakfast burrito and specifically said many times that no eggs, no eggs I don't know what's difficult in that. I took burrito walked to office and bamm it has eggs. Very annoying. It wasn't even crowded.
author: Chetan C.

description: Great spot for TACO TUESDAY: delicious Guacamole and vegetarian tacos are pretty good. Plenty of social tables outside and inside, fast service. Sangrias are better than margaritas, though they add jalapenos to sangria, so it might be unexpectedly spicy.
author: Katie K.

description: Some of the best tacos I have ever eaten! You can taste the homemade quality in the tortilla and the meat is just- DELICIOUS! So juicy! I love the Mexican feel in the restaurant and I am definitely going to be coming back
author: Leslie F.

description: Love the Margaritas with the tart pink candy salt!  Food is good, could be more authentic, but the happy hour is fantastic.
author: Julie P.

description: I tried their chicken salad. Terrible. Soaked in water. Nothing much in the salad either. Boring. Very disappointed given their prices.
author: Vici P.

description: Only had a couple minutes to grab a margarita, ok, lets be real, that means two.  Tasted great, cant wait to try the food next time
author: Trevor H.

description: Please stop putting all the chorizo in the last half inch of the burrito.  Thanks.
author: Shogz N.

description: Best margarita I've had. The bartender was amazing - very personable and nice. This place has a cool concept going on. I would def. come back for the margaritas and taco bites when we are back in San Francisco.
author: J. C.

description:
3.5 stars if everything goes well.  for me, it didn't.  Food was good, seasoned ok but they forgot to add the salsa or hot sauce to my to-go box.  I wasn't about to make a return trip just to get it.  with the salsa the tacos probably would've been better.

Two big problems with the order.  First, I ordered one each of a fish, chicken, and pork taco.  On the receipt, it shows that I paid for a chicken, beef, and pork taco, each at $3.25.  Second problem: my order somehow got lost.  I waited a solid 10min before having to ask on my order status and it was obvious that none of the cooks could locate the order.  So, they hastily put it together and that was that.  Yes, I ordered at 12:30pm in the heat of the lunch rush, but missing an order is kind of a big thing.  But, I saved $1.25 on the fish taco so I guess that worked out.

Will probably return to see what the actual turnaround time is on orders, and whether it is worth replacing this for chipotle.
author: Garrett L.

description: The tacos are good. I've had the burrito once and didn't find it special. Descent place for happy hour. Average service. The drinks are ok.
author: Soso K.

description: We've been here for breakfast, lunch, dinner & happy hour now and still very impressed. Really tasty and fresh ingredients in great combinations served amazingly quickly, even when there's a rush. The staff are always super friendly and it's easy to manage an impromptu gathering. Amazingly affordable too!
author: John H.

description: Tried the Asada Burrito today.   No rice?     the salsa was very heavy with lime.  Normally that's a good thing, but buy the time I finished my lunch, the lime flavor was getting a bit too much.
author: Jerry P.

description: Stumbled on this place one morning and saw that they sell breakfast burritos! Pretty cheap, only $3.25 and +$0.50 for extras. They also offer cheap coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice in the morning! The burritos were a little on the small side compared to normal ones, but just enough to fill you up for breakfast! Aside from that, the restaurant is very well decorated, I love the bright colors and the abundance of seating. It was immaculately clean, but that may just be because I'm here in the morning. Service is quick and to the point. I'll definitely come back.
author: Carmela Y.

description: Lousy customer service for business catering. Both people that worked there were very rude and impatient to help with portions for my large company order. My company will not be be looking to them for catering in the future and I do not recommend having to go through that for anyone else.
author: Jen B.

description:
Great atmosphere with great food! Speedy and friendly service makes it great for a lunch or quick dinner spot and their new breakfast burritos are making it into a popular morning spot as well! 

PS highly recommend the carnitas!
author: Nick N.

description: Best Mexican food in downtown San Francisco hands down if you want something unique and truly traditional you should eat at uno dos. Good service friendly customer service good drinks. THE BEST.
author: Ulises S.

description: Came here after work before catching the bus. They have good happy hour specials for FIDI and the Tinga (chicken) put in a quesadilla that the cashier suggested was mouth watering fresh and again as leftovers. The house salsa is perfect as well.
author: Zoe M.

description: Absolutely great place. The food is delicious. Happy hour is the latest in that area that I have found. It is a little noisy and cramped but totally worth it for the food and sangria. Will be coming back.
author: Helen D.

description: I just had a Carne asada burrito and it hit the spot....I got mine to go but I will be taking my hubby and friends here soon because it has a casual but fun atmosphere. Happy hour is packed and I still got my food in excellent timing. Perfect place to go to if you're craving Mexican food and you're downtown and not in the Mission.
author: Chev B.

description: I love this place so much! I was really sad when it left Polk Street to 2nd Street, because it was just a five minute walk from my place, but now that I live in Downtown, it's only a 15 minute walk from my place. It's like we're meant to be together! I'm really happy that Uno Dos Tacos found a larger space. The food is quite simple, but it's good and that's all that matters. Small portions, but it's a place that people need to at least try.
author: Eric M.

description: This area has been dismal for Mexican lunch since Baja Fresh closed and Chipottle opened. I hate Chipottle. UDT is so much better than what's available in the area. The momandpops in the alley close by isn't so great and they upped their prices to match FiDi lunching...so may as well spend $9 on a burrito and get the quality that is UDT. Plus there is a tequila bar!!! So far I love the meats, chips and service.
author: L v.

description: The tinga burrito is actually pretty good. I like how the bean choices are both black: whole and refried. Must come back for a drink or five...
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great place for happy hour on a nice evening. Love being able to sit outdoors with a beer and snacks.
author: Melinda C.

description: The chicken tacos are ok, but they need to do a better job shredding the chicken and removing the gross inedible bits. There always seems to be a big chuck of cartilage in each taco. I hate having to discretely spit it out into my napkin without grossing out my dining companions. Yuck.
author: Jamon B.

description: Went there for a burrito for dinner to take out after work.  Speed to get through the line was OK, not super fast. Staff is courteous.  Great to have a full bar there though I didn't stay for a drink.  Burrito was tasty.
author: John I.

description: My wife and I went there on a Wednesday night, got there before the rush for the Happy Hour, we tried the gorditas, flautas, tostaditas, guacamole and chorizo quesadillas, everything was really tasty we even order two rounds of the gorditas and the flautas. We washed all of this down with a few drinks ( the cazuela, el vampiro house margarita, cereza negra but my favorite was the Mexican gimlet) awesome service, great happy hour atmosphere. We'll be back for sure.
author: Edson P.

description: Neat spot to grab some good tacos in a busy area of town.  The guac was great and we had a pleasant lunch outside on the picnic tables.
author: Bret M.

description: Went there for a quick bite before class. It's super cute and I liked the atmosphere. The menu was really easy to order from since there where only a hand full of choices. I got the veggie burrito and chips. The burrito was really good...just a lot smaller than I would have expected, I'm glad I got the chips to help fill me up. I don't know if I would go back since I could easily go to chipotle and get a bigger burrito for the same price. Over all not bad just small portions.
author: Nikki H.

description: Best guac! However, odd hours and margaritas are okay. Food is pretty decent. Worth the trip for the guac and chips though.
author: Megha B.

description: I had an excellent salad with chicken.  The outdoor seating is nice.  The prices are good.  Service was very considerate.  I will come back again!
author: Niniane W.

description: Beautiful, clean, and stocked with drinks. The Carnitas burrito is addicting. The lengua tacos are delicious. The habanero table salsa is great. The staff is attentive and kind. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating so bring friends!
author: Mike G.

description: I was skeptical about this place because its location and clientele but the food is legit and has a little bit of a gourmet meets fast food Mexican feel. It's busy at Lunchtime but plenty of room. I was able to bring my little nephew who's 2.5 years old and the strolls took some maneuvering. They don't have high chairs but bench seating out in the patio was awesome: didn't need a high chair. My food was delicious and the little one was feeling brave and he tried (and liked) chips and guacamole!?!? Music is awesome and the staff super nice! The only complaint is that my agua fresca was mostly just agua with sugar! No flavor!
author: Sirama B.

description: I'm so happy that the quality of the food did not change after they moved! I am still a little upset that they aren't down the street from where I live anymore, but they are within walking distance from my office, so I might be able to let it go. On to the food, the tacos are still delicious and I still think the fish taco is the best. You must try it if you come here. The other tacos are good too, but the fish taco blows them out of the water. The beans that come on the side are also really good.
author: Jessie L.

description: Awesome fish tacos and grilled veggie salad.  The chips, guac and salsa is all really good too.  Outdoor seating too!  Great lunch spot.
author: Jeff C.

description: Service is good but the food was salty and mediocre at best. The asada was mostly cartilage so I didn't even finish my burrito. I will stick to restaurants that use more quality ingredients.
author: Kentaro F.

description: Cheap and delicious breakfast burritos. It was very good and well worth the price. I highly recommend it.
author: Cesie A.

description: I grew up in Guanajuato, Mexico, so I'll be honest I rarely go out to eat Mexican food just because more often than not, I am disappointed. When my friend Luis suggested that we have dinner before the SF Giants game at a Mexican spot, I was hesitant but went ahead anyway. Upon arrival, I ordered a Carnitas burrito and was warned by the cashier that they didn't have any rice in their burritos; however, I didn't think much of it at the time. Once I started eating the burrito, it was amazing! It had perfectly cooked carnitas with just the right amount of beans, salsa fresca, crema, y guacamole. At least for me, it was just the right amount of protein, carbs, and fats I needed that didn't give me that afternoon slump, or those extra carbohydrates from the rice. Since I am a nutrition and gym freak, this is important to me. Honestly, best burrito I've had in the bay area. Not to mention, their tequila based drinks, like the Paloma, or their Margaritas that put me on a good one before the game ;)
author: Jennifer C.

description: I do not recommend the burrito here. If you are a San Franciscan you wouldn't even want them to sell these burritos within the city limits also as a native I don't like paying $2.00 for chips and salsa I'm glad I did because the burrito wasn't big enough by any means. Next time I'll try the tacos....
author: Walter H.

description: Ordered the Pescado and Asada tacos for lunch. Not really a fan of the pescado, the fried cod tasted soft and squishy (I usually prefer a more crunchy flavor). The asada taco however is quite flavorful and delicious. The pescado taco was $4.50, the asada was $4. Service was fast though, I ordered, got a water glass, went to fill it up with water, not even half way filled and my food was ready. Servings were quite small in my opinion, I left still a little hungry
author: Xin W.

description:
I grabbed a carne asada burrito today. It was good. It wasn't great and as another yelper mentioned, it really is a Chipotle alternative. You pick from the menu and do not have a lot of choices to customize your burrito. They only asked me if I wanted to add cheese. I didn't have a choice of beans like you have at other places. Maybe you do, but they do not tell you your choices at the order counter. My burrito came with meat that didn't have much flavor, pico de gallo, cheese, and black beans. You can add some roasted jalapeno salsa which has some good heat to it, and it definitely made up for the lack of flavor on the meat. I typically do not have them put salsa in my burrito because it can make it your experience a wet mess (soggy tortilla), and if you have ever tried to eat one and have salsa juice drip onto your dress shirt...... it's no bueno! I always put salsa on right before I take a bite. I asked for no salsa but instead asked for onions and cilantro. No can do because it only comes in the pica de gallo. 

My personal choice of ingredients for a basic burrito is carne asada, cheese, avocado slices, onions/cilantro, rice, refried beans or refried black beans. I can only get this at a few places that are consistently fresh and delicious (Taqueria Cancun #1, Pancho Villa #2, and El Farolito #3).


The Good:
Alternative to long burrito lines in the FIDI
Fresh ingredients
Tasty Salsa
Lots of tables available indoors and on the patio

The Bad:
Can't customize your burrito filling 

The Ugly:
Carne asada had no flavor. 

I would only come back to this place again to try their tacos which seem to be more popular.
author: David M.

description: It's around the corner from my office so its soo convenient for me to indulge in lengua tacos! Mmmm...must resist. Prices are ok but the tacos are pretty tasty! The happy hour specials are pretty good. I must come back for sangria happy hour for sure!
author: Christine W.

description: Stopped by after work for dinner and very glad I did. Ordered a fish taco, a vegetarian taco, and guacamole, and all three were delicious. Fresh tasting ingredients, and I like that you can watch the food being prepared. This might become a regular spot for me...always glad to find affordable tasty Mexican food.
author: Connor C.

description: Uno Dos is a fun and conveniently located place to grab a quick bite at lunch or a tasty breakfast burrito on the way to the office in the morning.  Their guacamole is delicious and they have a variety of menu options including fresh Happy Hour margaritas (and a full bar).  My complaint about this restaurant is the amount of fat that they leave on the meat.  I have tried the chicken quite a few times and the carnitas once.  I always end up picking large fatty pieces of meat out, which is very displeasing.  Today I had a carnitas burrito and there were at least 3 pieces that were inedible.  I wish they would take more care to remove the fat when cutting up the meat.
author: Kelley F.

description: Good, but not amazing.  Their dishes are tasty, but not exactly authentic.  It's kind of like fancy Chipotle tacos.  I do like that they have different menu items than just burritos and tacos, like their tamales.  The guacamole is pretty good, but not outstanding.  I've had a breakfast burrito that was also tasty and quick.  A nice casual and quick option in the financial district.
author: Michelle C.

description: Uno Dos Tacos is a great casual option for lunch or dinner in downtown SF for delicious traditional Mexican food. I always get tacos and love them every time - especially the pescado. The decor is beautiful, too. I like that it's a nice place to have a meal (with an outside area, too) that is also casual dining. Definitely a go-to in downtown SF.
author: Ariana V.

description: Went in there for a breakfast burrito to try out this new place. I got a chorizo burrito which was pretty tasty. Not going to lie I was kind of hesitant when I was reading reviews and saw that someone had part of a cleaning pad in their burrito. I would definitely say the food side everything tasted very fresh! The service side was very slow but I will let it slide because the place just opened. I will def go here again!
author: Kyle W.

description: Nice location in the FiDi with an outdoor patio area to drink and people watch during happy hour.  Small beer selection but they just got their full liquor license and will have hard liquor soon.  I haven't had the food other than guac and chips which went great with my Modelo.  If you get there between 4-6pm you'll have better luck sitting inside than outside.
author: Durty D.

description: I have been here a few times. It is just okay. Breakfast? Meh. There is something missing at this place that I cannot put my finger on. There is a definite chain restaurant taste and vibe that makes me think of Chipotle. I feel like it should be a little better than it is now. I can't say the food is bad. But, it isn't good. It's a very generic presentation of Mexican fast food. I am more likely to seek out a true Mom & Pop than eat here.
author: Gerald B.

description: Very good happy hour deals. Their burritos are ok and a bit on the small side, but come here for the tacos which are amazing! Also, this is a great place for al-fresco dining. The atmosphere is friendly and refreshing.
author: Marcus I.

description: Met the manger, great guy, had three tacos, great salsa, and very tasty. It was 12:30pm and they were super busy, that is why I walked in. The aromas of grill cooking right in front of you made me want to order one of everything. It was my first time here,but I'll be back. Love the chips to.
author: Remington C.

description: Visit this place at least once a week, and love it. Carnitas are really delish. Tinga is tasty. The breakfast burrito is also really good. Also the corn tortillas (handmade) are some of the best I've ever had. I don't plan on slowing down my visits anytime soon.
author: Isaias D.

description: Fresh, yummy Mexican fare at reasonable prices with great atmosphere and service! Great for a quick bite or to enjoy with friends. Plus they have blankets (so smart!!) for the outdoor section.
author: Sharon M.

description: Went here for Happy Hour and got the sangria.  It tasted so awful, we had to return it.  They didn't give us a hard time about returning it and tried to give us the difference in price, but we just gave it back to them in tip.  The food wasn't memorable, and I probably won't go back.
author: C L.

description: Fantastic food! Great prices and fresh taste. Will come back. I was in the area looking for good Mexican food and this place hit the spot
author: Ernesto M.

description: This place just opened & is already attracting huge crowds, which is a great sign of quality food. I tried it today, & the food certainly didn't disappoint. Even though the line might have looked rather long, I was impressed at how quickly they handled the crowd. Also, they had very friendly folks handing out samples of their food while you waited in line, which was a great idea! The food was awesome & fresh, & you can easily be in and out in less than 30 minutes, very fast service. The manager came by to check & one of the chefs even noticed the salsa dispenser was low, and came up to me to provide a new one. A great customer service experience & delicious food. I will surely be back!
author: Aaron L.

description: I had the chicken burrito, it is ok. I guess there is no other choice so people come here.
author: Shin T.

description: Love the fish tacos but should have stayed on Polk st. - no cocktails and not as many food options. Come back to Polk!
author: Veronica S.

description: Breakfast burritos are also a great quick-fix option for the morning. The line can get long though. Try adding guac!
author: Michelle C.

description: You won't find a better deal in central San Francisco, IMHO. I had the veggie taco, which was super-filling, and they give you tiny side of beans with it. Between that and the handmade corn tortilla, and the roomy space, with communal tables, this unpretentious and uncomplicated place is a keeper. The have a huge outdoor patio as well. I'll be back.
author: Dave S.

description: Work across the street and stopped in at 4pm for one taco. 5 workers, 6 customers. 1 cashier. Waited 5 ... 10 ... 10 ... 15 minutes... No taco! Let them know I had to leave. No refund. No apology. No one cared. Just a big waste of time. Will not be back. Ever.
author: Johor A.

description: The food is delicious and the employees are very friendly. I am definitely returning to Uno Dos Tacos!
author: Vanessa R.

description: Great fish tacos. I would 100% go back! Quick and easy to meet up with a girlfriend for lunch between our two offices.
author: Sarah O.

description: This place opened today 5/21/14.  Even on their first day they were cranking through tons of people.  I was shocked at noon during the lunch rush my carne asada burrito came out in like 2-3 minutes.  Went great with a Pacifico as they serve beer. The salsa is a smokey tomatillo flavor and is already pre-packed in medium plastic containers. Grab a few for the road or your table!  Now we look to see if UnoDos  stands the test of time... So far so good.  The same owners have Super Duper, Berreta, etc.  So they aren't first timers.
author: Brian T.

description: Super friendly staff, quick lunch turnaround, the happy hour items exceeded all expectations, and they're soon to add breakfast to the menu and get their liquor license... so glad this place exists and is just half a block from my office.
author: Travis J.

description: Amazing place for real mexican food, being mexican I know how hard is to fine some great Mexican and this place hits the spot.  i went yesterday and was sad to know that they ran out of carnitas, so I order the chicken tacos, they were really tasty, but the best part of it was when the owner came to my table to offerme 2 carnitas tacos that he just got from the big carnitas pot. I'm so happy I work on this area. love the place.
author: Lorena F.

description: Their breakfast burritos are awesome and very well priced at only $3.50. I add the chorizo as I like a little spice in the morning.
author: Bill D.

description: So far so good!   I had the veggie plate, and it tasted fresh enough and almost too healthy.   My coworkers, who aren't Mexican food fans,  tried the beef and chicken tacos and liked them.
author: Ellie Y.

description: Switchover was OK. They tried to charge us twice, pulling us out to tell us we didn't pay. It was a bad experience but the food was good.
author: Roy H.

description: Food is very good, but they make ordering a burrito a hassle. They don't list the ingredients on the menu. Also, get it to go - music isn't great.
author: Ricardo B.

description: Thus place is very good. Everything is fresh and tastes like a piece of the Mission. They have Lengua!
author: Erran A.

description: Got food poisoning from eating here yesterday.  The food tasted fine at the time but i believe the salsa had issues.
author: George H.

description: Finally! They have the Fidi location opened up! It's the same menu as their other location on Polk and just as good! This venue is awesome, staff and service is fast and efficient. I definitely recommend this to those who are looking for a quick lunch, but don't be discouraged by the line because it always moves fast! Try the Lengua!!
author: annie w.

description: Yummy tacos, tried them all.  I love that they have blankets for those who want to sit outside.  They are really fast in providing service and have a simple menu.  I would go back for sure...and I am picky about where I get my tacos!
author: Vanessa H.

description: Good, solid mexican food by Montgomery BART. The guac is good, if a touch acidic, and the tacos were all decent.
author: Bill P.

description: I was stupid enough to try this place again, burrito at 830pm.  Lukewarm at best.  Food not hot.  Stay away, place is awful
author: Rey D.

description: Not a great option for vegetarians. No guacamole? Just a bunch of veggies in a tortilla with black beans. :(
author: Lisa H.

description: I came to Uno Dos Tacos for its happy hour after seeing it on Thrillist's list of the best new happy hours in San Francisco. When I walked towards the restaurant, it had loud music playing with lots of people sitting in the front patio area after work chatting over a drink or beer. The environment was relaxing and chill, which was a great plus. After walking in, I saw how even more crowded it was and was so thankful my friend arrived early to get a table. When I got up to order my food and drink, I was slightly confused by the happy hour menu because the four items had no explanation, which was confusing for someone who comes here for the first time. Nonetheless, I asked what the items were and ended up ordering flautas, which were chicken wrapped into flute-like tubes, drizzled with salsa and sauce, and topped with other veggies. When the flautas were ready, I quickly realized that was not enough food, so I ordered two pork tacos. Both dishes tasted good but were not uniquely or overly amazing, so I am happy that I tried the food here, but I probably will not come back often.
author: Annie C.

description: The burrito I got was basically just meat and black beans with a dash of salsa. The black beans had not been strained, so by the time I finished there was a pool of bean juice on my plate and my hands were completely black. I expected better from a place with a line out the door.
author: Ben E.

description:
Went here on 9/6 and am hooked! We split 2 chicken tacos and a chicken burrito with guac. I love no rice in the burrito. The tacos came with black beans that were good as well. 
We left with happy bellys. Only complaint is we wanted to go back on Sunday before our journey home and the website said closed. So we went elsewhere. Then walked by and it was open. Yes we debated to eat again! haha. But we did not and left sad.
author: Andrea C.

description: Food is ok. Very commercial, reminds me of Chipotle. Portions are small and no free chips & salsa. Not sure I'll be back.
author: Mrs. C.

description:
Was just there before work and purchased a breakfast burrito with chorizo. Get up to the office and there is no Chorizo in my burrito. :( Can't come all the way back down to get a new one made so I ate it. Will come back another morning and ask for one as I paid extra for the chorizo. 

The burrito was still good so that's why I'm giving Uno Dos a 3. This is my second time coming there. First time I was happy. I'm hoping they will make good on their mistake.
author: Jason L.
