description: This place has chips and salsa and cheese, refuses to make any nachos. How many words do I have to post, until this tip becomes a review?
author: MIcah S.

description: I was excited to return to this place after they relocated from Polk. It was disappointing to find that they completely shifted from a sit down restaurant to a fast-service lunch spot. They sacrificed quality for efficiency reduced the menu to tacos, burritos, and salads. The food was okay, nothing special. I definitely preferred the old business model!
author: Erin S.

description: Uno Dos Tacos is Uno Dos DELICIOUS!!!! I have been wanting to try this place out since it opened!! So, I finally decided that on my 40th birthday I wanted to get lunch there with my girlfriends and finally see what this place had in store for us!  We had been walking around the city so we were quite parched, so we started with a pitcher of Margaritas!!  Complete with chili salted rims on our glasses.  Yummmmm!  Next up, Luis Flores recommended that we get the guacamole and chips!!  The tortilla chips were so fresh and the guacamole was soon good that we ordered another bowl!  Their salsas are also really tasty!! For our tacos, we ordered Vegetariano, Chicken, Asada, Carnitas, and Pescado tacos that came with salsas and beans!!  The tacos are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!  I personally had three they were that good!!!  And what really made the tacos so incredibly tasty was the handmade corn tortillas that they made fresh right on the spot!  The fresh tortillas were so tender and delicious!! Luis Flores, as well as the rest of the staff were so gracious to us! They went out of there way to make us feel so welcome! And for dessert we had churros to take with us for on our train ride home!  I definitely recommend this place!!  Great ambiance, friendly amazing staff, and scrumptious food!!! I give it 5 stars all the way!!
author: Kirsten G.

description: Tacos here were okay, have had better. But they were fresh and the flavor was great! I had heard they have a great happy hour so I dropped by. I have to say I wasn't disappointed. I will be dropping back by again soon!
author: David P.

description: I keep coming back to this place every time i'm in the city. I had the chicken salad and it was muy buena. i had one of their sangria and i was very happy to see them making them fresh. i will be back.
author: Luz S.

description:
Brand new, not quite ready for prime time.

New look and nice amenities. 

Food service is a little weak. I can only order taco, burritos, bowl or plate with a choice of meat. 

I ordered the plate, with some dietary changes, (no tortillas, extra veggies) they served the bowl. Granted they aren't much different but still. They tried very hard to fix and gave me the plate right away but now no dietary customizations. It's ok, but a little frustrating. 

Food was ok, very simple with not a lot of choices, looks like they only do street tacos well. Probably won't come back, there are better choices in the FiDi.
author: Josh C.

description: Not bad for quick tacos. Unlike some places the stuffing is mostly the meat. Three should be enough so you don't have food coma at work. Not the best but for the price in SF it is decent.
author: Tri N.

description: Pleasantly surprised. Better than Chipotle's burritos. Lots of flavour and good portion size. Eat at the patio if you can. Inside is dark too crazy. Will be going back.
author: Ana C.

description: Hit and miss, quite pricey.  The best parts are the breakfast burrito and the guacamole.  The worst parts are that I occasionally get more fat than meat in my burritos--kinda insane levels of pure fat.
author: Brett C.

description: For the price and convenience, Uno Dos scores a 4. Although the tacos were a bit overpriced, I was reminded of the tacos I used to eat back at home. Obviously, not as delicious, but it's always nice when eating food makes me nostalgic.
author: Christopher G.

description: Might as well go to Chipotle up the road. They didn't have a Super Burrito option, but instead will charge an extra $1.50 for the fixins to make it happen. They also charge for the chips. Ridiculous. The tinga was OK, but honestly there were just too many red flags for my taste. Also the guac wasn't fresh. It was clearly way loaded up with Lime, and still starting to go dark. Service at least was friendly and acceptable.
author: Nik K.

description: I like their fresh tortillas and fish tacos.   However, the portions are sooo small! Even with 2 tacos I'm not very full.  I had to rate them low due to the fact that they do not have generous portions.   For the price they charge for a taco, they should at  least provide you with free chips and salsa.
author: JD A.

description: Came here for lunch and tried several of the tacos: Chicken, Beef, Carnitas, and Fish.  Of the four tacos I liked the beef one the most and then the fish taco.  The fish taco wasn't as crunchy as I had hoped but still had good texture.  They had a sweet salsa and a habanero sauce (was on all the tables) to add onto your tacos.  I was a little hesitant at first to try the habanero sauce, but after my bf tried it (he has a high tolerance for hot stuff), he said it wasn't hot, it turned out to be slightly hot to me, not enough to make you ask for water.  I also tried the aguas frescas - watermelon, lime and mint.  The drink was refreshing, slightly sweet and not overly sweet.  Plenty of seating inside and outside of the restaurant and walking distance from the 5th and Mission parking garage.  Because this restaurant is in the financial district I expect them to be very busy during the lunch work week.  I would definitely come back.
author: Joycelyn L.

description: I'm a big fan of the family of restaurants related to Uno Dos Tacos (Lolinda, Pesce, Super Duper) so I was pretty excited to try this place. We came in on a Saturday and ordered 2 fish tacos, 1 carnitas, 1 tinga, 1 carne asada, and a side of chips and salsa. Unfortunately, the only taco I liked was the carnitas and basically left the tinga and carne asada taco half-eaten. The tinga was flavorless and the carne asada was so dry it was almost like jerky (or day old taco meat). The fish tacos were ok, but they were a little greasy. The chips were good, but the fresh salsa had a lot of pepper in it and overwhelmed the salsa. My husband and I can usually power through "ok to not-great" tasting food and are pretty forgiving when we go out to eat, but the food here was just not good.
author: Trinh N.

description: Had the carnitas burrito. Meat was tasty, it was the slow cooked but not fried kind of carnitas. I heard they make their own tortillas.
author: Chris C.

description: This is the best place to enjoy your favorite type of taco. I had a great experience and I'm tempted to have lunch here every day.
author: Delroy H.

description:
this review is mainly for their homemade corn tortillas. i really like homemade anything, esp tortillas.  i tried chicken, asada n carnitas tacos n asada plate.  chicken n carnitas is meh, asada is good.  nice to have this place around the corner from work to satisfy the mex crave.

i think tacos should be $3 a pop for size and how filling they are.  that way you can buy 3 n be under the $10 mark
author: Michael R.

description: Came through around 6ish with my girlfriends. It was a Saturday evening and the place was empty. Happy Hour prices are decent and the portions are on the small side but the taste of the food we ordered was fresh and delicious. No one in my party ordered off of the main menu so I can't speak to those portions, but in the end, this place really hit the spot. The restaurant is clean. The decor is simple but colorful and they've got yummy sangria and beer choices. Will be back :)
author: gabriela o.

description: Unless you're going for happy hour don't waste your time.  It is extremely over priced, as to be expected for where its located.  They have a pretty limited menu imo, and they don't have much of an authentic flavor.  The guy working the register told me they have the best lengua he has ever had, I feel bad for him.  Avoid the lengua it was not good.  They have limited salsa as well, this place is just lacking.  The staff is friendly, just the quality for the price is not worth it.  Walk down the street and go to la caramba, cheaper and a bigger menu.  Great idea with their location, just don't exactly execute as well as I think they could.  Now that I don't work there I don't think I'd ever return.
author: Tavis I.

description: Don't fall for the long queue outside ... It's just that the it starts from the entrance . Just normal food with fast service
author: Vijay R.

description: Worst burrito I've ever eaten. Way over priced. And they don't have rice. What kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't have rice? I'm never going back.
author: Jay B.

description: Fish tacos were decent.  Carne Asada tacos were meh.  Overall I had the impression that everything was nice and fresh, but in the end.. it was just a little too bland.
author: Raymond M.

description: I tried the carnitas burrito it was tasty and flavorfull , I will recommened this place to my friends.
author: Jose C.

description: First time here. Ordered Asada burrito. I don't think they believe in seasoning, let alone basic salt. Carne Asada meat and black beans were totally flavorless.  Absolutely no taste. Very disappointed.
author: Warren M.
